loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 59 years old and widowed with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Paulina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP (Philippine pesos) 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like sugar, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, chips, etc. 

Paulina has been in this business for 35 years.

In the future, Paulina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like sugar, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, chips, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family, and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and other fishing materials for her business. Erlinda has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and other fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Emerlinda

texts.en:
Emerlinda is 21 years old and has two children, who are in school.

Emerlinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emerlinda has been raising pigs for a year now, and she has borrowed in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emerlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Venny

texts.en:
Venny is a fifty-year-old woman who lives in the town of Kalisizo in the central region of Uganda.  She looks after five orphans, whom she says lost their parents, and being a sister to the deceased she took on the responsibility.  She has been able to sustain the family with the funding from UGAFODE.

She operates a seasonal produce store in the town to earn a living, and through the funding from UGAFODE she has managed to push the children to higher levels of education. 

With the loan she has applied for, she hopes to buy seasonal coffee for trade and renovate her rentals in the same town so she has a monthly income.
She faces the problem of lack of enough capital since her business is seasonal, and she needs to have enough cash on hand all the time.

In the future she hopes to relocate to the village and buy a larger piece of land to practice commercial agriculture as she gets older.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es:
Ana de 37 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, uno de 10 años de edad y estudia cuarto grado y el otro de 13 años de edad que estudia en séptimo grado. Ana se separo de su esposo y con ella viven solamente sus dos hijos.

Es agricultora, pero hoy en día su fuerte es la fabricación de piñatas, aprendió en un taller impartido por la alcaldía del municipio donde vive ya tiene su propio negocio y para llegar a él viaja 20 minutos en autobús.
En su casa, Ana tiene una granja de peces(Tilapia) tiene seis mese dedicándose a este tipo de producción en la que le ayudan sus hijos y de esta manera contribuyen con los ingresos de la familia.


El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de piñatas, papel, almidón para el pegamento y alambre para el esqueleto de la piñata, también necesita comprar papel de periódicos. Otra parte será utilizado para sembrar 7,000 mts. Cuadrados de Maíz, por lo que comprara fertilizantes, herbicidas, plaguicidas y pagara mano de obra. También comprara alimento concentrado para la granja de peces.

Con el tiempo, Ana espera mejorar sus ingresos y comprar un par de terneras para producir leche y vender sus derivados
texts.en:
Ana, 37, is mother of two children.  One is 10-years-old and in fourth grade and the other one is 13-years-old and in 7th grade.  Ana separated from her husband so only her two children live with her.

She works in agriculture but her main job now is manufacturing piñatas.  She learned how in a government-sponsored course given by her city and she has her own business now that she gets to by taking a 20-minute bus ride.

At home, Ana has a tilapia (fish) farm.  She’s been working at this for six months and her children help he thus contributing to family income.

The loan will be used to buy supplies like paper, flour for the paste and wire for the piñata framework to make piñatas.  Another part of it will be used to buy fertilizer, herbicide and pesticide and to pay labor costs to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.  She will also buy concentrated feed for the fish farm.

In time, Ana hopes to improve her income and to buy a pair of heifers to start producing milk and to sell its derivatives.

loans.use: to buy piñata-making supplies, agricultural supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Doris Yohanna

texts.es: Doris es una joven de 24 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo de 2 años. Desde hace 7 años inició su propio salón de belleza, idea que surgió como una opción para generar ingresos por cuenta propia. Se capacitó en una escuela técnica, donde aprendió gran parte de lo que hoy sabe. Trabaja de Lunes a Sábado de 10 am a 7 pm, normalmente trabaja sola, pero los viernes y sábados recibe el apoyo de un empleado debido a la cantidad de clientes que le solicitan el servicio. La cliente se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, perseverante y dedicada a su labor, lucha incansablemente para poder progresar y darle lo mejor a su hijo. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en insumos al por mayor (tintes, químicos, tratamientos capilares, entre otros) y para pagar una capacitación técnica sobre peinados, esto le da la oportunidad ampliar su portafolio de servicios y podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes utilizando productos de mejor calidad, abriéndose puertas para atraer más clientes potenciales y así mejorar los ingresos generados por sus ventas. Doris sueña con hacer de su actividad, un negocio rentable y próspero, que le permita generar más recursos económicos con los que pueda adquirir su casa propia y un local donde pueda continuar ofreciendo sus servicios, así podrá tener mejor estabilidad y ofrecer a su hijo un mejor bienestar, educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doris, 24, is a young single woman with a 2-year-old son.  She opened her own beauty salon 7 years ago, an idea that arose as a way to generate income on her own.  She trained at a technical school learning much of what she knows today.  She works Monday to Saturday from 10am to 7pm.  She usually works alone but on Fridays and Saturdays she hires an employee because of the large number of customers that need tending to.

She’s noted for being enterprising, persevering and dedicated to her work.  She strives tirelessly to be able to progress and give her son the best.  She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies at wholesale (dyes, chemicals, hair treatment, etc.) and to pay for a hair-styling technique course which will give her the opportunity of expanding her service portfolio and to meet customer needs using higher quality products thus opening the door to attracting more potential customers and improving income generated from sales.

Doris dreams with her activity becoming a prosperous, profitable business that will allow her to generate higher income to buy a house of her own and a locale wherein she can continue to offer her services thus attaining better stability and offering her son improved well-being, education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Taimoe

texts.en: Taimoe is a 43-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small auto shop business. She has been with this business for five years. Taimoe needs a loan to buy tools, heavy duty machines, and car paint. She will use her profits to renovate her house. Taimoe joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy tools, heavy duty machines, and car paint

loans.name: San Group

texts.en:
San is 38 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Svay Reang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 each day to help cover the family’s expenses. 

Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $8 per day. This is the first loan for San’s group with KREDIT. The man who is in the picture is Mab's (the member in San's group) husband. 

San is now leading her group to request a loan. As a leader, she is going to purchase a water filter to use for her family. This purchase will help her improve her family’s health, preventing diarrhea and other diseases contained in the unclean water. 

In the future, she would like to run a general store at home and help her youngest child earn higher education. Moreover, she hopes she can build a new house soon.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter to use for her family to prevent diseases contained in the unclean water.

loans.name: Hat Group

texts.en:
Hat is 46 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Svay Reang Province, Cambodia. She has been breeding pigs for more than ten years, earning approximately $15 daily. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $4 per day. 

This is the second loan for Hat’s group with KREDIT. She is now leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to purchase a water filter to use for her family. This purchase will help her improve her family’s health, preventing diarrhea and other diseases that result from unclean water. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn higher educations. Moreover, she wants to improve her house’s condition and make it bigger.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter for her family's use.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, de 64 años de edad, está divorciada del padre de sus 2 hijas de 24 y de 22 años de edad y su nieto. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. Antonia se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas, para lo cual cuenta con una refrigeradora en su propia casa, en donde puede guardar su producto a la temperatura que le agrada a su público consumidor, quienes compran para llevar a tomar en otros lugares. Dedicándose a dicha actividad hace más de 03 años,  y contando con la ayuda de su hija en la venta del producto a los clientes.
Decidió empezar esta actividad económica para solventar los gastos de su hogar por el abandono de su pareja. Comenta que en ésta actividad no se pierde por ser un producto de bastante consumo, en toda actividad social siempre tiene demanda, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles comprará bebidas gasificadas de diferentes sabores y marcas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 64-year old woman who is divorced and has two daughters, aged 24 and 22, and a grandson. They all live comfortably in their own house. Antonia sells soft drinks and has a fridge in her house. This way she can keep the products at the temperature desired by the consumers, who buy the drinks to take away. She has been working on this activity for over three years and counts on the help of her daughter to sell the products to clients. 

She decided to start this activity to cover her household expenses once her partner left them. This activity does not generate losses as the product she sells is highly consumed and always has demand. This is why she has plans to grow her business. 

This is her forth loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the support received to get ahead. She commits to repay as scheduled and plans to use the 1,200 nuevos soles to buy soft drinks in different flavors and brands in bulk.

loans.use: to buy drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Agaalofa

texts.en: Agaalofa is 23 years old with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling handicrafts in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy Pandanus leaves, woolen clews, threads and materials. In the future, Agaalofa hopes to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy Pandanus leaves, woolen clews, threads and materials.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Chek is 53 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and breeding pigs for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $16 each day. 

To improve her family’s livelihood, Chek is requesting a loan of $1400 to purchase pigs and fodder for raising them. This purchase will help her expand the business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her youngest child earn a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and fodder for raising them

loans.name: Faasalu

texts.en:
Faasalu is 32 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business of making and selling pork buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a pot, bags of flour, soy sauce, onions and dripping oil. 

In the future, Faasalu hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a pot, bags of flour, soy sauce, onions and dripping oil.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
This is Margarita. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Margarita dreams to have a bigger store and hopes for good health for her whole family.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Idigul

texts.ru: Идигул работает продавщицей в продуктовом магазине города Вахдат. Ей 45 лет. Она милая и отзывчивая женщина. У нее есть муж и трое детей школьного возраста. Идигул в своем магазине продает пищевые, булочные, кондитерские изделия и дополнительно хозяйственные товары. В такой сфере деятельности она работает более 10 лет.  Она нигде не училась и никто не учил ее работать. Идигул просто открыла свою прилавку и начала работать и так она работает уже 10 лет.  Она любит свою работу и большую часть времени проводит там.  На сегодняшний день запасы ее продуктов почти истощены и все продукты, которые имеются стоят на прилавке. Она просит кредит, чтобы приобрести ассортимент свежих продуктов питания для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Idigul works as a salesperson at a grocery store in the town of Vahdad. She is 45 years old. She is a pleasant and thoughtful person. She is married and has three school-age children. Indigul sells food items, baked goods, sweets, and, additionally household wares in her store. She has been in this line of business over 10 years. She has not studies and no one taught her this trade. She simply opened her own store and started working, and has been doing so for 10 years already. She enjoys her work and spends most of her time working. At present her merchandise stock is almost depleted; all that remains are the goods displayed at the counter. She is requesting a loan in order to stock up on fresh groceries and increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to stock up on fresh groceries and increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Edelita is 52 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 13 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she earns additional income from raising cattle. Edelita has borrowed and repaid 21 previous loans from NWTF.

Edelita is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as candies, coffee, cream, biscuits, canned goods, and other products to sell in her general store. In the future, she aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase candies, coffee, cream, biscuits, and canned goods

loans.name: Chanyhol

texts.en:
Chanyhol is 51 years old and married. She lives in a village in the Kandal Stoeng district with her husband and five children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

She is a garment worker and supplements the family income through growing rice, while her husband has helped her in farming rice in the local area. 

Having been in this business for 9 years, they can earn about 36,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Chanyhol is a seventh loan cycle borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She successfully used the past loans to better support her family. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy a motorbike for her family. She hopes to have a decent motorbike for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for using by her family.

loans.name: Watfa

texts.en:
Watfa was born in 1989. She lives in a sector of Jordan called Dairalla with her family, which consists of nine siblings and her parents. 

Watfa has been selling foodstuffs at her house for one year. She is still a beginner at her business and she is planning to expand it by opening her own mini-market. 

To do so, she needs to earn a better income, which she can get by raising her sales, which she can do by buying more foodstuffs to trade, such as biscuits and chips. But, she doesn't have enough money to buy these foodstuffs. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to merchandise her mini-market with foodstuffs.

loans.name: Gilmer Edgardo

texts.es:
Gilmer es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en una comunidad llamada La Otra Banda, la cual está ubicada en el norte del Perú a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo. La zona es una comunidad de pequeños agricultores, con clima agradable y con los principales servicios básicos.

Gilmer trabaja en diversas actividades eventuales, generalmente como trabajador en campos de cultivos aledaños. Además posee animales menores como aves de corral y cuyes, los que cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y que, una vez engordados, comercializa entre sus vecinos y negociantes de la zona, los cuales le brindan una demanda permanente. Con estos ingresos el mantiene a su familia y trata de sacarlos adelante.

Gilmer desea comprar más animales para engordarlos y venderlos, de ese modo podrá obtener mayores ingresos con los cuales seguirá manteniendo a los suyos, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con el que espera realizar su objetivo.
texts.en:
Gilmer is a 39-year old man who lives with his wife and children in a community called La Otra Banda, located in the north of Perú, one hour away from the city of Chiclayo. This is an area of small farmers and has a nice weather and the main basic services. 

Gilmer works in several activities, normally as a farmer in cultivated lands nearby. He also owns small animals, such as pen birds and guinea pigs, which he breeds in the rear side of his house and sells to neighbors and dealers, having a stable demand. Thanks to this income he can support his family and get ahead. 

Gilmer wants to buy more animals for sale. This way he will earn more and continue to support his family. With this goal in mind, he has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to buy pen animals for breeding and sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a sprayer, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ma. Lilibeth

texts.en: Ma. Lilibeth is 38 years old from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and has six children ages 6 months to 14 years old. Ma. Lilibeth has farmed rice for 10 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy pesticides, fertilizer and pay for labor. She dreamed of making her business successful so she can provide her children a good education. The loan will provide hope in her planned business expansion and sustainability.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Ndabaw

texts.fr:
Madame NDABAW  âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère 4 enfants a commencé à faire du commerce il y a de cela 10 ans maintenant. Avec l’appui  de son époux, elle a pu avoir un fond pour démarrer. Dès fois c’est elle qui part pour acheter la marchandise, dès fois elle commissionne son frère. Elle est à sa 2ème expérience de crédit avec l’IMCEC  et demande un montant de 250.000FCFA avec lesquels elle va acheter des sceaux de pate d’arachide, des  bidons de 20 litres  d’huile d’arachide fabriqué à l’artisanal.
Elle n’a aucunes charges et les bénéfices sont reversés dans l’activité. A l’avenir elle souhaite augmenter son fonds de roulement et diversifier ses produits.
texts.en:
Ndabaw is 42 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She began her business over 10 years ago. With the support of her husband, she was able to begin the business with enough capital. Sometimes Ndabaw herself goes and purchases the merchandise; other times she enlists her brother. 

Ndabaw is on her second loan cycle with IMCEC and is requesting a loan i nthe amount of 250,000 francs CFA with which she will buy peanut paste and 20L containers of peanut oil made artisinally. She has no one in her care and all profits are reinvested in her business. In the future she hopes to increase her turnover and to diversify her products.

loans.use: to purchase peanut paste and oil for resale

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is very thankful for the financial assistance that has been given to her. She was able to buy more products for her business. Her income from business was used on their household expenditures. She believes that hard work will lead to a successful life, and that's why she keeps on working. She would like to apply for another loan, for 20,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy various products, including newspapers, cigarettes and beverages. Her profits from this business will definitely help her cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Soledad dreams that her business will flourish and expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for various products to sell in her business, including  newspapers, cigarettes and beverages.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 48 years old. She is married and blessed with five children. She lives in Siloy Calamba, Misamis Occidental, and has been engaged in snack vending such as homemade bread and juice. She has been in this business for more than five years now, earning a monthly income of 3,200 Philippines pesos.

Herminia requested a new loan for additional capital for her business to buy some ingredients for snacks. Herminia is a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2010. Herminia hopes to earn more out of her business and be able to repay her loan.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is from the village of Irind in the Aragatsotn region. She lives with her family and daughter. Svetlana has been a teacher in the local village school for many years. She is the only breadwinner of the family. Her salary of a teacher, however, is not enough to meet the everyday needs of her family. 

Svetlana is engaged in breeding livestock; cows, sheep, and hens, as well as in beekeeping. She cultivates potatoes, alfalfa, grass and walnuts. Svetlana's agribusiness currently needs some investment to function in a sustainable way. She needs a loan of USD 3000 to buy three calves, some forage for the livestock and to make credit repayments. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Svetlana has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. Therefore, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Svetlana will be thankful to all the lenders for helping her to maintain her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy three calves, some forage for the livestock and to make credit repayments

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is  single and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She sells firewood in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than seven years and earns PHP 3,000 every month. 

Her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) was used in her business and was successfully repaid. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan of PHP 8,000 to buy firewood and charcoal, in bulk, to sell. With this idea of buying in volume, she will earn an additional profit, unlike before. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal, in bulk, to sell.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Roció, de 27 años de edad, está casada con Jeferson y tiene 3 hijos de 05, 03  y 01 año de edad con quienes vive en su casa propia. Roció se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad para eso cuenta con una tienda la cual está instalada en su casa, desde donde atiende con sus productos a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos, lleva 5 años en este negocio. Le  gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar en su hogar y generar ingresos económicos para el bien de su familia. Por lo contrario, lo que no le gusta es cuando algunos de sus clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos concedidos, pero eso no la desanima y continúa trabajado con las mismas ganas, ahora tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva, Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 soles comprará productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros al por mayor.
texts.en:
Rocío, 27, is married to Jeferson and has three children, ages 5, 3, and 1.  She lives with them in her own house.

Rocío makes a living selling food staples in a store in her house where she sells her products to her customers, who are mainly her own neighbors.  She has been in this business for five years.  She likes her job because it lets her be at home and earn an income for the good of her family.  On the other hand, she doesn't like it when some of her customers get behind in their credit payments.  This doesn't discourage her, though, and she keeps on working with her same desire.

Now Rocío has plans to continue with her business and make it grow.  This is her second Kiva loan.  She hopes for your collaboration so she can finalize her plans.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount of 1200 soles [PEN] Rocío will buy rice, sugar, oil, and other grocery products wholesale.

loans.use: to buy food products wholesale

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en: Mupa appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She would like to apply for another loan for  KSH 50,000 to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: buy flour, rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a very hardworking man from Olkalou. He is 65 years old and separated from his spouse. He has one child, 15 years old, whom he takes care of.

He is a farmer, an occupation he has been carrying out for the last five years. He has applied for his third loan of 20,000 KES from Kadet Ltd to buy a calf to rear. Right now his monthly income is 10,000 KES. He plans to use the profit from his expanded business to educate his child.

His hopes and dreams are to be a successful farmer and to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Altansukh

texts.en:
Altansukh is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives on endowment from people who seek his counsel on spiritual matters.  

Altansukh  has borrowed from our organization two times and repaid each installment without delay. This time he is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT to purchase some insulation materials such as fiberglass, felt and foam to insulate his house as winter is coming near. As a result, his family can live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to buy insulation materials

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 44-year-old single woman who has two kids who are separated from her.  Mercy lives on her own. She is a good person and has no bad record on the said place. She has two kinds of businesses:  one is a sari-sari store and the other is selling viands at her food stall. She also sells charcoal and firewood.  

Mercy has been a good member in PAGLAUM MULTIPURPOSE COOPERATIVE since March 2012.  Mercy came to in PAGLAUM MULTIPURPOSE COOPERATIVE  for additional capital for her businesses.  This is her third loan amounting PHP 20,000.   She used the money to get more food products for additional income. To improve her living Mercy uses her money wisely so that she meets her daily needs and make more income to have more improvements in her life.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, near her married children's residence. For the past 11 years, Dominga was engaged in a food vending business selling snacks and viands in her local community. Her previous loan that was used for her business was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients to cook snacks and sell them in her community.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated through her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Abednego

texts.en:
Abednego is 34 years old and married.  He supports a family of three. He runs several small businesses, among them are: a retail shop, a mini bakery depot, and buying and selling electric and fencing poles.  His businesses are in Kapsabet town and its neighboring towns.  He is served by KADET Ltd from the Kapsabet office. 

Abednego has been in business for the last four years, from which he gets an average monthly income of KSH 45,000. He plans to use the amount borrowed of KHS 100,000 to purchase a motorbike to assist him in transporting bread and other items to his customers. He will use the profits from the businesses to repay his loan and expand his retail shop business.  His dream and hope is to grow the businesses to earn him more profit so that he can meet his family's financial needs.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to transport goods

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 39-year-old lady from Kisumu.  She is a married to Erick, who is a business man.  They support six people in their family. They have 2 children who are 18 and 7 years old.

Joyce has a well where she sells water to the community.  She has been doing this business for the last 5 years and earns a monthly income of KES 30000.  She has applied for her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase items like water tanks so as to improve her quality services to the community.  She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.  Her dream is to start a new business with the help of her current business and take good care of her family.

loans.use: buy equipment for her water business

loans.name: Vardush

texts.en:
Vardush is an agronomist from the village Nor Ughi in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and two daughters. Her husband works in the village self-governance body and her eldest daughter works in the private sector. Both of their salaries are very low and are not enough to meet the family's everyday costs. 

Vardush breeds livestock.  She has a cow, pigs and hens. She also cultivates tomatoes, alfalfas, peaches, apricots, grapes and apples. Livestock breeding and horticulture are very important sources of income for the family. 

As autumn is progressing, Vardush needs to purchase some forage for the livestock.  Their barn is also currently in poor conditions and needs to be renovated. A loan of USD 3000 will be a big help to this hard-working woman and her family and will enable them to renovate their barn and to purchase forage for their livestock. 

Vardush and her family are thankful to the lenders for helping them collect the needed amount of loan and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: renovate her barn and to buy livestock forage

location.town: Nor Ughi village of Ararat region

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 33-year-old man. He lives with his wife and his father in the capital city of Georgia. His wife works as a salesperson at a local shop. His father is provided with a retirement pension. 

David works on the minibus line and gets 525 Gels per month. As this income is not enough for the family, David requested a loan and seeks credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

This startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. David's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $2500 to purchase a car to start taxi business. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and will be able to increase the income for his family.

loans.use: to begin taxi business

loans.name: Restey

texts.en: Restey is 38 years old. She sells drinks and foodstuff.  She has run her restaurant for the past eight years. With this loan, she would like to buy more foodstuff and drinks to sell in her restaurant. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees.

loans.use: buy food and drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 23-year-old married lady who has a business selling recycled goods for the past 2 years.  She buys PET plastic bottles and different types of used papers and cardboard boxes. After properly crushing and recycling these bottles and boxes she sells them to the people in her community. 

Through her business Shakeela makes an enough amount to contribute to the family income. She has two children and she is liable for providing them with good food, health and education, so she requires earning more income to support her family well. 

Shakeela is in her 3rd loan cycle with Kashf foundation.  She requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy more recycled bottles, papers and cardboard boxes of different sizes in bulk quantities to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: buy recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en la costa norte del Perú, en el distrito de Cayaltí, su comunidad es una zona agrícola y comercial, las actividades económicas giran en torno a una empresa agroindustrial que produce caña de azúcar y maíz para consumo interno.

Su esposo trabaja como obrero en la empresa y para apoyarlo ella suele vender animales de corral entre sus vecinos y negociantes, la demanda es permanente y ella siempre está al pendiente de los eventuales compradores para ofrecer en venta sus animales y así obtener mayores ingresos para su familia.

Julia desea adquirir más animales y alimentos para seguir criándolos y ofreciéndolos en venta, para poder lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Julia, 58, is married and lives with her husband and children in the district of Cayalti, on the northern coast of Peru.  In her community there are agricultural and commercial activities which tend to revolve around an agro-industrial firm that produces cane sugar and corn for domestic use.

Julia's husband is employed by the company, and to support him, she usually sells barnyard animals to her neighbors and to traders.  There is constant demand, and she is always aware of potential buyers to whom she can offer her animals for sale.  This way, she can obtain greater earnings for her family.

Julia wants to acquire more animals and animal feed so that she can continue to raise animals to put up for sale.  To do this, she is requesting a loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles.

loans.use: to buy barnyard animals and animal feed

loans.name: Marta Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Marta es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora de 43 años de edad, casada y de su matrimonio tiene 4 hijos de los cuales el mayor trabaja en el campo con sus padres y los tres menores están en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación que al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles colaboran con sus padres y su hermano en el campo. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria completo pero no pudo seguir estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo por parte de sus padres en ese entonces. Ella es caficultora desde hace muchos años siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra y que hoy en día lo sigue haciendo en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos. Su producto es comercializado con los intermediarios que llegan a la zona la cual caracterizan su producto como un producto de calidad e higiénico. El terreno que ellos cultivan es propio y lo adquirieron por medio de una herencia por parte de sus padres y otra parte comprada la cual está ubicada a 1.5 kilómetros de distancia al cual se traslada a pie o en vestía.

Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación dando variedad a sus clientes y todos aquellos que consumen su producto para de esa forma poder generar más ingresos que vendrán a ayudar para fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos y sus nietos y que sean ellos los que sigan trabajando la tierra de generación en generación. Por lo que hoy en día solicita ayuda para poder comprar insumos agrícolas dar el mantenimiento necesario y posible para poder obtener una buena cosecha de café y aprovechar para preparar su tierra para la próxima temporada.
texts.en:
Marta is an enterprising and fighting woman.  She is forty-three years old, is married, and has four children.  Her eldest son works in the countryside with her and her husband, and her three younger children are all in different grades in elementary school; after their school activities, they help their parents and brother in the countryside too.  Marta has completed primary school, but could not continue studying due to a lack of support from her parents.  

She has been growing coffee for many years, and Marta's parents were the ones who taught her to work the land.  Today, she continues this practice in the company of her husband and children.  She sells her products through intermediaries who come to the area, and they characterize her coffee as a high-quality and hygienic product.  The land that she and her family use is their own; they acquired some of this land as inheritance from Marta's parents, and they also purchased some themselves.  Their lands are located 1.5km from their home, and they travel there by foot or by donkey.   

Her future plan is to increase her planting so that she has a variety to offer her customers and everyone else who consumes her coffee.  In this way, she will be able to earn a higher income; this will strengthen the inheritance for her children and grandchildren, and ensure that they continue working the land generation to generation.  

Today, she is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies in order to perform the necessary maintenance on her crops, so that she can have a good coffee harvest and prepare her lands for the following harvest.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies in order to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Empezó tiempo atrás vendiendo productos y realizando los pedidos por medio de una amiga, luego se capitalizó y obtuvo su propio catálogo.  Después  incrementó su mercadería comprando ropa y también se dedica a la venta de comida los fines de semana.  Realiza su trabajo sola, desde las 9:10 am hasta las 7:10 pm.  No es casada, pero tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13 y 5 años, quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal de su área.  Desea en el futuro seguir creciendo con su negocio y poner su propio local de ropa y bisutería, para poderle brindar una mejor vida a sus hijos.  Ahora necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar ropa y perfumes para su venta.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Quevedo.  She began selling products some time ago and is receiving orders through a friend.  Later she invested her own capital to obtain her own catalog business.  Afterwards she expanded her inventory of merchandise by buying clothing.  She also sells food on the weekends.

The borrower works alone from 9:10 A.M. to 7:10 P.M.  She is not married, but she has three children (ages 15, 13, and 5) who attend a state school in the area.  In the future she wants to keep growing her business and establish her own clothing and jewelry shop so that she can provide a better life for her children.  

For now, the borrower needs the money from this loan to buy clothing and perfumes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is 27 years old, a resident of Ndeeba, Kampala city. He is married with 2 children. The first is 3 years old and attends school and the baby is two weeks old.
 
Noah deals in a business of spare parts for motorcycles which is strategically located in the busy town near Kampala center. He started his business in 2011 with a view of stimulating his daily income and to have a strong business. In addition to that, he also repairs his customers' motorcycles, which is another source of income. 

He wants a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy more stock in order to serve his clients better, due to an increased demand for spare parts in the town. He sells mostly to motorcycle riders who come from different parts of town. However, he faces challenges of inadequate capital and competition in the market.
Noah, though being challenged by some factors, is a man who is determined, committed and focused, and is always aiming at acquiring more loans to boost his business so as to prosper.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Moniqa

texts.en:
Moniqa is a 35-year-old married woman with 2 children. She started her beauty parlor business in her house six years ago. She has a good client list, and most of her clients are her neighbors. Moniqa dreams of providing her children with good quality education and food, but she doesn’t have the funds. 
She has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy chairs with mirrors for her parlor, along with some better quality cosmetics for bridal makeup. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy chairs with mirrors for her parlor along with some better quality cosmetics for bridal makeup.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en: Teona is a 24-year-old woman. She lives in a small village in the Sagarejo district with her mother, brother, daughter-in-law and grandmother. Her grandmother is provided with a retirement pension. They have pigs and sell piglets. Teona bakes cakes and sells from home. She decided to expand this business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL. She will rent a space at a local supermarket and will sell her cakes from there. This will increase sales as well as income. With increased income Teona will be able to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to bake cakes to sell at the supermarket.

loans.name: Josefina Marlene

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Empezó tiempo atrás con esta actividad y le llamó mucho la atención la elaboración de bolsos.  Decidió emprender en este negocio y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien.  Trabaja con su hija todos los días, particularmente vendiendo en los campos.  Es unida y tiene una hija que le ayuda en el negocio.  Desea poder llegar a tener su casa propia, ya que por ahora sigue viviendo con su padre.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de yute para la confección de sus productos.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Quevedo.  She started in this business some time ago and focuses her attention toward making bags.  After she decided to establish this business, it has done very well so far.  The borrower works with her daughter every day, especially when selling in the countryside.  She is very close with her daughter, who helps with the business.  

The borrower would like to have a home of her own, but for now she continues to live with her father.  She now needs a loan in order to buy jute for making her products.

loans.use: to buy jute for making bags.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia de 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad que estudia quinto grado, en su casa convive con sus padres y hermanos. Silvia solo estudio hasta noveno grado por las dificultades económicas que tenia la familia en esa época.

Silvia tiene ocho meses produciendo pollo de engorde para la venta de carne, de joven aprendió con sus padres pero se retiraron del negocio, hoy en día Silvia volvió a trabajar y esta vez por cuenta propia. La galera improvisada esta a 50 mts. De su casa y es ayudada por su padre en el mantenimiento de los animales. Tres días a la semana, Silvia trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa particular, viajando a la ciudad,


.El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 100 pollos, 3 quintales de concentrado de inicio, 5 yardas de malla  para encerrar sus pollos y pagar parte de un crédito. Si todo sale bien espera duplicar su producción, construir algún día galeras fijas y ser la principal productora de pollos en la zona.
texts.en:
Silvia, 36, is a single mother who has an 11 year-old child who attends 5th grade.  She lives in her house with her parents and siblings.  Silvia has only a 9th grade education, due to financial difficulties that her family had when she was young.

For 8 months, Silvia has been fattening chickens and selling their meat.  She learned this activity when she was a child from her parents, but they have retired from the business.  Today, Silvia has returned to this line of work, this time working on her own.  Her improvised chicken coop is located 50 meters from her house. Her father helps her to care for the animals.  Three days a week, Silvia travels to the city to work as a domestic in a private house.

Silvia will use this loan to buy 100 chickens, 300 pounds of starter feed, and 5 yards of mesh wire to enclose her chicken coop and pay off part of an existing loan.  If all goes well, she hopes to double her production and someday build a permanent coop so that she can become the main chicken producer in the area.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens, 300 pounds of starter feed, and 5 yards of mesh wire for her chicken coop

loans.name: Sheily

texts.es: Sheily, de 45 años de edad, está casada con German quien es docente y  padre de su hija de 17 años de edad con quien vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hermana y suegra. Sheily se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas de distintos sabores para eso cuenta con una congeladora grande que compró con el apoyo del padre de su esposo, y en donde guardan y sus bebidas bien heladas al gusto de sus clientes. También vende golosinas de diversas presentaciones y marcas. Atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes ganándose sus preferencias y que ellos la recomienden con otras personas, que luego se convierten en sus clientes.  Tiene más de 04 años dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de su hija. Tenía apuros económicos para pagar los gastos de su hogar por eso decidió poner un negocio nuevo para generar ingresos económicos esto le permite sentirse ocupada contando con un oficio. Por tanto tiene planes de seguir con su negocio y hacerlo crecer y en un futuro abrir una bodega de venta de abarrotes. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos comprará bebidas gaseosas de diversa marcas y sabores, así como golosinas, ambos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sheily is 45 years old and married to German, who is a teacher and the father of her daughter, age 17. She lives with them, her sister and her mother-in-law in their own home. Sheily works selling carbonated drinks in a variety of flavors. She says that her customers like their drinks very cold, so she stores them in a large freezer which she bought with the help of her father-in-law. 

Sheily also sells many different kinds and brands of snacks. She says that she wins her customer’s loyalty by waiting on them with kindness, and ensures that they will recommend her to other people, who later become new customers. 
 
Sheily has been working in her business for four years, and until now has been running it with the help of her daughter. She says that she used to have hardly enough money to pay for her household expenses, so she decided to start a new business to improve her income. She says that having a business makes her feel useful. Sheily plans to continue with her business to make it grow, and she hopes to open a corner grocery store in the future. 

This is Sheily’s third Kiva loan. She says that she is grateful for the financial support she receives to move ahead, and that she promises to make her payments on time. Sheily is requesting this loan of 2,500 PEN to buy snacks and various flavors and brands of carbonated drinks at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy snacks and various flavors and brands of carbonated drinks at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, with her family. Her husband is a farmer and she helped him operate their owned farm to make a living. She plants and harvests corn for sale. Her previous loan from GDMPC that was used in her farm was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a loan of 12,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer and cover the costs of weeding maintenance. She had the determination to have an abundant harvest in return for her investments. She plans to use the profit generated from her farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cover the costs of weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Ursula Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Ursula, tiene 48 años de edad, tiene una hija  en  edad escolar, Ursula labora para el sector de la salud en una institución del estado desempeñándose en el departamento de importaciones, actualmente cursa la carrera de administración de aduana, ella es una persona con visión y metas establecidas para ser una mejor profesional, es por eso que solicita este apoyo de crédito para comprar una computadora, herramienta que le permita mejorar su desempeño laboral y estudios.
texts.en: Doña Ursula is 48 and the mother of a school-age daughter. She works for the public health service, in the import department of a government hospital, and is currently studying customs administration. Urusla has vision and has set a goal of becoming a better professional. She is therefore applying for a loan to purchase a computer, which will allow her to perform her job and study more effectively.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 47-year-old married and vigorous lady. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community, and makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Washington Jesús

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Empezó desde muy pequeño involucrado en esta actividad, ya que para ayudar a sus padres, trabajó en una avícola en el centro de la ciudad.  Ha laborado en este negocio toda su vida y ahora está pensando en independizarse.  Trabaja todos los días, sale en su moto desde las 3 am hasta las 8 am y su esposa le ayuda también.  Está en estado de unión libre con la madre de su hijo, quien es ama de casa y también le colabora en su trabajo.  Tiene 3 hijos, de 12, 9 y 6 años, todos estudian en la escuela fiscal de su sector.  En un futuro cercano, desea tener su propio negocio cerca de su casa y vender al por mayor.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de exhibidores y arreglos para su local.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Quevedo.  He started in this line of work at a very young age since he had to help his parents.  He then worked on a poultry farm in the central part of town.  The borrower has worked in this type of business his entire life and now he plans to become independent.  He works very day and travels on his motorcycle between 3:00 A.M and 8:00 A.M.  His wife helps out as well.  

The borrower is in a common-law relationship with the mother of his children.  She is also a housewife and helps him with his work.  They have three children (ages 12, 9, and 6) who attend a state school in their neighborhood.  In the future, he would like to have a business near his house where he can sell wholesale.  

For now, the borrower needs a loan in order to buy display shelves and to make repairs to his shop.

loans.use: to buy display shelves and to make repairs to his shop.

loans.name: Bexy Liseth

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Después de perder su trabajo, decidió cuidar de su mamá y poner un criadero de pollo para su venta y además aprendió manualidades.  Trabaja sola desde las 4 am hasta la hora que pueda y termine sus actividades.  Es soltera y por el momento no tiene hijos.  A futuro desea agrandar su negocio, poner vitrinas y tener buena salud para seguir cuidando a su mamá.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de bebederos, mallas y cemento para su criadero.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Quevedo.  After she lost her job, she decided to take care of her mother and start a poultry farm so that she could sell chickens.  She also learned to make handicrafts.  The borrower works alone from 4:00 A.M. until she is finished with all of her tasks.  She is single and does not have any children at the moment.  In the future she would like to expand her business, buy display cabinets, and remain in good health so that she can continue caring for her mother.  

For now the borrower needs this loan so that she can buy water bowls, wire mesh, and cement for her chicken coops.

loans.use: to buy water bowls, wire mesh, and cement for her chicken coops.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 33 years old. She is a mother of four children. She owns a stationery store and has spent three years running the business. With the loan, she would like to buy more books and other scholastic materials to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more books and other scholastic materials to sell.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. For about 4 years she has been in the business of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy reels of thread along with packs of beads, pearls and sequins in different colors. This will allow her to complete the orders of her customers on time. She is hopeful of getting an increase in her income and desires to provide a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread along with packs of beads, pearls and sequins in different colors.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of four. She has dealt in a business of animal sales for the last 15 years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level to fulfill her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
José de 67 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, de 42 y 37 años de edad, uno de ellos vive con él. Solo pudo estudiar hasta primer grado, no tuvo los recurso económicos para poder estudiar, es divorciado y además de su hijo lo acompañan su nuera y tres nietos.

José es agricultor desde los 10 años de edad, aprendió de su hermano mayor, trabajó como operador de la bomba en un proyecto de agua potable en la comunidad, trabaja 8 días corridos y tiene libre otros 8 días que se dedica a trabajos agrícolas.

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de 12 pliegos de lamina de aluminio para repara el techo de la cocina y parte de las paredes, también para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz que tiene establecido

José tiene como meta repara totalmente su casa para vivir con mayores comodidades no estar expuestos a enfermedades en la época lluviosa
texts.en:
José is 67 years old and has two children, aged 42 and 37 years, respectively.  José was only able to complete first grade at primary school as he did not have the money to study.  José is divorced and one of his sons, along with his wife and three children, live with José.

José has been a farmer since he was ten years old  He learned the trade from his brother.  José works as a pump operator on a community water project, where he works 8-days-on/8-days-off.  On his days off, he makes a living in agriculture.

This loan will be used to buy twelve sheets of aluminium to repair the roof on his kitchen, and part of the walls, and to buy fertiliser for his corn crops.

José's goal is to complete repair his house so as to be able to live more comfortably and not be prone to illnesses during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy twelve sheets of aluminium, and to buy fertiliser to grow corn.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба около 7 лет занимается торговлей. Она проживает в городе Вахдат. Матлюба в своем магазине продает хозяйственные товары, в том числе мыло, стиральный порошок, средства для мытья посуды, салфетки и другие хозяйственные принадлежности, а также краски для волос, домашние тапочки, шлепанцы, простые ткани. Ей в торговле помогает муж, заменяет ее когда ей необходимо отлучиться домой. Матлюбе 36 лет. Она мать троих детей. Ее дети уже ходят в школу. И она может свободно работать. Матлюба просит кредит для развития своего бизнеса. Она надеется, что получит финансирование и увеличит оборот средств. Она ждет вашей помощи!
texts.en: Matluba has about seven years of experience in trade. She lives in Vahdat. Matluba sells household goods in her shop, including soap, laundry detergent, dishwashing detergent, napkins and other household supplies. She also sells hair dyes, slippers, flip flops, and plain fabric. Her husband helps her in the shop, taking over when she is away.  Matlyuba is 36 years old. She has three children. Her children are enrolled in school, so she can work. Matluba is asking for a loan to develop her business. She hopes she will receive financing and will thus be able to increase her sales. She is waiting for your help!

loans.use: buy household supplies for resale.

loans.name: Pedro Fernando

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Tiempo atrás, tuvo la oportunidad de comprar su tricimoto y se puso a trabajar con ella, a fin de ayudar con dinero para la construcción de su casa.  Trabaja todos los días de 8 am a 9 pm.  No es casado y no tiene hijos por ahora.  Su deseo a futuro es tener su propia cooperativa de tricimotos, para que su familia no tenga necesidades.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de cadenas, asientos y aceite para la adecuación de su moto.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Orquídeas sector of Guayaquil.  Some time ago, he took the opportunity to buy a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi and put it to use so that he could earn money for the construction of his house.  The borrower works every day from 8:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M.  He is not married and has no children at the moment.  In the future, he would like to have his own motorcycle taxi cooperative so that all of his family’s needs are met.  

For now the borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy chains, seats, and oil for maintaining his motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy chains, seats, and oil for maintaining his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur s’appelle Dieynaba. Elle  est mariée et mère de 3 enfants âgés respectivement de 5, 7 et 10 ans. Aminata est âgée de 33 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de charbons et bois de chauffe.  Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 15ans dans ce domaine .Elle démarre sa journée à 7h 30mn du matin pour la terminer à 18h 30mn. Elle est à son 1ème crédit qui va lui servir à améliorer son stock aussi bien pour le charbon et le bois de chauffe.
Madame Dieynaba  s’occupe des petits besoins de ses enfants et participe à la dépense  quotidienne du foyer ainsi que les frais scolaires. 
Elle a comme projet futur  de développer son commerce  avec l’appui des institutions financières comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Our borrower's name is Dieynaba. She is married with three children who are five, seven and ten years old. Aminata is 33 years old. 

She is active in the retail sales of coal and firewood. She has over 15 years' experience in this field. She starts her day at 7:30 in the morning to finish at 18:30. This is her first credit loan that will serve to increase her stock of both coal and firewood.

Mrs. Dieynaba takes care of her children's minor needs and participates with daily household expenses and tuition fees. As a future project she wants to develop her trade activity with the support of financial institutions such as IMCEC.

loans.use: Buy coal and firewood

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es: José, a sus 51 años de edad, es separado y  padre de 2 hijos. Desde hace 26 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, pues tiene una chaza donde vende mecato, confitería, gaseosas, entre otros, se ubica en el parque principal del pueblo donde reside, por lo que tiene muy buena clientela, adicionalmente presta el servicio de lustrabotas, con lo que complementa sus ingresos para dar el sustento a sus hijos. Esta actividad la aprendió de su padre, quien tuvo chaza durante 30 años. El cliente es un hombre humilde, carismático y amable, lucha incansablemente, soportando las adversidades y los cambios climáticos con tal de dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, dulces, chicles, gaseosas), de esta manera podrá aumentar su margen de ganancia, pues conseguirá los productos a un menor costo y así se notará el incremento en sus ingresos. José sueña con tener la posibilidad de adquirir un local para montar su negocio y así prestar un mejor servicio, pues dejará de trabajar de manera ambulante y evitará los riesgos a los que está expuesto en la calle, para esto, dice que seguirá trabajando para dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, aged 51, is separated and is the father of 2 children.  

For the past 26 years he has earned a living as an independent vendor. He has a cart where he sells snacks, confectionery, soft drinks, and other items. It is located in the main park of the town where he lives, and so he has a large clientele. He also provides a shoe shine service, which supplements his income to help support his children. He learned this trade from his father, who had a cart for 30 years. 

José is a humble, charismatic and friendly man who struggles untiringly, enduring adversity and the changes in the weather, in order to give his family a better quality of life. 

He is currently applying for a loan to purchase an assortment of goods wholesale (snacks, candy, gum, soft drinks). This will allow him to increase his profit margin, because he will be able to buy the products at a lower cost, and thus, will increase his income. 

José dreams of being able to acquire a locale to set up his business to provide better service. This would mean he would no longer work as a street vendor and he would avoid the risks to which he is exposed on the street. He will continue to work to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods wholesale (snacks, candy, gum, soft drinks).

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 45-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good, and she has to think many times to start any task. Now her elder son is going to start driving Chingchi (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike and a sidecar). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Her son bought the motorbike but does not have money left to buy the body for making a Chingchi rickshaw. 

Nusrat requested a loan so that her son could maintain the rickshaw body so that he could drive the rickshaw smoothly. She says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: For the maintenance of a rickshaw.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia, 32 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a shop for 3 years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Nazia needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand.

She has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Angela Narcisa

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Empezó vendiendo bebidas y poco a poco fue creciendo con su tienda.  Realiza su trabajo con su hija, todos los días de 7 am a 8 pm.  No es casada y sus hijos ya son todos mayores.  Desea a futuro construir su casa y que su tienda se incremente mucho más, para darle un mejor porvenir a su familia.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de una refrigeradora, snacks y arroz para la venta en su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Orquídeas sector of Guayaquil.  She started out selling beverages and gradually was able to grow her store.  The borrower works every day with her daughter from 7:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M.  She is not married and all of her children are grown.  In the future, she would like to build a house and grow her store even more so that she can provide a better future for her family.  

For now the borrower needs this loan so that she can buy a refrigerator, as well as snacks and rice to sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, as well as snacks and rice to sell in her business.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa Elena tiene un grado de educación primario no culminado cursado hasta el cuarto grado de primaria ya que sus padres no pudieron apoyarla para que ella pudiese completar sus estudios y es por ello que diariamente en compañía de su compañero de hogar trabajan muy duro para que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades en el futuro. Ella es agricultora dedicándose al cultivo de café siendo sus clientes las bodegas, intermediarios que llegan a la zona, vecinos de la zona para la adquisición del producto al final de cada cosecha. Ella es madre de 2 hijos los cuales no estudian aun ya que no están en edad escolar. La tierra que trabaja en compañía de su esposo es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres una parte y la otra es comparada gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio realizado la cual está ubicada a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada a pie o en vestía. 

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 5 sacos de abono, 3 litros de foliares, 3 litros de boro y 50 cargas de café para su cultivo ya que con esto ella pretende agrandar más sus cultivos y fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos. Los planes a futuro son los de mejorar su sistema en cuanto al proceso del café comprando una maquina despulpadora con la cual pueda hacer el trabajo más rápido y preciso, como también poder cultivar otra variedad de café más atractivo y competitivo en el mercado de esa forma ella podrá generar más ingresos y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena only completed up to the end of fourth grade at school as her parents were not able to support her.  So, every day, Rosa goes out with her partner and they work very hard so that their children will have better opportunities in the future.  Rosa is a farmer and makes a living growing coffee, which she sells to neighbours, warehouses and intermediaries, at harvest-time.  Rosa is a mother to two children - they are still too young to go to school.  Rosa owns the land she works - her parents left her some of the land and she was able to buy the rest thanks to her efforts and sacrifice.  The plot of land is some two kilometres from her house, and she arrives there by foot.

Rosa has applied to "Comixmul" for a loan in order to buy five bags of manure, three litres of boron, and 50 loads of coffee for her crops.  With this she plans to expand her crops and strengthen the inheritance she will leave for her children.  Rosa's future plans are to improve her system at work - i.e. she wants to buy a machine so that she can work more accurately and quickly.  She would also like to produce a different variety of coffee - one that is better and more competitive in the market.  If she does this, she can earn a higher income and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to look after her coffee crops.

loans.name: Leoncio Marco

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Empezó desde muy temprano con esta actividad, debido a que siempre le gustó la mecánica.  Trabaja solo desde las 9 am hasta las 6 pm, en su taller de motos.  Es casado y su mujer se dedica al negocio de la costura.  Tiene 3 hijos, quienes van todos a la escuela fiscal del área donde residen.  Desea a futuro poder tener los recursos para ampliar su taller para seguir con su negocio.  Por ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de repuestos y compresas, materiales necesarios para su labor diaria.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Orquídeas sector of Guayaquil.  He started in this line of work at a very young age because he always enjoyed being a mechanic.  The borrower works alone at his motorcycle repair shop from 9:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M.  He is married and his wife has a sewing business.  They have three children, all of whom attend a state school in the area where they live.  In the future, he would like to have the resources that are needed to expand his workshop so that he can continue his business.  

For now, the borrower is requesting this loan so that he can buy spare parts and compressors since these are items that are needed for his daily work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and compressors.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, de 57 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, esta casada con Víctor, fruto de esa unión tienen 02 hijos los cuales ya son independientes, habitando cómodamente su casa propia . La actividad que realiza Bertha, es la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, la cual compra en la ciudad de Lima realizando viajes periódicos para realizar su compras de su mercadería, para luego venderlo desde su casa y en forma ambulatoria por los mercados y a sus vecinos o familiares,  realiza este negocio desde hace 06 años contando con el apoyo de su esposo en la ventas y cobranza de los créditos entregados. También  por las mañanas se dedica ala enseñanza de niños de educación inicial ya que es profesora de profesión. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha generado buenas ganancias además de conocer muy bien el negocio, por eso tiene planes de abrir una tienda comercial de venta de ropas en algunas zona comercial de la ciudad, para así no tener que caminar mucho buscando clientes. Este será su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles comprará más ropas de diversos modelos al por mayor,
texts.en: Bertha is 57 years old.  She is hard-working and persevering.  She is married to Victor and has two children, both of whom are now independent.  Bertha lives comfortably in the house that she owns.  Bertha sells clothes for men, women, and children.  She travels to Lima periodically to buy these clothes and then sell from her house or as a street vendor in the markets.  She also sells to neighbours and family members.  Bertha has been doing this work for six years and receives support, with sales and collecting payments, from her husband.  Bertha is a trained teacher and works with young children in the mornings.  Bertha likes her business as it has given her good profits.  She knows the business well and has plans to open a shop selling clothes in one of the city's shopping districts.  With premises, she will not have to walk so much as she looks for customers.  This will be Bertha's second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving to move ahead.  Bertha promises to make her repayments on time.  With this loan of 2000 Nuevo Soles, Bertha will buy a greater variety of clothes in bulk.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is from Malibangcao, Clarin. She is married and has six children. To make a living, Felicidad plants, harvests and sells corn with her husband.  She has been doing this for more than nine years and earns PHP 6,810 a month from these activities. Her previous loan from GDMPC, which was used for her farm, was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 6,500 PHP to buy fertilizer for her banana farm to gain more income.

She plans to use the additional profit generated from her farm to improve the general living conditions of her family and save a portion for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. He has six children and has been doing this work for 30 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'More funds in expanding my small scale farming.' His biggest challenge is 'Limited funds.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyasamo.'

Samwel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Assists farmers with asset funds.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Funds farmers.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Samwel replied, 'Upgrade their livelihood.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Samwel owns the following: cow and poultry. But he does not own: pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and TV, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en: Asmat, age 31, is a married woman and a mother of two. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs. 25000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.
