She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a mother of four children aged between two and eleven years. She owns a hairdressing salon. With the loan, she would like to buy more equipment for use in the saloon. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment for use in her salon.

loans.name: Tursunbu

texts.ru: Турсунбу 60 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитала детей, в настоящее время дети проживают отдельно. У Турсунбу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Турсунбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Турсунбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 14 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Турсунбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Турсунбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en: Tursunbu is 60 years old, married, and has raised children with her husband. Her children now live independently. Tursunbu has a secondary education. The family's primary source of income is animal husbandry.  Tursunbu started this business twelve years ago when she bought cattle for 15,000 KGS. Due to Tursunbu's hard work, her farm now has three dairy cows and fourteen sheep. She earns a monthly income of 12,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Tursunbu approached the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy cattle for breeding. Tursunbu plans to use her profits to increase her livestock and plans to save enough money to buy a car.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Adilet

texts.ru: Адилет 35 лет, разведена, одна воспитывает 3 детей. У Адилет- средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Адилет занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Адилет, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 нетель, 1 теленок, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Адилет обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Адилет планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Adilet is 35, divorced, and is raising 3 children by herself.  She has some post-secondary education, and raises livestock for a living, having started 5 years ago with 5,000 somoni worth of livestock.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, Adilet's farm currently has one dairy cow, one heifer, one calf, and 10 sheep, and  her monthly income is 10,000 somoni.  To further develop her farm, Adilet is seeking a loan of 110,000 somoni from Bai Tushum and Partners; specifically, she would like to buy more cows for her farm.  She plans on using her increased income due to the loan to buy even more livestock for her farm, as well as to set aside money for her children's education.

loans.use: buy cows for her farm

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 52-year-old married woman; she is a hardworking lady who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has done this for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her to continue operating her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000/- to buy a stock of threads in different colors, along with packs of buttons and laces. It will help her to complete the orders of her customers on time. She is on her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, along with packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 31-year-old married woman.  She has been selling shoes for the past six years. She offers various designs of shoes to the people of her locality. Her husband also assists her in selling shoes to the people of their community and in the local market. 

Bashiran makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her business, Bashiran contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR. With this loan, she will be able to purchase a greater variety of shoes in different sizes and designs. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of shoes in different sizes and designs.

loans.name: Milton Antonio

texts.es:
Milton de 29 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 3 hijos de 1 año de edad, 3 años de edad y 6 años de edad; solo el mayor estudia. Solo termino sus estudios de educación media y se dedico a trabajar, con él conviven sus tres hijos y su esposa y todos depende de los ingresos que genere.

Milton tiene 10 años de ser agricultor, aprendió con su padre cuando trabajaban juntos. También presta sus servicios como chofer de un camión, transportando materiales de construcción entre otros.
Todos los días se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para  las vacas de un amigo y recibe un pago por su servicio, luego camina un kilómetro hasta donde esta el cultivo  y después de trabajar 6 horas regresa a su casa.

El préstamo será utilizado para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde va a cultivar, comprara fertilizantes, semilla, pesticidas, herbicidas y pagara mano de obra.

El sueño de Milton es algún  día repara su casa, se encuentra en mal estado y teme por la seguridad de su familia, espera poder darle las comodidades que el no pudo tener.
texts.en:
Milton is 29 years old, married and lives with his wife and three children, ages one, three and six. His oldest child is in school. Milton only completed secondary school before starting to work. He says that his family depends on the income he earns. 

Milton has been farming for ten years, which he says he learned working alongside his father. He also drives a truck, transporting construction materials and other items. Milton wakes up at 4 in the morning every day to take care of his friend’s cows. He is paid for his work. He then walks a kilometer to the plot of land where he has his crop. He works six hours before returning home.   

Milton will use this loan to rent a plot of land to farm, to buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and herbicides, and to pay for labor. Milton says that his dream is to one day repair his home, which is in poor condition. He says that he worries about his family’s safety, and that he hopes to give them all the comforts of home that he did not have himself.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land to farm, to buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and herbicides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Teresita has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock like coffee, milk, toothpaste, canned goods, shampoo, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Teresita has been in this business for six years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like coffee, milk, toothpaste, canned goods, shampoo, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es una madre de familia de 51 años de edad, reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en la costa norte del Perú, en el distrito de Cayaltí, su comunidad es una zona agrícola y comercial, las actividades económicas giran en torno a una empresa agroindustrial que produce caña de azúcar y maíz para consumo interno.

Ella cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado para realizar transporte de carga y pasajeros), con el cual brinda servicio de transporte en la zona. El vehículo es manejado por un chofer, el cual brinda el servicio comunicando la zona central de la comunidad con las zonas aledañas. El servicio es bastante común y popular en la zona.

Debido al uso continuo de la unidad, Lucila desea brindarle mantenimiento, cambiando las llantas y el aceite, además de realizar otros procedimientos rutinarios. por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de S/. 3500 nuevos soles
texts.en: Lucila is a 51-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children on the northern coastline of Peru in the district of Cayaltí. Her community is in an agricultural and commercial area, where the economic activity revolves around an agroindustrial company that produces sugar and corn for domestic consumption. She has her own mototaxi (which is a motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers) with which she provides a transportation service in her area. The vehicle is driven by another person, who provides service in the central area and in surrounding areas. This type of transportation is fairly common and popular in the region. Due to the continuous use of the vehicle, Lucila wishes to perform maintenance, changing the tires and the oil, and also have other routine procedures performed. She believes it would be convenient to seek a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for this purpose in the amount of 3500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase tires, and to pay for an oil change and other maintenance procedures for her mototaxi.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 26 years old and single. He lives in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal Province. To make a living, he has been working at one company for almost two years. The current business earns him about US$10 per day to support the family’s need.

Pov is with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for this cycle. Now he is applying for an education loan to pay for his university’s tuition fees. He hopes this loan will enable him to study until graduation and also help relieve the financial burden on his family.

loans.use: to pay for his university’s tuition fees.

loans.name: Vin Group

texts.en:
Vin is a citizen from a rural village located in the Banteay Meanchey province’s Moungkul Borey district. She is 45 years old and married, with three children. 

For the last three years, she has been raising ducks and chickens, and sometimes she works for others for a fee. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 15,000 per day, and she can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.

Vin is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan of KHR 100,000 to buy more chickens and ducks for raising. She hopes to fatten her chickens and ducks so as to sell them for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and ducks for raising

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Chanty's Group

texts.en:
A 50-year-old mother of seven children, Chanty resides in a rural village of Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district, Cambodia. To earn a living, she has been farming rice on five hectares of farmland. She can earn about KHR 40,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for their future needs.  

This will be Chanty's first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. As the leader of her borrower group, Chanty will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s business and gain more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. He has three children and has been doing this work for 15 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Having variety of farm goods to sell.' His biggest challenge is 'Drugs are expensive to buy.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyangera.'

Robert was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Dairy cow.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Gives loans and insures their farmers.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Robert replied, 'Offer basic needs after investing.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Robert owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, sewing machine, TV' but does not have 'electricity, running water, DVD'.

loans.use: To put up a dairy unit.

loans.name: Joan

texts.fr: est une femme de 39 ans mariée mère de 8 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 26 ans; 5 d'entre eux vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail et en gros des vivres frais (légumes) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis quelques années. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter les légumes en gros  pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks et d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Joan is a 39-year-old married mother of eight. Her children's ages vary between 3 and 26 years, and five of them are in school.

She is a merchant and for the past 17 years has sold seasonal produce (vegetables), both retail and wholesale, in a local market. She has a good knowledge of her suppliers and especially of the customers she has acquired over time given her experience in this field.

Still, she finds herself constantly out of stock because she has to sell her whole stock in order to buy more supplies, due to her limited capital.

She wants to buy vegetables in bulk to have enough stock to better meet the constant demand of her customers, to avoid stock shortages, and to increase her profits.

She will use her profits not only to expand her business, but also to provide for her family.

loans.use: buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian lives in the Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. To make a living, Ian manages his coconut farm and plants corn under the coconut trees to earn extra income. 

Ian's previous loan from GDMPC was used to buy farm inputs. This loan was successfuly repaid. 

Recently, Ian borrowed a new loan of 18,600 PHP to cover the costs of cultivating his farm like plowing and fertilization. Ian is determined to have an abundant harvest so he invests more to improve his farm, the main source of his income. Ian wants to improve his farming activities to gain more profit for his family in the future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of cultivating his farm like plowing and fertilization.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia. She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Virginia dreams of being successful in her business and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sreyhour's Group

texts.en:
Sreyhour is 25 years old and married. She has two children. The family resides in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. To support the family, she and her husband have been working as carpenters for the past 7 years. The current business earns her family about 19,000 KHR per day to meet their needs. 

Sreyhour has been a member of Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle already, and she successfully used the previous loan to better support her family and to have sufficient food. As the leader of her borrower group, she will use her portion of the loan to buy wood for her carpentry business. She hopes to earn more income from her business in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy wood for her carpentry business

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory, a mother in late 40s, is a villager from Kampong Thom province. She has six children, three of whom still count on her as they are in school. For her family, rice farming and working at a rubber plantation are the main sources of their income. 

Nory is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has utilized her past six loans smartly to improve her living conditions better than before and keep her children in school. Now, she is seeking an education loan from VisionFund in order to pay for the tuition fee for her son, who wants to pursue his bachelor degree, majoring in Khmer Literature. She hopes this financial support will help her son in a timely way so her son can pay more attention in his studies and get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her son to pursue his bachelor's degree.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсаре 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Гулсары - высшее образование, работает в местной школе преподавателем, имеет авторитет хороший среди своих сельчан. Гулсара в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулсары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулсара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулсара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en: Gulsara is 58, married, and is raising 3 children together with her husband.  She has a university education, works at a local school as a teacher, and is respected among her fellow villagers.  To earn extra money for her family, Gulsara raises livestock, having started 18 years ago with 8,000 somoni worth of livestock.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, Gulsara's farm currently has 2 dairy cows, 2 horses, and 10 sheep; additionally, her monthly income has risen to 8,000 somoni.  She is seeking a loan of 100,000 somoni from Bai Tushum and Partners to further develop her farm; specifically, she wants to buy more cows, and hopes to use any extra income due to the loan to buy even more livestock for her farm, as well as to save money for her son's wedding reception.

loans.use: buy cows for her farm

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. Her husband is an employee in a small factory.  His income is not enough to support their family, so Nasreen took initiative for this business. She has two years of experience in this field.  

Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts for years. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand of customers at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Kalima

texts.ru: Калиме 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Калимы - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Калима занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Калимы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калима обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Калима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kalima is 43 years old, married, and raising six children with her husband. Kalima has a vocational education. The family's primary source of income is animal husbandry. Kalima started the farm nineteen years ago when she purchased cattle with 15,000 KGS. Thanks to Kalima's hard work, her farm now has two milk cows and twenty sheep. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Kalima is approaching the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy bulls for breeding. Kalima plans to invest income from the loan in increasing her livestock and plans to save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: buy calves

loans.name: Julio Esteban

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Inició tiempo atrás cuando se dedicó a aprender la profesión a través de cursos y capacitaciones.  Luego de esto pudo reunir algo de dinero, con lo que compró los materiales y el equipo de trabajo, para finalmente instalar su peluquería.  Trabaja solo, todo el día.  No es casado y por el momento no tiene hijos.  A futuro, le gustaría que su peluquería crezca y trabajar mucho más para generar altos ingresos.  Ahora necesita el crédito para adquirir, tijeras, un espejo y tintes para su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Orquídeas sector of Guayaquil.  He started some time ago when he learned his profession through courses and training seminars.  Later on he acquired some money, which he used to buy materials and equipment for his work.  Eventually he opened a beauty salon.  The borrower works alone every day.  He is not married and does not have children at the moment.  In the future, he would like to grow his salon and work more so that he can generate a higher income.

For now the borrower needs this loan so that he can acquire scissors, a mirror, and dyes for his business.

loans.use: to buy scissors, a mirror, and dyes for his salon.

loans.name: Leonel Antonio

texts.es: Leonel es un joven de 18 años de edad, estudiante de primer año de la carrera de Ing. en computación, en la actualidad no trabaja, sus padres le apoyan con los gastos universitarios. El motivo del crédito es para comprar una computadora, la que le será de mucha utilidad para enriquecerse de información así como en la práctica de su profesión.
texts.en: Leonel is 18 years old. He is a first-year student of computer engineering. Currently, he is not working and his parents help him to pay for school. Leonel is requesting this loan in order to buy a computer, which will very useful for him both as a student and later in his career.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas is a 32-year-old single man   He has been working as a butcher for ten years now. In January 2013 he opened his current butchery, and he is  working hard to develop it. 

Firas is responsible for the living of three members of his family, which is an additional motive for him to develop and expand his business 

He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay what's left for him to pay for a car he bought on credit. That will help him to decrease his business transportation expenses and have money for necessary meat and supplies to his shop.

Firas’s future plans are to improve his business productivity and to expand his butchery.

loans.use: to pay what's left for him to pay for a car he bought on credit.

loans.name: Shoista

texts.ru: Шоиста замужняя женщина в возрасте 45 лет. Она проживает с мужем и двумя сыновьями в городе Худжанд. Ее муж мастер по ремонту квартир. Сыновья тоже взрослые и самостоятельные. Им по 28 и 26 лет, один работает водителем, а другой учитель. Шоиста по натуре предприимчивая и способная женщина. У нее 11-летний стаж работы в области шитья. Она с детства любила смотреть как ее мать шьёт и кроит платья, и научилась этой профессии у нее. Сейчас Шоиста решила открыть собственный швейный цех. У нее есть собственные средства в виде швейной машинки, необходимых рабочих инструментов и помещение для работы. Еще недостающую сумму Шоиста просит в кредит. Она собирается купить две штук швейных машинок модели Джаноме и начать свое дело. Шоиста планирует принимать заказы на шитьё женских национальных платьев, костюмов и брюков. Она верит в успех своего дела, так как уже знает кто будет ее первыми клиентами. Это конечно же родственники, соседи, знакомые и друзья.
texts.en: Shoista is a married woman. She is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and two sons in the city of Khujand. Her husband remodels apartments. Her sons are grown and independent. They are 28 and 26 years old. One is a driver and the other a teacher. Shoista is, by nature, an enterprising and capable woman. She has eleven years of experience as a seamstress. As a child, she loved to watch her mother sew dresses and tailor. She learned the profession from her. Now, Shoista has decided to open her own sewing shop. She has her own supplies in the form of a sewing machine, the necessary tools, and room to work. Shoista is asking for a loan to cover the rest of her expenses. She's going to buy two Janome sewing machines and start her business. Shoista plans to take orders for traditional dresses, suits, and pants. She believes in the success of this business, and she already has her first customers. These new customers are, of course, relatives, neighbors, friends, and acquaintances.

loans.use: buy two Janome sewing machines so she can open a shop.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо замужем. Ей 33 года. У нее единственный ребенок. Зебинисо со своей семьей живет в городке Вахдат недалеко от столицы. После рождения ребенка она сидела дома. Когда ее малыш подрос и уже ходил в школу, Зебинисо вышла на работу. Она с помощью мужа арендовала магазин на рынке, где продавала продукты питания. Вот уже 5 лет Зебинисо совместно с мужем работает в продуктовом магазине. Они продают печенье, хлебобулочные изделия, конфеты, продукты быстрого питания, детские смеси и многое другое. Зебинисо и ее муж ценят свой торговый бизнес и хотят расшириться. С такой целью Зебинисо обратилась за кредитом, чтобы закупить новый ассортимент товара. Она надеется найти новых клиентов и увеличить товарооборот. Желаем ей успеха в поиске покупателей!
texts.en: Zebiniso is married. She is 33 years old. She has only one child. Zebiniso lives with her family in a small town near the capital, Vahdat. After having her baby, she stayed home. When her baby started school, Zebiniso went to work. She and her husband rented a shop in the market where they sell food. For the past five years, Zebiniso and her husband have worked together at the grocery store. They sell cookies, baked goods, candy, food mixes, baby formula and more. Zebiniso and her husband value their business and want to expand. To that end, Zebiniso requested a loan to purchase a new range of products. She hopes to find new customers and increase sales. We wish her success in finding buyers!

loans.use: increase her inventory to develop her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. It was a big help not just in her business, but also in her everyday expenses at home. She had this business for thirty years now. Her husband, who is a farmer, is helping her in generating income for their family.
 
She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan for her to buy more materials such as fabric, threads and other items needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain the family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ruth hopes that she will have more customers, and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more materials such as fabric, threads and other items needed in her business.

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Empezó tiempo atrás con esta actividad debido a que siempre le ha gustado el comercio y las ventas.  Trabaja sola desde las 9 am hasta las 7 pm, todos los días.  Es madre soltera y su hijo se encuentra estudiando en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Le gustaría a futuro poder tener su propio local para seguir laborando.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de cremas, perfumes y otros productos de belleza.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Orquídeas sector of Guayaquil.  She started some time ago in this line of work because she has always enjoyed the retail trade and making sales.  The borrower works alone every day from 9:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M.  She is a single mother and her son is studying at a state school in the area.  In the future, she would like to have her own shop where she can continue working.  

For now the borrower needs this loan so that she can buy crèmes, perfumes, and other beauty products.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, perfumes, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es:
Napoleón de 26 años de edad, esta recién casado y no tiene hijos, solo estudio hasta noveno grado. Su esposa es costurera y con ellos también vive la mama de él. 

Es carpintero desde  hace 10 años, aprendió todo lo que sabe de su padre que también era carpintero. Comenta que su padre le enseño con el fin de que se quedara con todas la herramientas que consiguió cuando trabajaba . Desde entonces Napoleón es el que aporta a los ingresos familiares.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar el motor de un torno de carpintería, una sierra Caladora y un Roster, las tres son maquinas que utilizan los carpinteros, Napoleón no las tiene y con ellas podrá dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y hacer un trabajo de mejor calidad sin tener que depender de los servicios de otra persona, pues pagaba para utilizar estas herramientas de trabajo.

El sueño de Napoleón es movilizar su mercadería a la ciudad para poder venderla a mejore precio y así darse a conocer como fabricante de muebles.
texts.en:
Napoleón, 26 years old, is recently married with no children. He has a 9th-grade education. His wife is a seamstress. Together, they live with Napoleón's mother. Napoleón has been a carpenter for 10 years. He learned everything he knows about this trade from his father, who was also a carpenter. Napoleón mentions that his father taught him carpentry so that he would have his father's tools when he reached a working age. Since then, Napoleón has been supporting his family with his work. 

He will use this loan in order to buy some carpentry tools: a motorized lathe, jig saw, and a router. Napoleón does not have these tools, but with them he will be able to provide better service for his clients and do higher-quality work without having to depend on other people. Currently, he pays to use these work tools. 

Napoleón's dream is to move his merchandise to the city in order to sell it at better prices and make himself known as a furniture maker.

loans.use: to buy a motorized lathe (carpentry tool), jig saw, and a router.

loans.name: Rosa Delicia

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Inició en esta actividad debido a que necesitaba pasar más tiempo con sus hijos, por eso montó su negocio de bazar, con el cual hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien.  Trabaja sola, desde las 6:30 am a 9 pm.  Es casada y su esposo está en la marina.  Tiene 2 hijos que son menores de edad.  A futuro desea poder agrandar su negocio para conseguir mejores ingresos.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de artículos de bazar, cuadernos y láminas.
texts.en: This client is from Guayaquil’s Orquídeas sector.  She started this activity because she needed to spend time with her children so she opened a general store that has done well to date.  She works alone from 6:30am to 9pm.  She’s married and her husband is in the navy.  She has two minor children.  In future she’d like to enlarge the store to earn higher income.  She needs the loan now to buy household items, notebooks and laminated instructional sheets.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana es madre soltera de dos hijos de 5 y 10 años de edad. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar en su negocio, una tienda que inició hace dos años; la idea surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia, pues toda la carga económica recae sobre ella por ser madre cabeza de hogar. La cliente es una persona humilde, amable y carismática, tiene don de gente, lo que le permite relacionarse con facilidad y prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en unas reparaciones locativas que debe realizar y en la compra de surtido (cervezas, gaseosas, mecato, confitería, entre otros) de esta forma dará una mejor imagen al establecimiento, logrando cambiar la percepción de los transeúntes, quienes pueden convertirse en clientes potenciales, además podrá ofrecer más variedad de producto, obteniendo como resultado un incremento en sus ventas y en los ingresos que recibe. Ana  desea seguir trabajando con esmero y dedicación para seguir progresando y dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener una mejor educación, bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is single mother of two children who are 5 and 10 years old.  She currently works in her business, a store she started two years ago.  The idea arose from the need to generate income to support her family because the entire economic responsibility falls on her as a mother head of household.  

She’s a humble, kind, charismatic woman who has a gift for getting along with people which allows her to relate to them easily and provide better customer service.  She’s asking for the loan to invest in some physical upgrades to her locale and to buy stock merchandise (beer, soft-drinks, snacks, sweets, etc.) to give her establishment a better image thus changing passersby’s perception so that they will become potential customers.  Also, she’ll be able to offer a wider variety of goods earning higher sales profits and income as a result.  

Ana wants to continue working with dedication and effort to be able to continue progressing and giving her children the opportunity of getting better education, well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and to do physical upgrades to locale.

loans.name: César Remigio

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Desde siempre le ha gustado ser independiente, por este motivo decidió emprender en la actividad de la venta de soya.  Trabaja solo de 6 am a 5 pm.  Es casado y sus esposa se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades en fomix.  Tiene 2 hijos, uno es mayor de edad y el otro estudia.  Sueña en un futuro poder tener más sucursales y más carros para transportar mercadería.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de productos de soya.
texts.en: This client is from Guayaquil’s Orquídeas sector.  He’s always liked to be independent which is why he went into business selling soy.  He works alone from 6am until 5pm.  He’s married and his wife works making foam rubber crafts.  He has two children; one’s an adult and the other attends school.  He dreams in future with having more branches and more cars to transport merchandise.  He needs the loan now to buy soy products.

loans.use: to buy soy and related products.

loans.name: Miguel Eduardo

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Empezó 3 años atrás con un capital que había ahorrado y con el cual pudo montar un negocio de copiadora.  Posteriormente adquirió artículos de bazar para comercializarlos también.  Trabaja solo de lunes a viernes, de 6 am a 7 pm, todos los días y también en sus ratos libres.  Es divorciado y no tiene hijos.  Desea a futuro comprarse un auto para incrementar sus ingresos y terminar de construir su casa.  Ahora quiere invertir el crédito en la compra de recargas, confitería y demás artículos de bazar para su venta.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Orquídeas sector of Guayaquil.  Three years ago, he used some capital that he had saved up to open a photocopying business.  Later on he acquired bazaar products and began selling those items as well.  The borrower works alone Monday through Friday, from 6:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M., and even during his free time.  He is divorced and has no children.  In the future, he wants to buy a car for increasing his earnings and to finish the construction of his house.  

For now the borrower wants to invest his loan in the purchase of rechargeable phone cards, candy, and other bazaar products that he can sell.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable phone cards, candy, and bazaar products that he can sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Alcala where she sells various foods. She is married with four children. She manages a food stall business, selling snacks such as hot dogs, fish balls, pan cakes and juices as refreshments. 

She usually gains a net income of PHP 2,000 each month, and uses it as an added revolving capital in the business, and for emergency purposes. She is now asking for a loan that will be used in buying citrus fruits, hot dogs, and fish balls to sell. This will help increase her merchandise so she can earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruits, hot dogs, and fish balls to sell.

loans.name: Rocelo

texts.en:
Rocelo is 45 years old and lives in Makugihon, Molave, ZDS. He is married with two children.

Rocelo has a sari-sari (general) store to sell items such as canned goods, soft drinks, breads, etc. He earns approximately 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan for additional capital for his business. Rocelo has been a member of PMPC for one month. In the future, Rocelo hopes to improve his sari-sari store into an enterprise someday.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories for his sari-sari (general) store such as canned goods, soft drinks, breads, etc.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 22-year-old Lebanese single woman. She started her career working in clothing stores, and then she became the owner of a proper clothing store. Her store is located at her town where people benefit from plenty of clothes and designs. She also sells gifts and some kitchenware. 

Today, in order to increase her store’s inventory, Hiba wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l.  She states that the loan will definitely help her diversify her selection and therefore will satisfy her customers' demands by offering them new collections of T-shirts, pants, etc. 

As for her future plans, she is seeking to make use of a new Kiva loan in coming years as she plans to also sell shoes and maybe some women's  accessories from her shop.

loans.use: to increase her clothiing store’s inventory

loans.name: Shirley Marisela

texts.es: El cliente es de la zona de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Empezó en este negocio por motivación de una amiga de su barrio que le mostró que por medio de la venta de ropa podía ganar dinero.  Sale sola todos los días, a recorrer con su mercadería y venderla a sus amistades o clientes desde las 8 am hasta las 6 pm.  Es casada y su esposo es guardia de seguridad en una compañía.  Tiene un hijo de 5 años, pero no va a la escuela todavía.  Desea en un futuro poder seguir trabajando duro para su familia y también llegar a tener su local propio para comercializar su mercadería.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de blusas, zapatos y ropa interior.
texts.en:
This client is from Guayaquil’s Orquídeas sector.  She started her business encouraged by a neighborhood friend who showed her how she could earn money selling clothes.  

She heads out every day with her merchandise to go throughout the neighborhood selling it to her friends and customers from 8am until 6pm.  She’s married and her husband’s a security guard at a firm.  She has a five-year-old son but he does not attend school yet.  

She hopes in future to continue working hard for her family and also to someday have a shop of her own to sell her merchandise in.  She needs the loan now to buy blouses, shoes and underwear.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is a 44 year old married woman and a mother of three children ages 13, 14 and 17. She lives in  Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business selling various goods and items such as shampoo, candies, chips, canned goods, seasoning and condiments to the people in her place. This is the source of her income for 5 years now. Her husband works as a farmer and Gertrudes is motivated to help him by working hard on improving her business.

She is asking for a loan to buy two sacks of rice, canned goods and toiletries. It is her dream to continue working for the expansion of her store, so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Edisson Policarpio

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Empezó tiempo atrás con esta actividad, debido a que su familia creció y tuvo la necesidad de sustentarla de mejor forma.  Trabaja solo cuando le salen contratos o cachuelos.  Es casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de comidas y también es ama de casa.  Tiene 2 hijos, de 7 y 3 años, quienes van a la escuela fiscal del sector.  Desea a futuro poder ampliar su vivienda y tener un local con amplio surtido de productos, para tener mejores ingresos y darle una mejor vida a su familia.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de pinturas y brochas para su actividad cotidiana.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Orquídeas sector of Guayquil.  He started in this line of work some time ago because his family was growing and he needed to have a better way of supporting them.  The borrower works alone whenever he obtains contracts or impromptu work assignments.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker and also sells food.  They have two children, ages 7 and 3, who attend a state school in the neighborhood.  In the future, he would like to expand his home and open a store that is stocked with an ample inventory of products so that he can generate more income and provide a better life for his family.  

For now, the borrower needs this loan so that he can buy paints and brushes that he will use in his everyday work.

loans.use: to buy paints and brushes for his work.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis, de 53 años de edad, está casada con Aurelio y tiene 03 hijos a los que quiere mucho. Juntos viven cómodamente  su casa propia. Gladis se dedica a la confección y venta de ropas interiores de damas y caballeros, para lo cual cuenta con una maquina que compró con sus ahorros. También vende comidas tanto desayunos como almuerzos en el frontis de su casa. Iniciándose hace más de 21 años en la costura, 03 años en la venta de comidas, confeccionando primero para sus familiares y vecinos, ahora ha logrado hacer crecer sus clientes gracias a sus buenos trabajos, contando con la ayuda de su hermana quien también está aprendiendo éste oficio de la confección. Tenía dificultades económicas en su hogar por la falta de empleo, por ello puso un negocio para generar sus propios ingresos económicos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 3500 nuevos soles, comprará materiales de confección como telas, blondas elásticas y otros materiales.
texts.en:
Gladis, 53, is married to Aurelio and has three children whom she loves a lot.  They live together comfortably in their own house.

Gladis earns a living making and selling men's and women's underwear with a machine that she bought with her savings.  She also sells breakfast and lunch in the front part of her house.  She started sewing 21 years ago and selling food three years ago.  In the beginning she sewed for her family and neighbors.  Thanks to her good work and the help of her sister, who's also learning the trade, she has managed to expand her clientele.

Gladis had financial problems in her home because of a lack of work, so she set up a business to generate her own income.  This is her fourth Kiva loan and she's grateful for the financial help she receives so she can get ahead.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

Gladis will buy fabric, stretch lace, and other sewing supplies with the requested amount of 3500 nuevos soles [PEN].

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Wendy Eunice

texts.es: Wendy, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo y reside en el municipio de San José de Colinas. Wendy tiene dos años de dedicarse a su propio negocio de venta de comidas como ser Baleadas, pupusas de chicharrón y quesillo,  tajadas con carne, tacos, pollo frito y pastelitos rellenos con carne.  Este negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar una plancha para hacer las pupusas y tortillas de las baleadas y también comprar la materia prima para elaborar las comidas. Su plan es ver a su negocio crecer y poder obtener sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
33-year old Wendy lives with her common-law husband in the municipality of San José de Colinas. She has earned her living for the past two years selling food such as flour tortillas, corn tortillas with pork and cheese, fried plantains with meat, tacos, fried chicken, and meat-filled pastries. She runs her business out of her home.

Wendy is seeking a loan to buy a special machine to make the tortillas and ingredients for the food. She hopes to see her business grow and thus bring in more income.

loans.use: buy a special machine to make the tortillas and food ingredients

loans.name: Jose Miguel Angel

texts.es: José de 48 años de edad es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y maicillo; sus productos son de muy buena calidad los comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. José  solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
José, 48, is very kind and hardworking.  He lives with his wife and two children.  He works very hard on his own land growing high-quality corn and sorghum he sells in various markets near his place of residence.  

José is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to have the necessary money to buy agricultural supplies like pest control, fertilizer, manure and seeds, among others needed for his crops.  He hopes to increase sales to earn higher profits and give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael lives in Malindi which is north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a 37-year-old married businesswoman. She has been in the fish business for the last six years and also sells charcoal. She knew Milango through friends and now would like to take a loan to buy a freezer for storing fish. She hopes that her business will grow and she will become a supplier in the next five years. The major challenges in the business are competition and price changes. The extra income that she will raise will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena de 32 años de edad se dedica al comercio de ropa calzado y perfumería en general, sus clientes están ubicados en su propio barrio y en los alrededores de este, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 8 a 12 años. Hace 2 años estaba trabajando como auxiliar administrativa en una ferretería y desde allí caminaba su actividad comercial, para complementar los ingresos familiares, pues su cónyuge trabaja prestando servicios de transporte en una motocicleta. Cuando Elena quedó desempleada, se dedicó completamente a su actividad comercial, vendiendo a crédito desde las 7 dela mañana hasta las 7 de la noche con sus descansos alimentarios y sus compras las hace a proveedores que le ofrecen los mejores precios del mercado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado y perfumería para la venta, porque responderá a encargos que desde ahora han hecho sus clientes. Su meta es lograr crecimiento en su negocio, para más tarde ayudar a sus hijos, a que se conviertan en unos profesionales excepcionales y con mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Elena is 32 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 8 and 12. She works selling clothing, footwear and perfume. Her customers come from the neighborhood where she lives with her family, and from the surrounding area.

Two years ago, while working as an administrative assistant in a hardware store, Elena began her business to supplement the family income. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. When she lost her job, she started working at her business full-time. She sells on credit from 7 in the morning until 7 in the evening, taking breaks for meals and to purchase products from suppliers who give her the best prices available.

Elena is requesting her first loan with Kiva and the field partner to buy clothing, footwear and perfume to sell. She says that she will be able to fill the orders that her customers have placed from now on. Elena says that her goal is to expand her business so that she will be able to help her children to become distinguished and successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear and perfume to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina, de 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en compañía de sus 02 hijos de 15  y 06 años respectivamente, habitando cómodamente la casa de su abuela. Gina se dedica a la venta de cosméticos , los cuales compra por catálogo y los vende entre sus amistades, sus vecinos, desde hace 02 años, paralelo a  eso también elabora adornos a mano, contando con el apoyo de su madre en la elaboración de estos productos. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera los ingresos económicos necesarios para poder apoyar a sus hijos, además de poder manejar sus tiempos libres para atenderlos, comenta que tiene un buen negocio ya que es de baja inversión y rentable, viendo los buenos resultados desea ampliar con la venta de zapatos femeninos. Este será su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles comprara más cosméticos y materiales para elaborar sus productos a mano.
texts.en: Gina is a single 31-year-old mother and lives with her two children, who are age 6 and 15. They live comfortably in her grandmother's home. She sells cosmetics, which she purchases from catalogs and then sells to her friends and neighbors. In parallel to this, for the last two years she has been making crafts by hand with the help of her mother. She likes her business since it generates income that she needs in order to support he children, and it also allows her to set her own schedule so she can tend to her children. She reports that she has a good business since it is profitable and requires little investment. Having seen good results, she wishes to expand and begin selling women's shoes. This will be her second loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support which enables her to continue in her business activities. She promises to make her loan repayments in a punctual manner. With the sum she is seeking, 800 nuevos soles, she will purchase more cosmetics, as well as materials for making her crafts.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, as well as materials for making her crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con sus padres y su hermana, es un joven muy trabajador, honesto y responsable, se dedica  a la elaboración de hamacas de poliéster desde hace varios años, comercializa su producto de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias ayuda en los gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, el cliente solicita un crédito para la compra  de material de poliéster así como muestra la fotografía para poder seguir produciendo mas, ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder seguir ayudando económicamente en los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
This client lives in a house of his own with his parents and his sister.  He’s a very responsible, hardworking young man who has been making polyester hammocks for several years.  He sells them from place to place in various neighborhoods near his house earning profits he uses to help with household expenses that come up at home.  

He’s asking for a loan to buy polyester material like that shown in the photo to continue producing more since this is his only source of work to continue helping economically with expenses at home.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Kushinga Kwemadzimai Group

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Florence from Murehwa, a village 75 km northeast of the capital city, Harare. She is divorced with three children, two of whom are attending school. Florence runs a vending business selling fruits and vegetables. The business has been in operation for 12 years. She says the main challenge she faces is a lack of adequate working capital to buy fruits and vegetables. Florence has requested a loan of $400 to buy fruits and vegetables for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future Florence plans to own a fruit and vegetable retail shop in town.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Farkhanda

texts.en:
Farkhanda, age 34, is a married woman. 
She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother she wants to provide more for her children; this is the reason she works hard to support her children.
She has been sewing clothes since the birth of her two children, when she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything their children needed. Then she decided to start tailoring work at home and is now sewing clothing for her community. 
She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community. 
She has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 
Farkhanda is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is 35 years old and married to Linet who runs a grocery store. Harun is the father of three children, aged 5, 2 and 6 months.

Harun buys and sells cereals to earn a living. He has been in the business for the last ten years. He earns a monthly income of approximately Kes 26,000. He learned about Kadet from one of his regular customers. Harun has been advanced a first loan of Kes 15,000 which he will use to buy more cereals for resale. He will use the proceeds to purchase a motorcycle for transport. He will also educate his children.

He hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase cereals for resale.

loans.name: Darwin Eduardo

texts.es: Darwin, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de La Flecha, Santa Barbara. Hace 5 años cuenta con un negocio de una pulpería (productos de canasta básica, lácteos, embutidos, carnes, queso, refrescos, productos de limpieza etc.), y taller de calzado (en la elaboración o reparación de zapatos como ser chinelas, zapatos escolares para niña o niño, tenis, etc.) las dos actividades las realiza en su casa. El prestamo que solicito es el tercer ciclo con la institución y es por  25,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir  en la compra de mas productos para la pulpería y más materiales para el taller de calzado como ser hilos, cuero y otros. Su meta es tener los negocios libres de deudas, estar siempre son la familia y ver crecer los negocios día a día.
texts.en:
Darwin is 42 years old, married with two children, and lives in the town of LaFlecha, Santa Barbara.

He has been in business for five years. He has a grocery store (basic food products, dairy products, sausages, meat, cheese, soft drinks, cleaning products, etc.), and a shoe shop (making or repairing shoes such as slip-on shoes, school shoes for girls or boys, tennis shoes, etc.). Both of these activities take place at his home.

He is asking for his third loan from the institution in the amount of 25,000 lempiras and he will invest it in the purchase of more products for his grocery store and more supplies for his shoe shop, such as thread, leather, and other items. 

His goal is to have his businesses debt free, always be family owned, and to see his businesses grow day by day.

loans.use: to supply his grocery store with food products and to buy raw materials for his shoe shop

loans.name: Isaac Antonio

texts.es: Isaac de 59 años de edad vive junto a su esposa  y sus tres hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, Isaac se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que aprovechar las oportunidades lo llevaran un paso más adelante del éxito; él quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abonos, controles de plagas, fertilizante, etc. Isaac tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Isaac, 59, lives with his wife and three children.  He works growing corn, beans and sorghum and has been working in agriculture for many years so has much experience in this line of work.  He’s very well-known in the zone and has a good clientele for he gets the best crops.  Therefore, he sells high-quality products at very affordable prices and service is unequaled.  

Isaac is noted for his great kindness.  He’s an enterprising man who very much wants to get ahead.  He believes that taking advantage of opportunities will take him one step further towards success.  

He wants to increase production but needs capital assistance to do so which is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy seeds, manure, pest control, fertilizer, etc.  Isaac has references that attest to his faultless morals; he’s responsible and pays his debts.  He trusts that he’ll be able to respond to this debt as well while at the same time provide his family with a fulfilled life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Pastora Elsa

texts.es: Doña Pastora  vive en casa propia con su nieta de 8 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, ella  posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pastora lives in a house of her own with her 8-year-old granddaughter who is attending school at present.  She owns a store where she sells basic staples, beans, milk, eggs and bread, among others.  She’s been in business many years and has gained much sales experience that leads to obtaining higher profits.  The store is located at home in a very busy area.  It’s quite well-known by local residents and has a large clientele for the store is well-stocked.  

She wants to increase business and make a new investment but needs capital to do so which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy what the store needs.  She is sure to repay the loan while at the same time trusts that she’ll provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a 28-year-old man from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is married with three children ages 1, 3 and 6. 

Noel has been fisherman for eight years now in order to support his family. He works hard so he can provide for his children. 

He is asking for a loan to buy diesel, engine oil, flashlight, battery and rice for his family. He is determined to improve his fishing inputs so he can be more productive and he can sustain his family's needs. 

In the future, he hopes to be able to send all his children to school.

loans.use: to buy diesel, engine oil, flashlight, battery and ric for his family

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
This is Anna, 36, a resident of Philippines. She is married to Efren, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anna owns and oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one (14-16 person capacity) jeepney unit, which are paying boundary (daily quota)* each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1.000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. 

Anna dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Khurelpurev

texts.en: Khurelpurev, 24 years old, lives with his mother, wife, and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a server at a pub and rendering taxi service to local people since 2010. His mother is a senior worker at a health center. Using his previous loan, Khurelpurev has purchased an electric car and his taxi income increased substantially. Now he is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas. A natural gas vehicle wastes less fuel and the cost arising from it is less than that of an electric car. Also a natural gas vehicle's emissions are cleaner.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 51-year-old married father of three children. He is a retired soldier.

For the past eight years Mahmoud has maintained a perfumery where he prepares and sells perfumes. It is his family’s main source of income, so he’s been working hard to develop it. At the beginning he faced many problems because he didn’t have experience in this domain, but now his customers recommend him to others.

Today Mahmoud is applying for a 1,000 USD loan through Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua to add accessories, bags and other merchandise to his shop so as to expand his business and diversify his products. In the future he is going to add school supplies to his shop.

loans.use: to add accessories, bags and other merchandise to his shop

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
This is Felix. He previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase farm supplies needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Felix would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan, which he will be using to buy fertilizer, seeds and other supplies for the maintenance of the farm. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Felix dreams that his farm will be larger and hopes to make a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his life and business and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and other supplies for his farm.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 45 year old woman who is engaged in a small eatery business where she offers viand, macaroni soap, pancit and mikki (noodles).

Every day, she wakes up early in the morning to prepare and cook the food and then sell it. She has been running this business for three years. According to Delia, she earns more or less PHP 500 per day, and this amount goes toward her daily expenses.

She wishes to grow her business and make it a viable source of income. For her to obtain her goal, she decided to seek a loan of PHP 10,000 as additional working capital to buy meat, vegetables, macaroni, pancit (noodles) as well as soft drinks. She knows that her hard work will lead her towards success.

loans.use: to buy food items and soft drinks for food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy office materials like papers, official receipts and glue

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es una madre soltera, la cual es muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación lugar posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad que ella posee, Francisca desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y así ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Francisca is a single mother. She is very responsible and her main goal in life is to help her children get ahead. She makes and sells tortillas every lunchtime and evening; her business is located in her house and she has many customers because of her friendliness.

Francisca wishes very much to improve her business as it provides her with a stable income to support her family. So she is seeking a loan to buy maize at wholesale prices and cal so she can make a larger quantity of tortillas especially at weekends when there is a greater demand because many tortilla makers close. In this way Francisca will be able to earn more money allowing her to have greater economic stability.

loans.use: buy maize at wholesale prices and cal

loans.name: Embassy 1A Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her early 30's, is married with two children who are in school.  Asha has been running her restaurant business for seven years and she works from 5:00am to 6:00pm each working day. She makes a fair profit from her business.

This will be Asha's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to stock her restaurant with cooking supplies (e.g., sacks of rice, baking flour, maize flour, beans, sugar) and to buy cooking oil.  She managed to successfully pay back all her previous loans. She used her profits to finish building her house and cover household expenses.  

Asha will use this loan to expand her restaurant and to buy additional cooking supplies. Her dream is to open another successful business.  

She will share this loan with her loan group, Embassy 1A Group, which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to expand her restaurant and to buy additional cooking supplies.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar de 48 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 30 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz, maicillo y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Don Oscar está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar  insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en: Forty-eight-year-old Oscar has worked in agriculture for the last 30 years, and that has given him the ability and knowledge necessary to tend to his crops. His principal plants are corn, sorghum, and beans. He sells his crops in bulk grain stores that are near his place of residence. The earnings he receives  from his sales help with his family's expenses; he lives with his wife and two children. Oscar is requesting a loan to enable him to buy farming supplies that will help him with his planting such as: manure, seeds, fertilizer, etc., so he can have better profits and continue helping with the household expenses without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa de 44 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con sus  tres hijos y su nieta, ella se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Josefa es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, etc. para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Josefa is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her three children and her granddaughter. She works making and selling clothing. The business is located in her home. Josefa is an incredible woman, very exemplary, and she is hardworking, responsible and positive as well. Many people offer good personal references of her and her work.

She makes a variety of clothing at affordable prices. She also offers good quality work which is a reason many people prefer her. She has been doing this work for many years and has a lot of experience and above all she has regular customers who rely on her more each day.

She has made the decision of asking for this loan from Integral in order to invest in her small business buying the necessary supplies such as: fabric, thread, elastic, etc., in order to make a variety of clothing.

She is doing all this in order to provide better service to her customers so that they feel motivated to continue using her services and so her sales and  earnings are increased. She hopes to achieve her goal and to better her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, etc. for her home based business

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
This is Rufina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. It also helped in the education of her children. Her business has been running for 13 years now, and it continues to grow. Her income from business is being used in her everyday expenses at home. She and her husband, who is an electrician, are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for a new 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rufina hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn dreams that her business will flourish even more and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. At these meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.
