*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Chanry's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Chanry is 35 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are still in school.

To support the family Chanry and her husband have been farming rice for five years. This earns her family about 30,000 KHR a day and is used to meet the family’s needs.

Chanry has been a member of Kiva’s partner VisionFund for five previous loan cycles. She successfully used the past loans to better support her family through sufficient food and her children’s education fees.

Chanry is the leader of this two-member group and is applying for a 1,300,000 KHR loan. With her portion she will buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current income so she can improve her family’s living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en:
Hussien is a 23-year-old single man from Iraq. He completed high school with high grades, and in 2005 he opened a body car repair shop. His customers appreciate the quality of his work. 

He is also a third year law student. His college is far away from his home. Every year he faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the study year because of the additional expense of covering college fees, transport from his governorate to his college in another governorate, books, and house rent. 

With this loan, he can accommodate all these expenses and finish his college study. Hussien's vision is to get a masters degree in the future. 

The story of Hussien is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients that are able to get better education.

loans.use: to pay for his college tuition, books, and house rent.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 31-year-old, married woman. She has been doing embroidery work with a machine at home to support her family. Her husband owns a small mobile repair shop, but earns an insufficient income to support her family. 

She has become an expert in embroidery by using a machine, but a few days ago, her machine broke due to continuous work. Now she wants to buy a new embroidery machine to continue her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan to buy an embroidery machine so that she could sew more embroidered dresses to sell and increase their income.
 
She is a mother of a daughter, and is motivated to provide for her family. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her daughter. Kaneez says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Alies' Group

texts.en:
Alies is a 47-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 4 children, her 2 sons also doing jobs as a laborers on daily wages. Her 2 daughters help her in daily routine work.

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and she will hand over the whole amount to her husband. Her husband will utilize the amount partially for their restaurant and partially for their scrap business. Her husband owns a restaurant in morning and scrap dealing work starts after noon. 

Alies requested a loan for her husband. He will use this amount partially for his restaurant to buy vegetables, beef, chicken, and pulses for cooking, and a partially for his scrap business to buy scrap goods such as iron, plastic accessories etc. With the increase in the household expenses, she wants to grow the business as well. She wants to save the profits so that she can arrange the marriage of both her daughters. Alies hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon.

Alies is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: Use loan amount partially to buy vegetables, beef, chicken and pulses for restaurant and partially to buy scrap goods such as iron, plastic accessories, etc. for scrap business.

loans.name: Savdy's Group

texts.en:
Savdy is originally from a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province. She is a 28-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is in school while the other two are still too young to attend.

Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for the past five years. She and her husband earn about 33,000 KHR a day to meet their family’s needs. They also manage to save about the same amount daily for future needs.

Savdy is the leader of this two-member group. She is applying for a 1,800,000 KHR loan through Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She plans to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She expects this loan will help her grow healthy and abundant rice crops. With her profits she hopes to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Gilma Rosa

texts.es: Gilma es una madre soltera de un hijo de 9 años. Ha trabajado durante 8 años vendiendo mercancía por diferentes municipios de la región, ofreciendo zapatos, blusas, pantalones y artículos para el hogar; pero hace algún tiempo se vio obligada a dejar esta actividad debido a que estuvo a cargo de un familiar que sufría de una grave enfermedad. La cliente cuenta con amplia experiencia como comerciante independiente, por esta razón desea reiniciar su actividad; para ello solicita el crédito, pues desea invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (zapatos, jeans, blusas, camisetas, tenis, entre otros), con lo que espera volver a generar ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Al comprar en grandes cantidades, ella puede ampliar el margen de utilidad que recibe por cada venta; de esta manera se abrirá paso par que en un futuro pueda cumplir el sueño de tener un almacén ubicado en alguno de los municipios en los que realiza sus ventas, que le genere mejores ingresos y así poder dar a su hijo una buena educación.
texts.en:
Gilma is a single mother with one son, age 9. For eight years, she worked selling various merchandise such as blouses, pants and household items in the different municipalities of the region. It has been some time now since she felt obligated to put her business on hold in order to take care of family member who was seriously ill. 

Gilma is described as someone with a lot of experience as an independent retailer and who is eager to restart her business. She is requesting this loan to buy shoes, jeans, blouses, tee shirts, sneakers and other merchandise at wholesale prices. Gilma says that by buying in large quantities she can improve her profit margin with each sale. She hopes that this will allow her to realize her dream of having a store in one of the municipalities where she now makes her sales. Gilma hopes to increase her income to be able to give her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy shoes, jeans, blouses, tee shirts, sneakers and other merchandise at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 52 years old and married with five children. Two of her children attend school and the others have finished school. Three years ago, she decided to start a school that concentrates on early childhood education. The school has grown and this is where Laura spends the entire day teaching and caring for the children.

Laura is asking for a loan to buy desks and books for the children to use at the school. She hopes that her business will grow into a primary school and she will be able to serve more students. Her challenge is that some parents fail to pay school fees, making it difficult for her to run the school. The extra income that she will raise will improve her living standards and pay school fees for her remaining children.

loans.use: to buy desks and books for her school.

loans.name: Azhra

texts.en:
Azhra is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother to six children. Her husband works for a firm and with his contribution, her family has a happy life. 

A few years ago, Azhra started a sewing school business in her home to help meet their household expenditures. She has sewn for many years, and is an expert in sewing fine clothes. Azhra decided to teach her art to the young girls in her area. She is earning more income and sharing her skills with others, also. She teaches and sews for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to the lack of funds, however, she is unable teach all of her students because she does not have enough sewing machines for her students to use for practice. She contacted BRAC Pakistan for a loan to buy an additional sewing machine for her students’ use. She expects a boost to her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for use in her sewing school.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Yat is 39-years-old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has four dependent children, two of whom are in school. Corn planting is the primary source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for ten years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 50,000KHR per day.

This is the second micro loan for Yat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Yet will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Thy is aged 45 years and married with three children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. To make a living and support his family, Thy and his wife have been farming rice as primary business for fifteen years.
This is the first micro loan for Thy’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading his group to request a loan, Thy, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy rice seeds for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to cultivate his rice in order to earn more income to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for his farmland.

loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
Chorn is aged 23 years and married with one son and they live in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. He and his wife earn a living through farming rice which they have been doing for six years. To supplement their income, he and his wife also work as paid workers and sell foods in the village. The current business earns them about 20,000KHR per day and allows them to save about 14,000KHR each day for the future needs.

Chorn has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Chorn successfully used the first loan to better support his family and increase his family’s business. Now he is leading his group to apply for another loan. As the leader, he wants to use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice successfully and increase his current business in order to better his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en: Mylene has five children and she resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she works as a cook in a private company to make a living. She always find ways in order to earn an income to support the needs of her children. Her immediate need lately is to repair her house in order to have a better living with her family. The amount of 15,000 PHP that she borrowed from GDMPC micro credit will be of big help to realize her plan. In the future, she wants to see her children's success and an an improvement in their standard of living.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Patria works hard to support her family. Patria has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling soft drinks. Patria is borrowing 10,000 PHP to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Patria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon, a rural villager from Kandal province's Ksach Kandal district where crop farming is a popular business in the neighborhood, is 48-years-old and to make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and working for others for a fee. Together, she and her husband have been in this business for several years, earning about 40,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the sixth-cycle loan for Sokhon with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The past business loans, which she successfully paid back, have helped her to sustain her standard of living as well as her business in a gradual manner. This cycle, she is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for her oldest son’s university.  He is specializing in Management. She hopes highly that this loan will enable her to send her oldest son to university in order to help him obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for oldest son’s university.

loans.name: Kroen

texts.en:
Residing in the Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province, Kroen is 42-years-old and married. She has three children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Kroen has struggled to make a living through farming rice and selling dessert in the village. Kroen has been engaged in her business for several years and is able to earn up to US$17 per day. However, she is able to save only US$6 per day after deducting all related expenses.

Kroen has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, she is applying as a first-time borrower with VisionFund for a loan in order to pay for her daughter’s university fees for the remaining four years. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her daughter in university to pursue her degree so she can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university fees.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Marialyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marialyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Marialyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 45 years old and from Olkalou. She is married to Simon, who is a farmer, and they have four children, ages 27, 25, 23 and 21 years old, all adults.

She is a farmer who practices mixed farming.  It is a business that she has been running for the past ten years.

To enable her to buy planting seeds, fertilizer, and animal feed, she has applied for her third loan of KES 30,000 from Kadet Ltd. 

From her farming activities, Hannah earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.  She intends to use profits from her expanded business for paying school fees for her children and for expansion of her farming activities.

Her future dreams for her business are to be a successful farmer in her area, and her hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and animal feed.

loans.name: Kaingu

texts.en: Kaingu lives in the Malindi area north of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a 33-year-old unmarried businessman. For more than ten years, he has been practicing farming and and this has been his business. He saw a need for water for his farm and he decided to sink a borehole so that his farm could have enough water. He heard about Kiva partner Milango through friends and he seeks a loan in order to buy 87 bags of cement that he will use to build the borehole. He also own a motorbike that transports people for a fee in town. The challenge in farming is that the weather can not be depended upon. The extra income that he will be able to raise will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 87 bags of cement.

loans.name: Embassy 1B Group

texts.en:
Aisha, who is in her early thirties, is married with two girls who are in school. For a period of seven years now,Aisha has been running a beauty salon and selling cosmetics. She is doing great in her business. She works from 9:00am to 8:00pm every working day and she is able to make a small return per month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Aisha's third loan which she will use to buy more hair products, cosmetics and woman's shoes to resell. She used her previous loans to restock more cosmetics, hair products and she has paid back all her previous loans successfully. Aisha used her business profit to cover food expenses for her family, pay school fees and reinvest back to her business. She dreams to expand her salon and also improve it by painting with nice color, putting aluminum doors and buying new shelves. 

Aisha will share this loan with her loan group "Embassy 1B" which consists of seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more hair products, cosmetics and woman's shoes to resell.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en: Oleg is a 41-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two sons in the Akhaltsikhe district. His son works on renovation and earns a small monthly income. Oleg has been involved in the taxi business for 18 years. He is very experienced in this field. Oleg needs to purchase a bigger car (his existing one has only two doors) to serve his clients as a taxi driver. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $2,500 to purchase a car with four doors. His clients will complain less when he has a bigger car.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is a 38-year-old married woman living with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband drives a van in Lahore city where he provides the services of pick-up and drop-off to female students. In the evening he uses his vehicle for loading and unloading in the market. Due to continuously working the van has gotten depreciated and there is an urgent need for maintenance.

Therefore, her husband came along with Farzana and requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan which is the field partner of Kiva. Farzana hopes that through this amount her husband will be able to repair the van so that he can drive it again. 

Farzana belongs to a poor family and her husband is the only earning person and he does not have any other source of income.
 
Farzana seems very glad and says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: for the maintenance of a van.

loans.name: Cerilyn

texts.en:
Cerilyn is married, with one child. 

She helps her husband in their vulcanizing shop to make a living. She plans to improve their shop, having proper tools available and accessories for the services they offer. 

Cerilyn has borrowed PHP 10,000 to purchase additional tools and accessories. 

She hopes to have a better living in the near future and to able to provide the needs of her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and accessories.

loans.name: Oscar Ernesto

texts.es:
Oscar de 45 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos de 23 años de edad, de 18 años de edad, de 13 años de edad, de 12 años de edad y de 2 años de edad. Dos de ellos estudian y el mayor trabaja de albañil. Oscar solo estudio hasta noveno grado debido a las malas condiciones económicas en que vivía su familia. Con Oscar viven 6 personas mas y todas dependen de sus ingresos.

Tiene 36 años de ser agricultor, aprendió con su padre, siembra maíz, maicillo y frijol. También tiene un  trabajo de medio tiempo con la alcaldía de su comunidad, presta servicios como electricista, para llegar viaja 5 kilómetros en autobús, mientras sus hijos se ocupan de las actividades agrícolas.

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de insumos agrícolas, Fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas, para sembrar 7,000 mts cuadrados de maíz.

Con la ganancia de la venta de granos, espera tener el dinero suficiente para comprar un par de bueyes para arar la tierra la siguiente temporada agrícola y no tener que pagar aparte para que la preparen la tierra..
texts.en:
Oscar, 45, is married with five children: 23, 18, 13, 12, and 2 years old. Two of them are students and the oldest works in construction. Oscar only studied up to ninth grade, owing to the poor economic conditions in which his family lived. Oscar lives with six other people and they all depend on his income. He has 36 years of farming experience, which he learned with his father. He plants corn, sorghum, and beans. He also has a part-time job in the mayor's office of his community where he offers electrician services. To get there he travels 5 kilometers by bus, while his children take care of the farm work. 

The loan will be used to purchase farming supplies, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides to plant 7,000 square meters of corn. With the profits from selling the grains, he hopes to have enough money to buy a pair of oxen to plow the land next farm season, as not to have to pay separately to prepare the land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides to plant corn.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: This time, Gemma is borrowing a new loan of Php 29,500 in order to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. The fishing business that she previously funded through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) and KIVA continues and provides for Gemma and her family an increased income to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Al-Khir Al-Waytat Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Khir Al-waytat. It consists of five women. They have applied for a loan of 230,000 YER from AMB in order to solve their immediate financial problems. Aisha is the leader of this group. A native of Sana`a, the borrower is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. One of them attends primary school. She makes every effort to rear her children well. She has a small house and would like to renovate the house. She has requested this loan in order to buy building materials to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha lives and works outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Elisha is married, and has seven children. He has been farming for twenty years, and is currently growing maize, tending to an orchard and rearing livestock. Elisha likes beekeeping because the bees require little oversight: it “can’t tie you [to an area] like cattle, for instance.”

This is Elisha’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to improve his farming activities. His hope for the future is “to educate my children with ease.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Benelly

texts.en:
Benelly is 42-years-old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Benelly is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Benelly has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a thirty-two-year-old man who lives in the rural areas of Rakai, central Uganda. He has a business of seasonal agriculture that he has been in for the last 13 years. He usually deals in seasonal maize growing and banana agriculture that he harvests after two weeks. With the loans from UGAFODE, he has managed to buy a small motorcycle which helps him with trade. He has also managed to plant a eucalyptus forest of about three acres, making improvements to his shelter. 

He hopes to use the loan advanced to him to buy seeds for the coming rains and to prepare farmlands for propagation. In the future, he hopes to open up a small retail shop in his locality, a dream that he can realize through UGAFODE.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is the 58-year-old married father of four children. He has a convenience store where he sells candies and canned foods and many other food supplies in addition to ice cream during the summer. He is his family’s sole breadwinner; he puts so much effort into developing his business to make sure that it will provide him with a good income to cover his family’s increasing needs.

Moustafa is a Palestinian refugee who lives and works in a Palestinian camp, just like almost all of the Palestinians living in Lebanon. He is a hard worker, and he has good experience in his business. 

He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with special goods to diversify his products and increase his income. He will increase his canned goods sector and buy specially offered products that will attract customers’ attention and create in them the need to acquire these products.

Concerning the future, Moustafa is working hard to keep on expanding and increasing his work capital to move to a bigger place.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special goods to diversify his products and increase his income.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda runs a cafeteria in Ozamiz City to make a living. She is also engaged in her grocery business. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients and selected groceries for sale. She plans to use her generated profit as additional capital for the business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and selected groceries for sale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 46 years old and married with four children. Three of his children are in school. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Richard has a business buying and selling seafood in the Philippines. Richard has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafoods to sell.

Richard has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Richard would like to save enough money to continue to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Sheraton Group

texts.en:
Asha is in her late thirties and married with a daughter in school.  She has had her business supplying food items to hotels for seven years.  She works from 4:00am to 10:00am every working day.  She makes a fair profit per month.

This is Asha's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used her previous loans to restock crates of tomatoes, sacks of beans, and Irish potatoes.  She paid back all her previous loans successfully and used her profits for school fees, food for her family, and started to build a house.   She will use this loan to buy more sacks of rice to resell to hotels. Her dream is to be able to supply food to more hotels.  

Asha will share this loan with her group "Sheraton" which totals three members.  The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to resell to hotels.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en: Eter is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, three children and a daughter-in-law in a small village of the Gori district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 0.8 hectares of agricultural land, where different kinds of fruit are grown. Eter sells the harvested products to local retailers at a good price. In addition, she has a cow and sells milk. As the income is only seasonal, she decided to request a loan and start a grocery store. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 Gel to open a grocery store. The family will have a stable income and will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 46-year-old woman.  She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

The financial condition of her family is not good as her husband does not earn sufficiently to meet all household expenses.

She is the mother of two daughters and a son, her children are doing jobs as laborers from their childhood.  

Her husband owns a small tailoring shop and sews gent’s clothes only. He recently hired a tailor due to the burden of work but he does not have an extra machine.

Therefore, Azra has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new machine for the new tailor.

Azra is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a stitching machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Aminata from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children aged three and seven years.  She began her business because she wanted to create an income to support her children and herself. In 2009, Aminata established her palm oil business.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 9:00pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase a gallon of palm oil to resell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, Aminata plans to own the biggest local food store in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a gallon of palm oil to resell.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is 48-years-old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Mira works very hard to provide for them.

Mira runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Mira has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as soap, toothpaste, shampoo, cooking oil and other groceries. 

In the future, Mira would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Almakan

texts.ru: Алмакан 42 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Алмакан - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Алмакан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Алмакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 овец, а также имеет земельный надел мерою 1, 60 ГА, на котором ежегодно выращивает перец, фасоль, клевер, кукурузу и свёклу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алмакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Алмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Almakan is 42 and a widow. After the death of her husband she raised three children on her own as well as taking care of her farm. Almakan has a specialist high school education and raises crops and livestock as the primary source of income for her family, something she began 23 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 3,000 KGS. Thanks to Almakan's hard work, her farm now includes five sheep as well as 1.6 hectares of land under cultivation, on which she grows peppers, beans, clover, corn and beets every year, with a monthly income of 9,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her farm, Almakan has turned to microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 25,000 KGS to buy a cow to increase her number of livestock. She plans to invest income from the loan toward a further increase in head count of household cattle, and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru:
Нурали уроженец района Дж.Руми. Ему 52 года. Он семейный человек. В данный момент Нурали хочет заняться овцеводством. Овцеводство - одна из универсальных и наиболее перспективных отраслей в животноводстве. В Таджикистане наибольшее развитие эта отрасль получила на юге страны. Овцы достаточно скороспелы, а также неприхотливы к условиям содержания. 
Нурали не занимался такой деятельностью, но считает ничто не поздно начать. Он имеет сарай для содержания скота и немного сбережение. Нурали просит кредит в размере 1000 долларов США для закупа овец и их корма. Он собирается заниматься овцеводством сам. Нурали любит животных. Он по жизни светлый и добрый человек. Он действительно нуждается в кредите чтобы начать новый бизнес. И Вы можете ему помочь.
texts.en:
Nurali is a native of the J. Rumi region. He is 52 and a family man. At the moment Nurali wants to raise sheep. Sheep breeding is one of the universal and most promising branches of animal husbandry. In Tajikistan the development of this branch of industry has for the most part been in the south of the country. Sheep mature quite quickly and in addition are undemanding in terms of living conditions.

Nurali is a newcomer to this occupation, but feels that it's never too late to begin. He has a barn for livestock and some savings. He is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase sheep and feed. He is preparing to take care of the sheep on his own. Nurali loves animals and is a joyous and kind man. He really needs a loan so he can start his new business. And you can help him.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and feed

loans.name: Amanda Carolina

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Empezó desde temprano, dado que siempre le gustó la peluquería y estudió en algunas capacitaciones para esta actividad.  Realiza su labor en casa de su mamá de 10 am a 9 pm, todos los días.  No es casada y tiene un hijo de 3 años.  Desea que su hijo crezca sanamente y con buenas enseñanzas, para que pueda ser alguien útil a la sociedad.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de un espejo, tintes y otros insumos para su trabajo diario.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Orquídeas sector of Guayaquil.  At a young age she always enjoyed hairstyling, so she studied and took a few courses in this line of work.  The borrower works at her mother’s house every day from 10:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M.  She is not married and has a three-year-old child.  She wants her son to grow up healthy and have a good education so that he can be useful in society.  

For now the borrower needs a loan so that she can buy a mirror, dyes, and other supplies for her daily work.

loans.use: to buy a mirror, dyes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Simouy

texts.en: Simouy is 42 years old and a married mother of four children who are in school. She tackles rice farming for a living while her husband works at a construction site to supplement her income. This is the business that she has had for 10 years, earning about 37,800 KHR per day.  This not the first loan for Simouy with Kiva partner VisionFund. She has repaid her past loans with success to improve her living conditions and keep her kids in school. For this cycle, she is seeking a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crop and triple her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Khanarem

texts.en: Kanharem is 28 years old and a young mother of a little son. She strives to earn a living via a tailoring business which she runs at home. This business has returned her about 24,400 KHR per day.  This is the first loan for Kanharem with Kiva partner VisionFund.  She will spend her loan to buy a sewing machine and more materials to support her tailoring business. She hopes this purchase will help her meet her customers' demands on time and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and more materials to support her tailoring business.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong, age 56, is a resident of Kampong Thom province.  She is a mother of three children who are in school. For the rest of her family, rice farming of one hectare is her core income-generating business. She has been involved in her current business for 34 years.  This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. After her previous loans which she has fully paid back, she has improved her standard of living, especially  in providing daily decent food for her children and keeping them in school. Now, one of her sons needs to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in Hotel and Tourism management. Therefore, she has applied for an education loan to pay her son’s tuition fees. She hopes that her son can graduate with a good study record and get a good job.

loans.use: To pay her son’s tuition fees

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap is 44 years old and a married mother of six children. Nowadays, three children are in school. To earn a living, she sells desserts in a local school and works on a rice farm. To earn additional income, her husband plays traditional music instruments and helps her on the rice farm. This is the business that she has had for ages.  With Kiva partner VisionFund she is a fifth-time borrower. She is seeking an education loan to pay her son’s tuition fees. He wants to pursue his bachelor's degree specializing in Engineering. She hopes that this financial support will enable her son to pay more attention to his studies and get a good study score and get a good job.

loans.use: To pay her son’s tuition fees

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 22-year-old single woman from Jenin city. She lives with her parents in a small and simple house in the city. 

For the past year, Hanan has been working in a clothing store she owns. She sells women's clothes; she imports them from Turkey and other countries. She loves this job, and she always would like to improve it by expanding the store and buying more clothes to sell.
 
Hanan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her buy more women's clothing to sell for the Eid season. This will improve her store, and also her income will increase. 

Hanan appears in the photo while she was working in her store.

loans.use: to buy more women's clothing to sell for the Eid season

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Arlene successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Arlene's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is asking for a loan because she believes that it will help her improve her business.
Her previous loan enabled her to educate her son. However, she still operates her dairy farm business of selling milk. 

The loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting will help her purchase milking containers for her business.  She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: purchase milking containers for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 55 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Jocelyn has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She lives at her own house that has electricity, but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women, and curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase fabric and thread for her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread for her business

loans.name: Bulamu Women's Group

texts.en:
Herbert is our new client of the Institution who applied for ugx.500,000. He has operated a piggery and poultry business in the outskirts of the city for ten years. 

The purpose of the loan is to diversify his piggery business by buying animal feed and stocking more pigs. He is an honest and hard-working man, but he has always been constrained by financial issues in his business. He says given the loan, he will stock more piglets for the festive season. His main clients are well-wishers, and he also supplies to big pork joints within the city outskirts. 

He has future hope of expanding his business gradually to be able to earn a living.

The Ugafode credit officer in charge of the group in shown on the left in the black top.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma.Teresa is 59 years old and married with four children.

Ma.Teresa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Ma.Teresa has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years, and earns an income from clothing sales.

Ma.Teresa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business. The previous loan enabled her to save money from her salon business. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oils, shampoos, and hair conditioners. 

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date, has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oils, shampoos, and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Grigol

texts.en:
Grigol is a 57-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in a small village of Zestaponi district. Grigol is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has three cows and three calves. His wife produces cheese to sell. In addition, Grigol has a vineyard and sells wine. 

Grigol requested a loan to start a new business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL. With the received credit, he will rent a space, renovate it, and open a shoe workshop. 

He had worked in a shoe workshop and is experienced in this field. He will get orders to make different kinds of shoes. The Start Up program will enable him to be involved in his own business and thus increase the income for his family.

loans.use: to open shoe workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 31 years old and lives in Azerbaijan in Baku. He is married and has two sons, ages 5 and 3. His elder son is a schoolboy and the other son is going to kindergarten.

Ramil is a taxi-driver. He has been working for five years. He wants to change his car spare parts, cover, wheel, etc. Ramil needs a loan of 1,000 AZN. 
The reason he has applied to Kiva organization. 

He says many thanks to Kiva. He believes that the loan will help him increase his passengers, develop and earn much money.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married, with one child who goes to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  

Halima has operated a shoe-selling business for the past five years. In addition to the shoe business, she sells clothes. She cites seasonality as her major business challenge.

With the KES 30,000 loan, Halima wants to purchase sacks of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer muy trabajadora, es por ello que cada día trabaja con mucho esfuerzo en su humilde empleo como personal de limpieza de un hospital, con lo cual puede tener dinero para poder solventar su hogar y sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad; Yolanda cree que le esta yendo bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo humilde.

Yolanda gracias a los prestamistas kiva podrá comprar materiales para realizar, mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, especialmente en el pequeño cuarto donde duermen sus hijos ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a hard working woman, which is why every day she puts a lot of effort into her humble job as a janitor at a hospital. It gives her money to pay for her home and care for her 2 children, ages 13 and 11. Yolanda thinks that her work is going well because she is responsible and, above all, humble.

Thanks to the Kiva lenders, Yolanda will be able to buy materials to make improvements to the house where she lives, especially to the small bedroom where her children sleep, which is currently in bad condition. This way she can improve her family's quality of life and continue fighting to make her biggest dream a reality: "to own her home".

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Harding

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Harding from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with eight children, ages 19 to 30 years old. She began her business because she wants to create income to support her children and herself. 

In 1998, Harding established her local food stuff business. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m., Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Harding requires a loan in order to purchase more bag of fufu (cassava grain). She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children school fees and increase her business. 

In the future, Harding plans to own the biggest local food store in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bag of fufu (cassava grain) to expand her business.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is a 57-year-old, married man. He lives with his wife, two children, and mother in a small village of the Martvili district. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. 

Tamaz is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has two cows, a calf, and a pig. His wife milks the cows every day and produces dairy products to sell. In addition, Tamaz has nut trees and 0.3 hectares of land where maize is grown. He sells the harvested products to local retailers at a good price. 

Tamaz decided to start a new business and requested a loan. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of GEL 1,000 to start a new business. He will begin to locally trade in meat and fish. This will increase his income and, after that, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to begin trade in meat and fish.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 53 years old and married with two children. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elena has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack food, soap, spices and other groceries. 

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Isatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children, ages eight month and 13 years old.  She began her business because she wants to empower herself. 

In 2009, Isatu established her local food stuff business. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase gallons of palm oil, coconut oil and pepper. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children school fees and increase her business. 

In the future, Isatu plans to own the biggest local food store in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of palm oil, coconut oil, and pepper.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. Her husband runs a donkey cart, but his income is not enough to support their family, so she took initiative for this business. 

She has three years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. 

She is a mother five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, health, and education. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with increasing demand at her store. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Erimina

texts.en:
Erimina is asking for a  loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business. 

The previous loan enabled her to construct her rooftop. However, she still operates the food stall business. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase food items, tea leaves, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase food items, tea leaves, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been running a business stitching clothes for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also deals in the work of cloth trade to generate extra income. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Shahida requested for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and laces. It will help her meet the demands of her customers on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and laces.

loans.name: Musukala

texts.en:
Musukala is 40 years old and married with three children between the ages of 6 and 18 years. She runs a pharmacy in Waterloo Western, a rural area in Sierra Leone. Her children are going to school, and she also has three additional dependents at home.

Musukala sells malarial drugs, cholera drugs, and blood syrup within her community.  She has been in this business since 2010. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Musukala requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more malaria drugs, cholera drugs, and blood syrup for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to open a big clinic in her community. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more malaria drugs, cholera drugs, and blood syrup for resale

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en: Hameeda is 57 years old and a married woman and mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Hameeda’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Hameeda has applied for a loan of Rs 25000, for her son. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Hameeda is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Shehzadi

texts.en:
Shehzadi is 25 years old. She is young and a newly married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband works over a lathe machine and manufactures the spare parts of vehicles. He has been doing this business for many years and until this time, his business is very settled. Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some of its important parts have become depreciated and need replacement.

Her husband is a poor person and does not have a sufficient amount to buy spare parts to fix the problems of the lathe machine. Therefore, Shehzadi requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy spare parts for his lathe machine. 

Shehzadi hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of lathe machine

loans.name: Al-Krwan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Krwan, which consists of four women. They live in Aden, Yemen. They are hard-working and enterprising women. 

Nariman is the group's leader. She is a married woman who has 4 children. She is a housewife who lives with her family and has a good life. She has a small house and was able to renovate part of her house. Now, she intends to renovate another part of her house. So, she took out a second loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to remodel the other part of her house, and thus make it more comfortable for her family. She thanks her lenders for funding her first loan.

loans.use: to remodel her house.

loans.name: Christian Alex

texts.es:
Christian es un joven de 26 años de edad, que se gana el pan de cada día en esu humilde trabajo como obrero de un fundo agrícola, con lo cual puede solventar sus gastos de manutención, ya que es de condición humilde; Christian trabaja alrededor de 9 horas, asimismo con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su pequeño negocio e venta de patos, con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra; Christian cree que le está yendo bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y hace un buen trabajo.

Christian está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder construir jaulas para la crianza de patos y de esta manera los animales no se puedan escapar, así  podrá mejorar su negocio y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” estudiar la carrera de administración y tener una granja grande”.
texts.en:
Christian is 26 years old. He gains his daily bread as a simple worker on an agricultural estate. This pays his expenses although at a humble level. Christian works about 9 hours a day. With a lot of effort he has managed to start a small business selling ducks which gives him an extra income. Christian believes things are going well at his work because he is responsible and does good work. 

Christian is grateful to the lenders at Kiva. Thanks to the help they have given him he can buy construction materials so he can build cages to raise his ducks. This way they can't escape. So he will be able to improve his business and strive to realize his great dream: to study business administration and have a large farm.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Thamer

texts.en: Thamer is 20 years old. He lives at an area in Jordan called Karak with his family, which consists of 3 siblings and his parents. His father is in the military and his mother works at a governmental entity. He is studying for a Diploma in Social Services in his 2nd year. He is planning to continue into university in order to continue his studies until he gets his Bachelors degree. Thamer’s parents are currently facing some difficulties in paying for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat, age 38, is a responsible mother living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband operates a scrap shop from home and deals with the scrap goods.  He has been running this business for many years, with a lot of scrap scattered in his house.  Recently he constructed a room for a sibling, which is the reason there is not enough space remaining for the scrap business.  
Therefore, Nusrat requested a loan for her husband so that he could rent a scrap shop to continue his business and increase savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 
Nusrat says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: Taking loan to rent a scrap shop to continue scrap business.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is a 29-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has worked very hard for many years to get his family ahead and give them everything they deserve. He has a grocery store which is his main source of income. He started his business with limited capital and he operates well.  Many people prefer his store because he always has the basic staples at affordable prices, and he provides the best possible customer service. His dream is to see his store flourish. Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. So, he took a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to stock his business with more products so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back. His goal for the future is for his business to grow and to have more customer demand. He will then get more income, which will help meet the basic needs of his household.

loans.use: to stock his business with more products so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.

loans.name: Athra

texts.en: Athra was born in 1962.  She is married and a mother of 6.  Athra has been selling blankets for 1 year.  She started her project with a small quantity of blankets and found it profitable so she is now planning to expand her project by adding clothing sales.  She wants to buy clothes to raise her sales which may raise her income and help her support her family; but she doesn't have enough money to do so, and for this reason has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to trade.

loans.name: Hassanatu

texts.en:
Meet 19-year-old Hassanatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is single with no child for now.  She began her business because she wants to develop herself and her parents. In 2011, Hassanatu established her palm oil business.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 9:00pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Hassanatu requires a loan in order to purchase gallons of palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and enable her to attend a vocation school to learn hairdressing. In the future, Hassanatu plans to become a hairdresser. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Asysah

texts.en:
Asysah runs a small stall where she sells mobile phone airtime credits, and bill payments. Asysah lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Asysah is married and has children.

Asysah began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime credits and servicing bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. During the last  month, she has around $5 - 10 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, she took a loan from Kiva to buy a printer to support her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: To buy a printer to process bill payment transactions

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 50 years old and married with four children. She runs a slippers business in Waterloo in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. She has three additional dependent at home.

She's been in this business since 2004 and sells slippers within her community.  She says that the main problem in her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Alice requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more variety of slippers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and change her status of living. In the future, she would like to open a big bar and restaurant. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for resale.

loans.name: Kristeen  Michi

texts.en:
Kristeen Michi is 36 years old and a widow with three children.

Kristeen Michi works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy grocery products to sell.

Kristeen Michi has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns additional income from clothing sales.

Kristeen Michi aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to sell

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is a villager from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is 33 years old and a mother of three children, one of whom is still in school. The other two are too young for school. She and her husband work as paid workers to support their family.  She has been involved in this business for four years. This is the first microloan for Pov with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Now she is seeking a loan to build a house for her family. She hopes that she can make more income so that she will have a decent latrine.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Isatu from the Waterloo Eastern area of Freetown. She is married with three children between 5 and 10 years old.  She began her business because she wanted to create income to support her children and herself. In 2010, Isatu established her clothing business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase different types of clothing materials to expand her clothing business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and buy a piece of land. In the future, Isatu plans to own the biggest clothing shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase different types of clothing material to expand her clothing business

loans.name: Rafet

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Rafet from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with five children between the ages of 2 and 18 years. Two of her children attend school. She started this business to meet her family's daily needs.  Rafet runs a clothing business; she sells a variety of baby clothing material within the community, and she has been running this business since 2004. She works at the business from morning to night to introduce her goods. Rafet says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Rafet has requested a loan in order to buy more baby clothing material for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to import her goods from overseas. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more baby clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose luis es un hombre muy trabajador, para poder salir adelante y poder solventar sus gastos de manutención trabaja en su pequeño negocio de carpintería, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes al día, Jose cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es responsable y cumplido con sus clientes.

Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar una maquina rupeadora, ya que actualmente tiene una maquina que ya no funciona muy bien y los acabados de sus trabajos no están saliendo muy bien, de esta manera tendrá la herramienta adecuada para trabajar y podrá entregar un mejor trabaja a sus clientes, así mejorara sus ingresos y luchar para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” ampliar su negocio y tener una gran carpintería”.
texts.en:
José Luis is very hard-working.  To be able to get on in life and pay his maintenance bills he works in his small carpentry business, working about ten hours a day, in which time he can deal with up to ten clients.  José thinks that his work is going well because he is very friendly to his customers and above all because they find him responsible and reliable.

José is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help he will be able to buy a new router tool.  The one he has doesn’t work very well anymore and the finish on his work doesn’t turn out as well as it should.  In this way then, he will have the appropriate tool for his work which allows him to offer better quality to his customers.  In turn, this will improve his income and he can work towards making his dream come true; “to expand his business and have a great carpenter’s workshop”.

loans.use: to buy a new router tool

loans.name: Sonia Neeilly

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 27 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de técnico en contabilidad, con lo cual logro conseguir empleo en un pequeño estudio contable de su ciudad y luego con esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa, con el cual tiene un ingreso extra para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar; Sonia cree que le va bien en su negocio y en su trabajo porque es responsable y amable con sus clientes.

Sonia esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como polos, blusas, entre otros y atender el pedido de sus clientes, asimismo mejorara sus ingresos y seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en:
Sonia is 27 years old. With a great deal of hard work, she completed her accounting degree and got a job and a small accountant's office in her city. With more effort, she then started her own business selling clothing, which gives her extra income to cover her household expenses. Sonia believes that her business and her job are going well because she is responsible and friendly with her customers.

Sonia is grateful for the Kiva lenders because the support they offer her will allow her to buy products for her business such as polo shirts, blouses, and so on, and to meet her customers' needs. That way, she will increase her income and keep working to make her greatest dream--"to build a house from high-quality materials"--come true.

loans.use: to buy products such as polo shirts, blouses, and so on.

loans.name: Moeurn's Group

texts.en: Moeurn is 42 years old and residing in Battambang province. She is a mother of four little children. Her main source of income is a pineapple plantation. She has been involved in the current business for ages, and it has returned her about 30,000 KHR per day. This is the first microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for Moeurn.  She forms a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cash crop. She hopes that she can double her income from her agribusiness.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cash crop

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en: Sokly is 30 years old and one of the breadwinners in a family consisting of three children. Her main sources of income to meet the daily cost of living are rice farming and pineapple planting. This is the first loan for Sokly with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of two to get a loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion of 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her cash crops. She hopes that she can get a good yield from her crops so she can make more money.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cash crop

loans.name: Taramaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TARAMAYA”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Reyna es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de verduras, venta de carne, tejido de chompas, venta de fruta, costura de polleras, venta de ganado, lechería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Reyna es integrante, ella indica que hace diez meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de lechería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás, ya que el mismo fue un negocio familiar, posteriormente decide implementar un espacio independiente, ya que necesitaba generar recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ternero) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas y posteriormente a la crianza comercializará su producto a las empresas lácteas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantenerse en lo posible ya que ella es soltera y decidió independizarse.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Taramaya village bank is starting its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Achacachi regional center. The group has nine members and is led by a board that is chaired by Reyna. The group members have a variety of businesses, including weaving blankets, selling vegetables, sellig meat, weaving sweaters, selling fruit, sewing skirts, selling livestock, and dairy farming.

This loan will benefit the businesses of the group members, including Reyna. She says she has been part of Pro Mujer for ten months and joined at the invitation of a recruiter who came to her house. At the moment she has a dairy business. She says she started the business several years ago, that it was a family business first and then she decided to start up her own establishment because she needed the money.

She will use this loan to buy calves for her business at the markets in the region and then raise them and sell the dairy products. This work provides her with enough of an income to support her family, since she is unmarried and decided to go off on her own.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the information it provides on health and financing.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Ashyrbubu

texts.ru: Ашырбубу 59 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает 4 детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Ашырбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Ашырбубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Ашырбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 нетели, 2 теленка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ашырбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Ашырбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Ashyrbubu is 59 years old, she is a widow. She has raised four children herself after her husband's passing and also runs her business. Ashyrbubu has secondary education and does animal husbandry as a main source of income for her family which she started eighteen years ago with the purchase of cattle for 5,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Ashyrbubu now has two milk cows, two heifers and two calves. Her monthly income is 8,000 som. With the goal to further grow her business Ashyrbubu has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to buy calves to increase the headcount of livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of headcount of livestock and plans to save money to repair the house.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар 54 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитала троих детей, все дети живут и работают в России, помогают материально. У Дилбар - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Дилбар занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Дилбар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 9 дойных коров. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дилбар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Дилбар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Dilbar is 54 years old, she is a widow. She has raised three children herself after her husband's passing. All of her children live and work in Russia and help her financially. Dilbar has higher education and does animal husbandry as a main source of income for her family which she started thirteen years ago with the purchase of cattle for 5,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Dilbar now has nine milk cows. Her monthly income is 10,000 som. With the goal to further grow her business Dilbar has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy calves for feeding and further resale on the market at a higher price. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of headcount of livestock.

loans.use: to buy calves for feeding and reselling.

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex es un joven muy trabajador y sobre todo con ganas de salir adelante, trabaja como cajero en una empresa de supermercados de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos de manutención, alex cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es amable y responsable.

Alex esta agradecido con los prestamistas kva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podra realizar mejoras en el pequeño modulo donde vive con su familia, ya que comprara materiales como arena, cemento para mejorar los pisos, asi podra mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Alex is a very hard-working young man and above all he wants to get on in life. He works as a cashier in a city supermarket chain, which gives him an income to cover his living expenses. Alex thinks his work is going well because he is friendly and responsible.

Alex is grateful to the Kiva lenders since with the help they have given him he will be able to make improvements to the small modular home where he lives with his family. He will buy materials such as sand and cement to improve the floors and so he will be able to improve his family's quality of life and keep striving towards making his big dream a reality: to have his own house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with one child age that is 9 years old. Her child is attending school. She started a business to get provide income for her family.

Mariatu runs a retail business in which she sells palm oil, coconut oil and native rice at a particular busy market place. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. Mariatu says that the main challenges to her business are sometimes her vehicle breaks down on the way to work and a lack of capital to expand her business.

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to buy local food commodities like palm oil, coconut oil and native rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy local food commodities like palm oil, coconut oil and native rice.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Originally from Battambang province, Vanna is 47 years old and married. She is blessed with four children.
