Goderdzi is a 67-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, daughter and aunt. His aunt is provided with a retirement pension. Goderdzi is involved in agricultural activities. He has two cows and a vineyard. His wife milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. Goderdzi produces wine and sells to local retailers at a good price. 

He decided to start a new business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,000 GEL and start trade with clothing. He will purchase clothes form the wholesalers and then sell them among his villagers. This will increase his income.

loans.use: to begin trade with clothing.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 25 years old; he lives with his wife and his 2 children in Gaza. He has a store for selling school products. He earns a monthly income $650. He started his business on the first of November, 2012.

Mohamad needs this youth loan to repair a printer machine and buy new school products, especially since it’s the school season now.

Mohamad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: repair a printer and buy school supplies to sell

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas is a 62-year-old married father of three children. Since 1995, he has worked in distributing water for daily and agricultural use to villagers since lack of water is a major problem in Lebanon.

Nicolas is a hard worker and he puts much effort to reply directly to customer requests.
 
He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy bigger water storage tanks in order to store water to increase his water capital and respond to increasing customers’ requests.

Nicolas is planning to buy a new agricultural tractor that he will use to expand his working sector in agriculture as an additional income business.

loans.use: to buy bigger water storage tanks to store water to increase his water capital and respond to increasing customers’ requests.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia, esta separada del esposo tiene tres hijos vive con su señora madre que es mayor de edad  en la zona de Lllojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja como profesora Parbularia percibiendo un sueldo pequeño con el cual mantiene a su familia, tambien percibe una asistencia familiar para sus hijos.

El crédito lo requiere para pagar los gastos medicos de su señora madre quien se encuentra mal de salud y ella como es hija mayor debe hacerse cargo.

Es la cuarta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Claudia is separated and has three children. They live with her mother, who is an elder person, in the neighborhood of Lllojeta, in the city of La Paz. She works as a preschool teacher and receives a low salary to support her family. She also receives some family assistance for her children. 

She is requesting a loan to pay for her mother's medical expenses. She needs to take care of her as she is the oldest daughter. 

This is the forth time she works with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her dependent mother's medical expenses.

loans.name: Hassan's Group

texts.en:
Hassan is a member of this group from Iraq. Hassan is 30 years old; he is married and has three children. 

He has been working in the agriculture sector for 13 years. He is a hard worker who is specialized in growing palm trees and selling dates. Hassan takes good care of his production and makes sure that every tree has the care it needs to ensure high quality production.

Hassan will use this loan to purchase fertilizers, a water pump and upgrade his irrigation system to reduce water waste and control the growth of harmful weeds. 

Hassan expects that the loan will generate additional income that will enable him to fence his farm.

The story of Hassan and his farm is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, a water pump and upgrade his irrigation system.

loans.name: Azhar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Azhar, and consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They took out a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB. 

Safa is 23 years old. She has been selling basic products like clothes, perfumes, incense, among other things. She has had the business for few years and has many customers who come to her because it is the best-stocked place in the neighborhood. 

She needs to buy materials for her business but has no capital, so she is requesting a loan from AMB to allow her to buy clothes, perfumes, and incense among other things. 

She hopes to expand her business to get more profit.

loans.use: to allow her to buy clothes, perfumes and incense, among other things.

loans.name: Saffie

texts.en:
Saffie is 45 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and has five children between the ages of 13 and 21 years old who are in school and live at home. 

For the past seven years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market; spending eight hours on her business each day, from Monday to Saturday. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother. 

Saffie is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Saffie hopes to improve her children education even more and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Crisandra

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Crisandra works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Crisandra is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase spare parts for her tricycle.

Crisandra has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: est une femme de 54 ans mariée mère de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 24 ans et 36 ans. Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis des années. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour lui. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (alvéoles d'oeufs,huile, 1 sac de riz, palette de poisson, viandes, les crudités et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
The client is a 54 year old married woman, and the mother of six children between the ages of 24 and 36 years old. She opened and has been managing her own restaurant for years. It is thanks to this business that she is able to care for her family.

The fact that she has to purchase her restaurant supplies at retail prices means that she cannot earn much income on her end product. Hence the importance of this loan for her business, as it will allow her to increase her stock of ingredients (cartons of eggs, oil, a sack of rice, a pallet of fish, meat, vegetables and the seasonings needed to cook her dishes). She plans to reinvest a part of her income into her business, and the rest will help her provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Ciudadela Ferroviaria en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de seis horas en la preparación y atención del servicio de comida en una empresa privada .
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos de cocina(mas vajilla, ollas, sartenes, etc.) para dar mejor atención en el servicio que presta ya que desea atender mayor cantidad de comensales y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos, porque con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, transporte y pago de servicios básicos.
El sueño de Jaime es tener su propio restaurante ya que  es chef y también atender eventos para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Jaime is single and does not have children. He lives at his parents' house, located in the neighborhood of Ciudadela Ferroviaria, in the city of La Paz, and uses only one bedroom. He currently works for over six hours preparing food for a private company and providing customer service. 

He is requesting a loan to buy kitchen supplies (dinner service, pans, pots, etc.) so that he can provide a better service and reach a higher number of customers. This would allow him to increase his income and to cover his expenses in food, transportation and basic services. Jaime's dream is to have his own restaurant as chef and to serve at events so that he can improve his income and quality of life. 

This is the first time he requests a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy dinner service, pots, pans, etc. to provide a better service at the restaurant where he works serving customers.

loans.name: Leontine

texts.en:
Leontine is 36 years old. She owns a bar and has been running the bar for two years. 

She would like to buy more beer and soda for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children. She has moved from selling retail to owning a bar which she hopes will make more returns.

loans.use: To buy more beers and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 26-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working as a farmer since seven years ago, specializing in planting eggplants and bell peppers. Rana supports her husband in covering their family’s expenses. 

Today, she is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary seeds and fertilizers for her land, and will use part of the loan to buy firewood for the coming winter season to keep her beloved children warm. 

Rana loves her small business, and she hopes to stay healthy and capable of expanding and developing it to produce more products in the future.

loans.use: to buy the necessary seeds and fertilizers for her land and firewood for the coming winter season to keep her children warm.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Helen is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF  to purchase more frozen food to sell.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en: Rezo is a 48-year-old married man. He lives in a small village in the Sachkhere district with his wife and two children. His children go to school. Rezo is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has two cows. His wife milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. In addition, he has 1.25 hectares of land, where he grows maize and haricot. Rezo decided to start a new business and requested a loan. The start up loan, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to borrow 2500 Gel for purchasing two buffaloes. He will use them to transport wood from the forest to sell.

loans.use: to purchase buffaloes

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Jariatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 12 years. Two of her children attend school. She started a business to get her daily survival for her family.
 
Jariatu runs a cookery business; she sells cookery at her house. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business from 4:30; she will not rest until the food finishes. Jariatu says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Jariatu has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities, such as cooking season, oil and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. 

In the future, she plans to have a big cookery shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities, such as cooking seasonings, oil and rice.

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Monique est une femme de 39 ans, mariée, mère de famille. Elle a un atelier de couture qu'elle gère depuis 13 ans déjà dans un quartier de la capitale. Elle a une bonne clientèle mais se retrouve tout le temps en rupture de matériel parce qu'elle achète en petite quantité pour confectionner les vêtements qu'elle vend. Ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter en grande quantité son matériel de couture(accessoires, tissus) ce qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs, satisfaire sa clientèle et réaliser un bon profit. Ce bénéfice lui permettra non seulement de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille, mais aussi d'agrandir son activité avec le temps en achetant en grande quantité.
texts.en:
Monique is a 39-year-old woman, married, and the mother of a family. She has a tailoring shop which she has run for 13 years in a neighborhood of the capital. She has a good customer base but keeps running out of material because she has to buy it in small quantities to create the clothing she sells. 

This loan will allow Monique to purchase her material (accessories, fabric) in bulk which will allow her to achieve her business goals, meet the needs of her customers, and earn a decent profit. This loan will allow her not only to provide for the daily needs of her family and herself, but also to grow her business over time by purchasing in larger quantities.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel, es soltero y tiene una hija que esta en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación que tiene paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra,la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como comerciante ambulante en la venta de celulares,visita todas las ferias para poder tener mas venta y mejorar sus ingresos ya que con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación,educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mas celulares ya que debe actualizar su stock ya que la gente le pide otros mucho mas actuales.
El sueño de Miguel es tener su propia tienda para la venta de celulares y mejorar sus ingresos para poder brindarle mejor calidad de vida a su hija y también brindarle comodidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Miguel is single and has a daughter who is in school. Their live in their own home, occupying only one room which has brick walls and dirt floors. The house is located in the Obispo Bosque area of the city of La Paz. Miguel works as an itinerant seller of mobile phones. He visits all the markets of the city to sell more and increase his income. With the little that he makes he has to pay for food, education and the household expenses of his family.

Miguel needs the loan to buy more cellular phones as he needs to update his stock as people are looking for more up to date models. Miguel's dream is to have his own shop to sell phones and increase his income. Then he can provide a higher quality of living to his daughter and offer her more comfort. This is the first time he has requested a joint IMPRO KIVA loan.

loans.use: to buy cell phones to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Smbat

texts.en:
Smbat is from Vanadzor town, and is the father of two students, his daughters. He works at a local factory as a production manager, and his wife takes care of their household. 

Smbat's daughters study at the Yerevan State Medical University after Mkhitar Heratsi. Smbat's salary to covers his household costs, but it is not enough to save for his daughters' education costs. So, this hardworking and beloved father asks for help from lenders to cover his elder daughter's tuition fee. 

He will be very grateful for such a great assistance.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for his daughter.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth lives in the Kericho area, which lies in the tea-growing region of Kenya. She has two children and has been doing this work for five years. Her primary income sources are milk, tea and crops.

She stated that dairy farming is what is most enjoyable about farming. Her biggest challenge is lack of enough capital. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Lelgong.' Janeth is borrowing 40000 KES to construct a greenhouse.

Janeth was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Improves low-income earners.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Loan repayment is done monthly.'

Her highest monthly expense is the cost of farming. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Janeth replied 'Increased income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Janeth owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Sarah from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with six children, two in school. She started her food stand business to support her family.
 
Sarah sells cooking oil, seasonings and rice at her house. She has been running this business since 1990. She works at the business 12 hours per day and six days per week.  Sarah says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Sarah has requested a loan to buy food commodities like cooking oil, seasonings and rice for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and buy a freezer to improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to have a big provision shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking oil, seasonings and rice for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which is tea growing region. She has seven children and has been in her current line of work for three years. Her primary income sources are producing milk, tea and various crops. She loves farming, even though she knows that calamities can affect crops and livestock. She is requesting this loan to improve her farm and increase her income. Her biggest monthly expense is the cost of running her farm.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Ruth owns the following: a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in her household a mosquito net, TV, and DVD but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, or a sewing machine.

loans.use: to begin raising poultry.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which has a very beautiful countryside, ie. very smart. She has two children and has been doing this work for three years. Her primary income sources are milk, tea, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Farming!' Her biggest challenge is 'Expensive.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Tema.'

Lilian was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'It funds assets.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'It promotes low income earners.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Lilian replied 'Improvement income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Lilian owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Ryskan

texts.ru: Рыскан 51 год, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает пятерых детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Рыскан - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Рыскан занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 80,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Рыскан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 50 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рыскан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Рыскан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Ryskan is 51 years old, a widow and raising five children alone after her husband's death, and is also running her own business. Ryskan has a higher education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 23 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 80,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Ryskan's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 1 horse and 50 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 13,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Ryskan requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a horse in order to increase livestock headcount. Ryskan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her children's continued education.

loans.use: to buy a horse in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Daissy

texts.es: Daissy a sus 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de 9 años. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo de la confección, inició como operaria en diferentes talleres por temporadas y, con algunos ahorros decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller, luego de un tiempo fue víctima de una ola invernal que se presentó en la región, su vivienda se inundó y ocasionó varias pérdidas materiales, especialmente de su maquinaria, además su hija tuvo varias lesiones y traumas, por lo que su familia entró en una crisis económica. La cliente con su empuje, perseverancia y con el objetivo de salir nuevamente adelante, supo sobrepasar todos estos obstáculos y, con lo poco que pudo recuperar continuó con su labor, trabajando todos los días y recibe el apoyo de su mamá quien le colabora con la terminación de los productos. El crédito que solicita lo desea invertir en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, resortes y moldes) y para realizar el mantenimiento de sus máquinas. Con esto tendrá la capacidad de aumentar su producción y sus ventas, lo que le generará mejores ingresos, con los que espera poder salir adelante. Daissy sueña con tener su marca propia y brindar a su hija una mejor calidad de vida y educación, para lograrlo sabe que debe seguir luchando con esmero y dedicación.
texts.en:
Daissy, age 31, is the single mother of her nine year old daughter.  During her productive life she has worked in the field of sewing.  She started as a worker in different shops seasonally.  With some savings she decided to become independent and set up her own shop.  

She was later a victim of a flood that occurred in the area.  Her house was flooded and she lost various materials, most importantly her machinery.  Also, her daughter has various injuries and traumas.  Therefore, her family entered into a financial crisis.

Daissy, with her drive, perseverance, and the objective of once again getting ahead, knew how to overcome all of these obstacles.  With the little that she was able to recover, she continued with her work.  She is working every day, and she gets help from her mother, who collaborates on the finishing of the products.

She wishes to have the loan she is requesting to buy supplies wholesale (fabric, thread, elastic, and patterns) and to perform maintenance on her machines.  With this she will have the capacity to increase her production and her sales.  This will generate better income with which she hopes to be able to get ahead.  Daissy dreams of having her own brand and providing her daughter with a better quality of life and education.  In order to do so she knows that she needs to keep struggling with care and dedication.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (fabric, thread, elastic, and patterns) and to perform maintenance on her machines.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créer ce 18 septembre 2013 à l’occasion de son inauguration dans la place publique du village, ce banc villageois compte en son sein des femmes déterminées à entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenu et de renforcer leur capacité de financement. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce.
 
Madame Fatou, âgée de 46 ans (assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère 02 filles et un garçon. Elle est prévoit de s’investir dans la vente de légumes frais qu’elle achètera auprès des producteurs des villages pour la revente dans les marchés hebdomadaires et au marché communal. Elle compte renouveler son stock tous les 15 jours.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire acheter un sac d’ognons à 15 000 F CFA, du sucre pour 20 000 F CFA, un carton de thé vert à 7 500 F CFA et 5 litre d’huile de palme.

Les bénéfices lui serviront à épargner et d’aider son mari dans les charges de la maison en prenant en partie les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Created on September 18, 2013, during the inauguration of the public square of the village, this Banc Villageois is made up of women who are determined to undertake income-generating activities and strengthen their financial standing. They have been living in the same village for several decades and maintain relations of solidarity and mutual aid. They run small businesses as merchants.
 
Fatou, aged 46 (shown in the photo sitting second from the right), is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and is the mother of two girls and one boy. She is planning to invest her loan into her business selling fresh vegetables that she will buy from the producers in the local villages. She will then sell her wares at the weekly markets and at the community market. She intends to renew her stock every 15 days .

With her new loan, she wants to buy a bag of onions for 15,000 Francs CFA, sugar for 20,000 Francs CFA, a carton of green tea for 7,500 Francs CFA, and 5 liters of palm oil. She will use the income she earns to contribute to her savings, and to help her husband with the household expenses by paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bag of onions for 15,000 Francs CFA, sugar for 20,000 Francs CFA, a carton of green tea for 7,500 Francs CFA, and 5 liters of palm oil.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, tiene la necesidad de una nueva inversión en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, para poder  comprara tomates, güisquiles, papas, lechugas aguacates, manzanas, uvas, y peras, con las cuales cubrirá las necesidades de sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior ella aumento la variedad de productos que ofrecía en su negocio; generándole los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su economía y mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia. Su sueño es seguir ampliando su negocio y mantener la estabilidad que hasta hoy tiene.
texts.en: Blanca needs a new inversion of capital for her business selling vegetables and fruits. She needs to buy tomatoes, chayote, potatoes, lettuce, avocados, apples, grapes and pears to meets the demands of her customers. With her last loan she increased the variety of products she offers in her business, generating the income necessary to improve her finances and improve the living conditions of her family. Her dream is to continue to increase the size of her business and maintain the stability she has enjoyed up to now.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chayote, potatoes, lettuce and avocados.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 32 years old and lives in Caldwell with her husband and two children who are in school and are 2 and 15 years old. Over the past ten years, she has been selling dishes (plates, spoons, pans, etc.) in the local market, and spending 9 hours on her business each day, from Monday to Saturday.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more dishes for her business; she hopes to build a new home for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dishes for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Hawa from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with six children. Four of her children are currently attending school. She began this business because she wanted to be self dependent.

Hawa runs a general stock business; she sells soft drinks, bread, biscuits and sweets. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day. Hawa says that sometime business is very difficult.

Hawa has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits and sweets for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children school fees and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than even. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits and sweet for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 45 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom attend school. She is from Kandeh town Bo. She runs a grocery store, which she has been doing for 20 years.  She sells soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and sweets. Emma works 10 hours a day, seven days a week. She began this business because she wanted to take very good care of her family.

Emma is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and sweets to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and sweets

loans.name: Flutura

texts.en: Flutura installed new windows in her house thanks to you. The loan that she is requesting now is to be used for stocking up on second-hand inventory items to resell. This is her activity where she generates the income for her family. Kindly note that we could not take a picture of her at her activity because at the moment she had none.

loans.use: to stock up on second-hand inventory items to resell

loans.name: Fatima Petrona

texts.es:
La Señora Fátima  de cincuenta y seis anos,  es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos  no  curso  estudios básicos, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante  Fátima  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es  una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como: huevos, arroz, azúcar, leche, pan, frijoles  detergentes, jabón, aceite, verduras, tiste, jugos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Fátima  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Fatima, age 56, is from León, which is in the western part of the country. Fatima is known for being hard-working and responsible with a desire for self-improvement. In her free time she likes to enjoy spending time with her children.  Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources, she did not go to school.  She was obliged to work at an early age in order to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, Fatima has a business activity, which is a store located in her home. It is a small store where she sells food products in small quantities. She sells things like eggs, rice, sugar, milk, bread, beans, detergent, soap, cooking oil, vegetables, herbal tea, and juice.  She works some ten hours a day selling her products.  She does this in order to be able to get better income in the not so distant future.

Fatima is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have have ways of earning a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
María, solicita capital de trabajo para fortalecer más su negocio en el cual ofrece diversos productos, con el comprara blusas, faldas, camisetas, pantalones, jugos y sodas así de esta forma brindar mejores opciones de compra a sus clientes.
Anteriormente solicito un crédito que le género muchas ganancias y un número de clientes mayor del que poseía. Las condiciones de su núcleo familiar han cambiado notoriamente brindando así una mejor vida para los nuevos miembros de su familia.
texts.en:
María is requesting working capital to strengthen her business more.  In her business she offers diverse products.  She will use the loan to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, pants, juice, and soda.  This way she will provide better buying options for her customers.

She previously requested a loan that generated a lot of income for her and a greater number of customers than what she had.  Her family conditions have significantly changed, providing a better life for the new members of her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, pants, juice, and soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of drugs like anti-malarial and anti-bacterial drugs.

loans.name: Aymn

texts.en:
Aymn is a 26-year-old, single man living in a poor area in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hardworking and kindly man who strives to provide for his family. He is a driver earning a low salary, which is not enough to cover his family's expenses. 

He suffers a financial challenge because he doesn't have a second source of income besides his salary. Islamic Aid will be coming soon. So, he applied for a loan of 50,000 Yemeni Rials from AMB to buy a fridge to keep meat and food. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy fridge to keep meat and food .

loans.name: Favio Jose

texts.es:
Favio de cuarenta y ocho años de edad, casado con tres hijos menores de edad, es originario de León, lugar que  está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser  responsables, trabajador, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de actividad con su familia. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por falta de recursos económicos y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos de hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  el servicio de taxi, el cual brinda a  su comunidad, de forma rutiada, y servicios privados. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios de taxi. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de un juego de llantas nuevas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Favio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Favio, 48, is married and has three minor children. He was born in León in western Nicaragua. He is responsible and hardworking and wants to succeed. He enjoys being with his family in his free time. Sadly, he lacked money to go to college and started working at an early age to help pay household expenses. 

Thanks to his efforts and desire to succeed, he maintains a taxi service, offering routine and private trips. He will use this loan to buy a set of new tires so that he can offer customers better service and increase his income over the near term. Favio thanks Kiva lenders, who support low-income people in countries like Nicaragua so that they have decent work.

loans.use: to use working capital to improve his taxi service.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Josephine from Kandeh town Bo in Sierra Leone. She is married with six children between the ages of 6 and 20 years. One of her children is going to school. In 2005, Josephine established her retail business. She was a housewife; she began her business because her mother was once a business woman, so she trained her to do this business. She works at the business everyday from morning to night. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to run the business.

Josephine requires a loan in order to purchase more general stocks, such as cigarettes, tooth paste, soaps and mosquito sprays. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Josephine plans to see her business to her higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more general stocks, such as cigarettes, tooth paste, soaps and mosquito sprays.

loans.name: Marigold

texts.en:
Marigold is 48 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. 

Marigold is in the agriculture business, farming rice in the Philippines. Marigold requested a loan of 5000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marigold has been farming rice for twenty years now, and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain her work.

In the future, Marigold would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Yolanda Olimpia

texts.es:
Yolanda, necesita responder a las nuevas demandas de sus nuevos clientes que visitan su venta de ropa  para dama, niñas y niños, por lo que nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar vestidos para dama, vestidos para niñas y trajes para niños.
Cuando se le otorgo anteriormente un crédito pudo ampliar su negocio con mayor facilidad con la que tuvo el beneficio de mejores ganancias y la preferencia de sus clientes. Su vida familiar es diferente a la que poseía antes, pues a podido satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Yolanda needs to respond to the new demands of her new customers who visit her as she sells clothing for women and children, so she is asking for another loan to buy dresses for women and girls and suits for boys. 

When she received her previous loan she was able to expand her business more easily which gave her the benefits of better profits and preference with her customers. Her family life is different from how it was before, as she has been able to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy dresses for women and girls and suits for boys.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in Kenya's tea growing region. He has no children and has been farming for five years. His primary income sources are milk, tea, and crops.

Dickson stated that "profit earning" was the most enjoyable part of farming and this his biggest challenge is "expenses."  Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Chetuy." Dickson was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "Improves income."  Dickson was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required micro-finance training session and he replied, "Funds low income earners."

Dickson's highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how the loan will benefit his family, Dickson replied, "It will increase income."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Dickson owns a cow, poultry, and a motorcycle, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net, solar power, and a TV, but does not have electricity, running water, a sewing machine, or a DVD.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Beatrice from Liberia. More specifically, she lives in the Caldwell area. She is married and her husband is a contractor. They have three children between the ages of 16 and 20 who attend school and live at home.

Over the past ten years, Beatrice has been selling salt, coal, oil, rice, soap, and other items at the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending eight hours on her business per day.

Beatrice started her business with money given to her by her husband, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, coal, oil, rice, soap, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, coal, oil, rice, soap, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Alice K.

texts.en:
Alice is 25 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and her husband is a security guard. They have two children, aged six and ten, who are attending school and live at home.

Alice has been selling cold water and soft drinks in her community from a small shop for the past four years now. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold water and soft drinks for her business. She plans to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Mamie from Kandeh town Bo. She is married and has five children between the ages of 5 and 19. Two of her children are currently attending school. She began this business because she wants to be independent.

Mamie runs a general store; she sells soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and sweets. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business throughout the week, 10 hours per day. Mamie says that her business is doing well.She has been able to increase her customer rate and make more sales.

Mamie has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and sweets for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise even more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS ORQUIDEAS” está conformado por 11 socias quienes se dedican a diversas actividades del comercio. Alizonhp en el grupo cumple la función de tesorera quien fue elegida por las socias del mencionado. Alizonhp tiene 22 años es conviviente con 02 hijos pequeños. Hace 08 meses se dedica a la venta de productos naturales. Y a la vende productos de belleza. Es de esta manera que puede apoyar a su esposo quien se dedica a ser soldador. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más productos naturales. Su mayor deseo es construir su vivienda y mejora la calidad de vida de sus hijos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Alizonhp es la tercera persona parada del lado izquierdo viste blusa morada.
texts.en: The "Las Orquideas" group has eleven members all working with different types of business.  Alizonhp was chosen by the group to be treasurer.  She is 22 years old and lives with her two young children.  Eight months ago she started selling natural products and she now also sells beauty products.  It is through this work that Alizonhp is able to support her husband, a soldier.  Alizonhp will invest this loan in more natural products.  Alizonhp's biggest wish is to build her home and improve her children's quality of life.  The group thanks Kiva lenders for the support being provided.  In the photo, Alizonhp is standing in the back row - she is third from the left, wearing a purple blouse.

loans.use: to buy more natural products.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which has a climate that is excellent for agriculture. She has two children and has been farming for six years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.

Judith stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is "harvesting crops" and that her biggest challenge is that it is "expensive to maintain a farm." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Lelgina."

Judith was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "'Insurance of dairy cows."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required micro-finance training session and she replied, "It offers cheap interest."

Judith's highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how the loan will benefit her family, Judith replied, "Improvement of living standard."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Judith owns a cow, poultry, and a motorcycle, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and a TV, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, or a DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread, such as flour and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different styles of new clothing, manure, and herbicide.

loans.name: Rosa Milena

texts.es: Rosa, a sus 29 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos de 11, 10 y 2 años. Trabaja como empleada doméstica pero, con el ánimo de complementar sus ingresos, desea comenzar a vender productos nutricionales Herbalife, los cuales conoce porque son productos que consume. La cliente es una mujer carismática, humilde y trabajadora, lucha incansablemente para sacar adelante a sus hijos, quienes son su principal motivación. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos al por mayor (suplementos vitamínicos, malteadas, batidos, entre otros), para aprovechar los descuentos que le realizan y así poder tener un buen margen de ganancia a la hora de venderlos. Rosa es consciente que en el mundo actual las personas están adoptando la cultura de ser saludables y sabe que los productos son de buena calidad por lo que tendrían buena acogida en el mercado, pero también sabe que tienen alto costo, por lo que desea asumir el reto de trabajar arduamente para que su negocio de los resultados que espera. Rosa sueña con poder sacar adelante su actividad como independiente para que le permita generar una estabilidad económica favorable y así, ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor educación y bienestar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old and is married with three children aged 11, 10 and 2 years. She works as a domestic help but, with the intention of supplementing her income, she wants to start selling Herbalife nutrition products, which she knows about as she takes them herself. Rosa is a charismatic, modest and hard-working woman and she works tirelessly to bring up her children, who are the centre of her life.

Rosa is asking for a loan to buy products wholesale (vitamin supplements, malted drinks, milk shakes and others), in order to benefit from the discounts available so she can make a better margin when she sells the products.  Rosa is aware that nowadays people are adopting a healthy lifestyle and she knows that the products are good quality so they will be well received in the market. She also knows that they cost a lot, so she is setting herself the challenge of working hard so that her business gives her the results she hopes for. Rosa dreams of being able to take the business forward independently so that it can give her economic stability and so she can provide her children with better education and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale (vitamin supplements, malted drinks, milk shakes and others).

loans.name: Alice     K

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Alice from Kandeh town, in Bo, the southern area of Freetown. She is married with five children between the ages of six and 18. Her children are attending school, and she began her business because she wanted to be self-sufficient.

Alice runs a cookery business selling cooked rice, fried fish and cool drinks. She has been running this business for 15 years. She wakes up at 4:30am to prepare her cookery business, and she does not rest until the food is finished. One of her daughters usually helps her to run the cookery. 

Alice's business is her only source of income. Alice says that her major hardship is that preparing the cookery can sometimes be very difficult.

Alice has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking items, including bagged rice, coconut oil, and pure water. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change the structure of her cookery and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to have her own residence. 

She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking items, including bagged rice, coconut oil and pure water.

loans.name: Laurina

texts.en: Laurina is 25 years old and lives in Caldwell.  She is married and has a one-year-old child. Laurina started her table business in 2011. She sells cassava in the local market. Sometimes it’s difficult to purchase a lot of cassava because the transportation cost is too high, but she makes sure to purchase some anyway. Laurina is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava for her business. She wishes to open an account with an international bank and own a shop one day.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava

loans.name: Enise

texts.en:
Enise lives in Cap-Haitian, about 156 miles north of Port-au-Prince.  She owns a little grocery store which generates $US 182 monthly, and also works as an agricultural technician.  

Enise has been an EarthSpark/clean energy retailer for eight months.  She has always paid her balance on time, and as her client-base grows more and more people ask her for more products from EarthSpark’s Eneji Pwop brand. 

She would like to buy more products so she can serve more people.  She is very excited about the Eneji Pwop products, and says she sells the products because she wants to help people who are living in the country and have no electricity access.

Enise wants to borrow 51,175 HTG so she can buy more products from Eneji Pwop.  People in her area pay a lot of money to have their phones charged, and Enise wants buy more 'Tipowa' and 'Powa Pak' products to help them out.  Enise estimates this loan will enable her to sell about 5000 HTG worth of products per week.  She has prepared a very good marketing plan to get people to buy her products, with ideas such as bracelets, brochures and t-shirts.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Ashurby

texts.ru: Ашурби 40 лет. Она пережила много тягости жизни. Ашурби разведена и воспитывает своих детей сама. Она имеет 2 детей. Дети Гулизор и Бахтиёр. Ашурби более 5 лет работает в местной больнице уборщицей. Ашурби не имеет высшее образование, так как она не имела возможности поступить в университет. Итак, она не имеет возможностей найти работу с высокой оплатой. Она хочет купить спальный гарнитур для своих детей, но не имеет денег. Ашурби запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки спального гарнитура. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ashurby is 40 years old. She has experienced many hardships in life. Ashurby is divorced and is raising her children by herself. She has two children, Gulizor and Bakhtiar. Ashurby has worked as a hospital janitor for more than five years. Ashurby does not have a higher education, since she was not able to go to the university. Therefore, it is not possible for her to find a high-paying job. She wants to buy a bedroom set for her children, but she does not have the money. Ashurby is requesting a loan of 1000 KGS to buy bedroom set. She's waiting for your kindness and hoping for your mercy.

loans.use: buy bedroom furniture for her house

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Jeneba from Kandeh town, in Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of two and 12. Two of her children are currently attending school. She started business to support her household.

Jeneba runs a food stand, where she sells rice, pepper, and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business for 16 years. She works at the business throughout the week for ten hours per day. Jeneba says that her business is doing well, because she is able to take care of her family with her profits.

Jeneba has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasoning, rice, and oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and build her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise even more. 

She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasoning, rice, and oil for resale.

loans.name: Francisca Del Socorro

texts.es: Francisca del Socorro de 59 años de edad, casada, con ocho hijos todos mayores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país cercanías  a uno de los volcanes mas grande del país, es una micro empresaria la cual pose en su casa de habitación un pequeño taller de repostería, donde con especialidad trabaja y produce de lunes a viernes deliciosas reposterías como: donas, repollitos, maletas, pasteles de carne, queso y piña, enrrollados, picos, tres leches, atoles, entre otros. Francisca inicio su negocio desde hace varios años el cual le ha ayudado a tener mejores ingresos en el hogar, su compras las realiza principalmente a camiones distribuidores su ventas las realiza en las escuelas públicas y privadas así como también en cafetines y otros a clientes fijos y eventuales al contado y al crédito. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener mejores ingresos para mejorar su negocio, ella solicita crédito para la compra de materia prima como: harina, azucar, manteca, piñas, carne, queso, miel papel absorvente entre otros, ella está muy agradecida con el apoyo y ayuda que los inversionistas le bridan a personas de escasos recurso y países pobres como Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de trabajo.
texts.en: Francisca del Socorro is 59 years old, married, and has eight children (all now adults).  Francisca is originally from one of the towns in Chinandega, in the west of the country, and near to one of Nicaragua's largest volcanoes.  Francisca has a small business - she runs a bakery out of her home.  She works Monday to Friday, producing delicious pastries, such as doughnuts, pastries filled with meat, cheese, or pineapple, rolls, snacks, "three milks" cake, corn-flour drinks, and more.  Francisca started her business a few years ago and it has helped her to have a higher income for the household.  Francisca buys her supplies from lorries that come by selling products, and she sells her goods in private and public schools, as well as to cafés, and other regular and one-off customers.  She sells both on credit and in cash.  One of Francisca's dreams is to earn more money so as to improve her business.  She is applying for a loan in order to buy basic supplies such as flour, sugar, butter, pineapples, meat, cheese, honey, paper and other more.  Francisca is very grateful to Kiva lenders, who are supporting people with little money - and poor countries such as Nicaragua - so that they can have a decent job.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making her delicious cakes.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in the tea-growing region of Kenya. He has no children and has been doing this work for four years. His primary income sources are milk, tea, crops, transportation services, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "dairy farming." His biggest challenge is "market price is not constant." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Lemet."

Solomon was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "because they give an easy mode of repayment."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "Loans are insured."

His highest monthly expense is transportation costs. When asked how would this loan benefit his family, Solomon replied "family income will increase and better living standard."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Solomon owns the following: "cow, motorcycle" but does not own "pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, electricity, TV" but does not have "solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD."

loans.use: To put up a dairy unit.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Hawa from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 9 years and 16 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

Hawa runs a food stand; she sells rice, pepper, and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business for 16 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day. Hawa says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Hawa has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasoning, rice, and oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasoning, rice, and oil for resale.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 32 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and has a two-year-old child attending school. Her husband is a driver.

For the past ten years, Angela has been into trading. She enjoys it a whole lot because she makes a lot of profit.

Angela is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. She hopes to build a house for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Bububatima

texts.ru: Бубубатиме 57 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Бубубатимы - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бубубатима занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бубубатимы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 телки, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бубубатима обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бубубатима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Bububatima is 57 years old. She is a widow who has been raising three children after her husband's death. She also runs her own farm. Bububatima has a vocational education, and the family's primary source of income is animal husbandry. Bububatima started this business 22 years ago when she bought livestock with 20,000 KGS. Due to Bububatima's hard work, the farm now has three dairy cows, two heifers, and ten sheep. She earns a monthly income of 7,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Bububatima asked the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 KGS to buy cattle for breeding.  Bububatima plans to invest profits from the loan back into the livestock on her farm.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Héctor Iván

texts.es: Héctor a sus 32 años de edad, es padre de 1 hijo de 9 años, por el que lucha día a día para sacarlo adelante. Nació en el seno de una familia campesina, en la que aprendió todas las labores del campo desde niño, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre. Actualmente posee cultivos de fríjol y aguacate, además posee 2 vacas productoras de leche, el líquido obtenido a diario lo vende a un vecino y la cosecha recolectada la ofrece en el mercado local. El cliente es un hombre pujante, humilde y trabajador, a pesar de los obstáculos que se le presentan siempre está dispuesto a salir adelante. Solicita el crédito con el fin de ajustar el dinero para comprar una vaca productora de leche, con la cual podrá aumentar su producción y por ende sus ingresos por venta. De esta forma, Héctor desea seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de ampliar su negocio lechero, que le permita tener mejores ingresos para su familia y así poder dar a su hijo la oportunidad de tener una mejor educación y bienestar.
texts.en: Héctor is 32 years old and is a father to a nine-year-old son.  Héctor fights every day so that his son can get ahead.  Héctor is from a family of peasants and, thanks to his father, learned about all sorts of country work from a young age.  Héctor currently has avocado and bean crops, as well as two dairy cows.  He sells his milk to his neighbour and sells the harvest at the local market.  Héctor is a booming and humble and hard-working man.  In spite of the obstacles that he meets, he is always willing to try to get ahead.  Héctor is applying for his loan to buy a dairy cow.  With another cow he can increase production and, therefore, his income from sales.  Through his work, Héctor wants to continue fighting for his dream of expanding his milk business. This will allow him to have a higher income for his family and to give his son the opportunity to have a better education and improve his well-being.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nora Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Nora de sesenta años de edad, casada, es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos  y por la pobreza en la que Vivian no pudo cursar sus estudios, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante Nora tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es  una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergentes, jabón, aceite. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Nora agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nora is a 60-year old married woman who is originally from León, located in the west side of the country. She is a hard-working and responsible person and has a strong willingness of self-improvement. She likes to enjoy her children's company in her free time. Unfortunately, due to the lack of resources, she could not pursue her studies and started working to help with the household expenses when she was very young . 

Thanks to her hard work and willingness to get ahead, Nora has a grocery store in her house. She sells food products in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap and oil. She spends approximately 10 hours each day working at her business with the goal to improve her income in the near future. 

Nora is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they provide to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent source of income.

loans.use: to invest in work capital and to stock her grocery store with products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various types of bread products like donuts, special quesadillas and whole grain bread

loans.name: Marly

texts.es:
Marly tiene 26 años y nació en Manizales, población ubicada en la zona cafetera colombiana. Gracias al diario trabajo de su padre como conductor de taxi y a su madre como profesora de secundaria, Marly estudió economía en la Universidad de Manizales, cuyos méritos académicos le permitieron continuar con estudios de maestría en la que la tesis de grado obtuvo la calificación de meritoria.

Marly tiene el sueño de realizar un doctorado y el apoyo de Kiva ayudaría a que pueda pagar la inscripción al examen de TOEFL y GRE, la traducción de la documentación académica al inglés y la aplicación a las universidades en Estados Unidos y Reino Unido.
Una vez realice el doctorado, Marly sueña con incidir positivamente en temas públicos a través de trabajar en investigación en economía aplicada a situaciones reales, generando cambios y propuestas en temas de política que impulse el desarrollo y mejore los niveles de calidad de vida de su ciudad y el país.

Aquí está su historia:

A pesar de que cuento con el apoyo de mi familia para cumplir este sueño, mis padres no pueden llegar a cubrir gastos tan elevados como estos debido a su limitada situación económica. Aunque actualmente me encuentro trabajando y ahorrando, el dinero no es suficiente para los pagos de los gastos académicos. Por tal razón se hace necesario para mí solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, ya que puede servirme para cumplir mis metas académicas, profesionales y personales que se trazan al proyectarme en estudiar un doctorado en el exterior.
Tengo dos motivaciones para estudiar mi posgrado de doctorado en el exterior, en primer lugar porque en el área de mi interés que es la política económica y el desarrollo tiene unas excelentes escuelas y docentes ubicados principalmente en el países europeos y estadounidense; en este sentido, poder estudiar bajo la guía conceptual y metodológica de quienes transforman la frontera de conocimiento es una excelente oportunidad para cualquier estudiante del mundo. Una segunda motivación es más personal y está relacionada con el interés de realizar intercambios culturales y de conocimientos con personas de otros países que posiblemente tengan intereses similares.

He trabajado en investigación económica, social y de evaluación de impacto y esto me ha impulsado a trazarme una trayectoria educativa que incluye el estudio de un doctorado (PhD) que fortalezca y enriquezca mis conocimientos prácticos adquiridos. Además, para mí sería un motivo de orgullo y satisfacción poder contribuir al desarrollo de mi ciudad y de mi país, de poder por medio de estrategias y/o programas bajo alianzas público-privadas, impactar positivamente en la mejora de la calidad de vida de las personas más vulnerables y del desarrollo económico de mi ciudad. Por dichos antecedentes me interesa, realizar un doctorado en economía como una ruta para cumplir mis metas de estudios y para fortalecer mis competencias laborales. La única garantía que tengo es poner todo mi empeño y dar lo mejor de mí.
texts.en:
Marly is 26 years old and was born in Manizales, a city situated in the Colombian coffee-growing region. Thanks to her father's daily hard work as a taxi driver and her mother's work as a secondary school teacher, Marly studied economics at the University of Manizales. Her academic abilities enabled her to continue studying for a Masters, in which she was awarded the grade of merit for her thesis. 

Marly dreams of doing a PhD and support from Kiva would help her to pay to register for the exam of TOEFL and GRE, the translation of her academic documentation into English and the application to universities in the US and the UK. Once she has her PhD, Marly hopes to impact positively on public affairs by working on research into economics applied to real situations, bringing about changes and proposals on matters of policy which drive development and improve the quality of life of her city and the country. 

Here is her story:

Although I have my family's support in achieving this dream, my parents cannot manage to cover such high costs as these due to their limited economic situation. Although I am currently working and saving, the money is not enough to cover the academic costs. For this reason it is necessary for me to ask for Kiva's help, as this can help me to reach my academic, professional and personal goals which are based on my plans to study for a PhD abroad.

There are 2 reasons for wanting to study for my PhD abroad; firstly because in my area of interest, which is economic policy and development, there are excellent schools and teachers located mainly in Europe and the US. In this sense, to be able to study under the conceptual and methodological guidance of the people who are at the cutting edge of their field is an excellent opportunity for any student in the world. My second reason is more personal and relates to my interest in intercultural exchange and meeting people from other countries who may have similar interests. 

I have worked in economic and social research and impact evaluation and this has motivated me to follow an educational path which includes a PhD which will strengthen and enrich the practical knowledge I already have. Moreover, it would give me pride and satisfaction to be able to contribute to the development of my city and my country, to be able to impact positively, via strategies and/or programmes under a public-private alliance, on improving the quality of life of the most vulnerable people and the economic development of my city. For the above reasons I am interested in doing a PhD in economics as a way of fulfilling my study goals and to strengthen my employment skills. 

The only guarantee I have is that I will put in the maximum effort and give the best of myself.

loans.use: to cover the application costs to study for a PhD in economics.

loans.name: Lazos Unidos Y Rumbos Distintos Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAZOS UNIDOS Y RUMBOS DISTINTOS”  se encuentra conformada por 05 socios quienes se encuentran contentos por estar pasando el 05 ciclo. Sonia tiene 36 años es soltera con 02 hijos educando. En el grupo cumple la función de presidenta. Sonia hace más de un año que implemento su bodega en su vivienda y a la vez se dedica a ser promotora hace 06 años. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, bebidas y golosinas. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su bodega con todos los productos de primera necesidad. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Sonia se encuentra en medio  viste saco negro.
texts.en:
The group "Lazos Unidos y Rumbos Distintos" is made up of five members, who are glad to be at their fifth cycle. Sonia is a 36-year old single woman and mother of two school-age children. She is the president of the group, has had her own grocery store in her house for over a year, and has been a salesperson for six years. 

She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, drinks and candy. Her biggest dream is to expand her store with all the first-necessity products. The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan provided. 

Sonia appears right in the middle of the photo and wears a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, drinks and candy.

loans.name: Mehmonniso

texts.ru: Мехмоннисо родилась в 1971 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Мехмоннисо более 20 лет занимается педагогической деятельности. Она работает в школе и преподает младшим классам. Она имеет большой опыт и знает все тонкости своего дела. Она всегда поддерживает своего мужа и старается помочь ему во всем. Недавно сломалась машина ее мужа, и он должен отремонтировать машину. Однако ее муж не имеет денег. Мехмоннисо хочет помочь своему мужу отремонтировать машину. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для ремонта автомашины мужа. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mehmonniso was born in 1971. She is married and is raising four children. Her husband drives a taxi. Mehmonniso has been teaching for more than twenty years. She works at a school and teaches the younger grades. She has a lot of experience and knows the fine points of her work. She always supports her husband and tries to help him in every way. Recently, her husband's car broke down and he must repair it. However, her husband does not have the money. Mehmonniso wants to help her husband repair his taxi. She is asking for a loan of 3000 KGS to repair her husband's car. She's waiting for your kindness and hoping for your mercy.

loans.use: repair her husband's car

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 54 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Vilma has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sardines, shampoo, and other groceries. In the future Vilma would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Koko

texts.en:
Koko is a 39-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. He owns a mini market since one year ago where he sells dairy products in addition to daily items such as canned food, juices, bread, sweets, etc.  He works very hard to support his family financially, in collaboration with his wife who works as an accountant since 2000. 

With this requested loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, Koko will increase his store’s inventory of food provisions and drinks. He is certain that the variety of his merchandise selection will allow him to attract more customers and therefore increase his income. In the future, he intends to expand his business operation into other areas.

loans.use: increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 41 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 10 to 20, all of them attend school. 

For the past two years Sarah has been operating a table where she sells peppers, rice, bitter balls, red oil, etc. sometimes she has less customers, but most of the time she make a lot of profit. 

Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, rice, bitter balls, red oil, etc. to expand her business. In the future she hopes to expand her business into a big store.

loans.use: buy food items to sell

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 46 years old and lives in Caldwell.  She is married and has 2 children ages 6 and 28, only the younger one is attending school. 

For the past two years Oretha has been selling frozen chicken, pig feet, etc. in the local market.  She enjoys her business because she has lot of customers, and the profit she generates help her buy food for her family. 

Oretha is requesting a loan to purchase frozen chicken, pig feet, etc. for her business.  She plans to build a house and send her children to college in the near future.

loans.use: buy frozen food to sell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Riza works hard to support her family.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Riza is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.  Riza has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Barbare

texts.en:
Barbare is 35 years old and lives in Caldwell.  She is married and has 4 children ages between 2 and 18, all of them attend school. 

Over the past 5 years Barbare has been selling used clothes in the local market.  She started by getting some money from her friends. 

Barbare is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business.  She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house in the future.

loans.use: buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
35-year-old Ellen lives and works in Caldwell.  She is married and is a high school graduate.  She has 3 children ages between 4 and 17, who are attending school. 

For the past 4 years Ellen has been selling used clothes in the local market.  She makes a lot of profit because she sells quality used clothes and has a lot of customers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She hopes to build a house and buy a piece land in the near future.

loans.use: buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta works hard to support her family. She is married and has business selling dried fish in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for two years.

Roberta requested a PHP 6500 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.  In the future, Roberta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Tutu

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Tutu from Kandeh town Bo in Sierra Leone. She is married and has 4 children.  Her children are going to school.  

In 2005, Tutu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needs to generate income to take care of herself and her family. She works at the business every day from morning to night.  She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation.

Tutu requires a loan in order to purchase palm oil, gari and general stock. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Tutu plans to see her business to her higher levels. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy food items to sell

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
