Meet 42-year-old Fatmata from the Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has 9 children ages 2 years to 25 years.  She began her business because she wants to create income to support her children and herself. 

In 2009, Fatmata established her local foodstuff business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to own the biggest local food store in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy palm oil

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a young man who is 23 years old and lives in Taiz. He is married and living with his wife. He bought his taxi one year ago with the support of his wife so that he can start his life and cover household expenses. 

Ibrahim faced a financial challenge to repair his taxi. So, he took a loan of 50,000 Rials from AMB to buy spare parts to repair his taxi. He hopes to save money in order to buy an extra taxi.

loans.use: buy spare parts to repair his taxi

loans.name: Lilliam Maria

texts.es: Lilliam María de 30 años de edad, madre soltera  con un hijo menor de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega en el occidente del país, tiene como actividad económica la compra y venta de mercadería en general como: roa, zapatos, cosméticos, productos plásticos entre otros ,  el cual distribuye de forma ambulante, inició este negocio con capital propio desde  hace 4 años, el cual o hace como un medio para vivir y de sacar adelante a su hija debido a ser madre soltera.  así como también tiene en su casa de habitación una pequeña pulpería en la cual vende todo tipo de productos de consumo del hogar como: granos básicos, golosinas, aceite, productos congelados, detergentes y mas , las ventas las realiza al contado y al crédito, a clientes fijos y eventuales, la compras la realiza al contado a camiones distribuidores y en los mercados aledaños a su domicilio, ella solicita crédito para la compra de capital de trabajo el cual usara para invertir en sus dos negocios, uno de sus sueños es ver formar profesionalmente a su pequeña hija al igual que el de incrementar el inventario de sus negocios como: productos de consumo del hogar, mercedaria en general como variedades de ropa, cosméticos, chineria entre otros para obtener mejores ingresos y tener una estabilidad económica ella agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kivas brindan a personas con escasos recurso para tener un medio digno de trabajo.
texts.en:
Lilliam María is 30 years old and is a single mother with a child still in her care. She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega in the eastern part of the country. She has a business buying and selling general merchandise such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics and plastic products, among other items, which she distributes in an itinerant fashion. She started this business with her own capital four years ago; she does this as a means to make a living and to get her daughter ahead, because she is a single mother. She also has a small grocery store in her home, where she sells products for home consumption such as basic grains, candy, oil, frozen products, detergents and more. 

Her sales are done in cash and on credit to established and new customers. Purchases are done in cash from trucks that distribute items and in the markets near her home. She is asking for the loan to acquire working capital, which she will use to invest in her two businesses. 

One of her dreams is to see her young daughter study and become a professional. She would also like to increase her inventory for her businesses with products for home consumption and general merchandise such as an assortment of clothing, cosmetics and chinoiserie, among other items, in order to obtain better earnings and have financial stability.

She is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors provide to enable people with scarce resources to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to acquire working capital with the purchase of general merchandise like  clothing, cosmetics, food products and other items.

loans.name: Pamela - Esther Photo

texts.en:
Pamela is 40 years old.  She is supporting a family of four. She has been in the cereals business for the last 15 years and earns a monthly income of KES 60,000.

Pamela applied for a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase more cereals stock, including wheat. The anticipated profit will be used to improve her living standard.  She hopes to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: buy cereal grains to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Zenaida works hard to support her family.  She has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  

Zenaida is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts and to maintain her trisikad.  Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: maintain her trisikad

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 40 years old and is from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 10, 17 and 18. 

Fe has been engaged in a sari-sari store business and in selling of home-cooked meals for 6 years now. This is her means of earning a living for her family's needs. She is asking for a loan of 10000 PHP to buy vegetables, meat, canned goods, chips, candies, noodles and to pay for tuition fees. Her income provides her family with the needed healthy diet and school fees for her children.

In the future, Fe hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s continued education.

loans.use: restock her store and pay school fees

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.  The previous loan enabled her to to save money in her business. She is requesting for another loan of KES 20,000 to purchase food ingredients and items for her business.

Rukia feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: buy food ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Gwendolyn

texts.en:
Gwendolyn is 53 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gwendolyn runs a general store in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, rice and other groceries. 

Gwendolyn  requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 23 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Hazel has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this busines for three years.

Hazel requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.  In the future, Hazel would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 54 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Fe has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for three years.

Fe requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 40 years old and is a married woman with 2 children who are in school.  Marilyn is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for twenty years.

Marlyn requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.  In the future, Marlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 59 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Josefina has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  

Josefina requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, Josefina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a widow with one child who is an adult.  She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  She sells fruits and coconuts to passers by and her neighbors.

Joyce is requesting for a loan to buy sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: buy fruits and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Febe Ann

texts.en: Febe Ann is 44 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Febe Ann has a business selling fruits in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fruit to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of seafood (shrimp, fish) and molluscs (squid, conch).

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 51 years old and married with 3 children. With 3 children in school, Estelita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as spices, canned goods, soft-drinks and other grocery items. In the future Estelita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 49 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load). She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bety Johana

texts.es:
La señora Bety  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijos y  esposo en una comunidad en la zona sur  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad.
Doña Bety necesita el préstamo para la compra de: maíz, cal, leña. Los cuales  necesita para seguir elaborando su  producto. Ella espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera espera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
Doña Bety espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  sus hijos continúe con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre del  2013
texts.en:
Bety is a very hard-working and responsible woman who lives with her children and husband in a community in the south side of Honduras. She has a business where she makes and sells tortillas and which is well-known in her community. 

Bety needs a loan to buy corn, lime and firewood. She expects that, thanks to the loan, she will have the necessary inputs for her business and will be able to respond to her clients' demand. She also expects that sales will increase and that her family's quality of life will improve. Bety's dream is for her business to keep growing and become the most popular in the community. This way she will be able to support her family and her children's studies so that they will have better opportunities in life. 

Choluteca, Honduras - September 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, lime and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old, married, and has nine children, two of whom are in school.  She is in an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie is 52 years old and has four children, all of whom are in school. Rosenie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming rice for ten years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rosenie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 36 years old, married with eight children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Joseph grows maize, beans, and cassava. He also has cows, goats, and chickens.

Joseph has served as a CKW for the last two years and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Joseph will pay fees for his children and expand his farming enterprises. His biggest dream in life is to educate all his children up to university level.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that he can provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old, a single mother with three children. She earns her income through the sale of crops, running a small business and monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land Mary grows maize, beans and vegetables. She also has chickens and pigs.

Mary has served as a CKW for the last two years and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Mary will buy new stock for her business and expand her farming enterprise. His biggest dream in life is to move away from poverty and become very rich.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old. She is a widow with two children. She earns her income through the sale of crops, and also receives monthly compensation from her work as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land Elizabeth grows maize, beans and pineapples. She also has chickens.

Elizabeth has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Elizabeth will buy new stock for her business and expand her farming enterprise. Her biggest dream in life is to build a commercial house, rent it out and earn income.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 44 years old, and married with six children. He earns his income through the sale of crops, and he receives monthly compensation for his work as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Paul grows maize, cassava and sunflower. He also has sheep, pigs and turkeys. 

Paul has served as a CKW for the last two years and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Paul will buy farm inputs and expand on his farming enterprise. His biggest dream in life is to become rich and self-sustaining.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is 48 years old, and married with one child. She earns her income through the sale of crops, her livestock, and her work as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land Robinah grows maize, beans, rice and cassava. She also has chickens.

Robinah has served as a CKW for the last two years and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Robinah will buy an exotic breed of chicken so as to expand her poultry farm. Her biggest dream in life is to be rich and to be a role model for other women in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is 45 years old. He is married and has 8 children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and the monthly compensation he receives as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Bosco grows maize, coffee and rice. He also has goats and pigs.
 
Bosco has served as a CKW for the last two years and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Bosco will open up a retail shop in his community. His biggest dream in life is to educate all his children up-to university level and that they get good paying jobs.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 37 years old and married with 5 children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a trisikad  transportation business in the Philippines. Annabelle has been in this business for ten years.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her trisikad (a 3-wheeled 'pedicab' similar to a rickshaw). In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Belinda dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Abifaisi

texts.en:
Abifaisi is 45 years old, and married with five children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land Abifaisi grows maize, beans, rice and cassava. She also has chickens and pigs.

Abifaisi has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Abifaisi will pay school fees for her children and cover other home needs. Her biggest dream in life is to construct a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale, so that she may provide vital farming information to her community

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 42 years old and married with seven children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and from monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Fred grows maize, beans, cassava, groundnuts and matooke. He also has a cow, chicken and pigs.

Fred has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Fred will start a dairy milk shop in his community. His biggest dream in life is to become rich and help the poor.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale, so that he may provide vital farming information to his community

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 44 years old and married with five children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land Alice grows maize, beans, cassava and sorghum. She also has a cow, chicken and pigs.

Alice has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. Alice plans to save the additional money she will earn as a CKW and start a small business buying farmers' produce for resale. Her biggest dream in life is to be self-dependent and rich.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 28 years old and married with 1 child. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Godfrey grows maize, beans, cassava, ground nuts, and sweet potatoes. He also has chickens and bees. 

Godfrey has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes.
 
With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Godfrey will start a poultry project.  His biggest dream in life is to be well off with a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he can provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 32 years old and widowed with 6 children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Godfrey grows maize, beans, cassava, ground nuts, and sweet potatoes. He also has chickens, sheep, and pigs. 

Godfrey has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes.

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Godfrey will expand his goat rearing project and pay school fees for his children.  His biggest dream in life is to start a big business in Agro Inputs and become self-reliant.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

Having served as a CKW for the last two years, Francis looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes.
 
With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Francis will expand his poultry project. His biggest dream in life is to become a commercial farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is 25 years old and single, staying with her parents. She earns her income through the sale of crops, livestock, and receiving monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her family's land Angella grows maize, beans, ground nuts, and millet. She also has chicken.

Angella has served as a CKW for the last two years and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Angella plans to buy her own piece of land for farming. Her biggest dream in life is to establish a community support organization empowering vulnerable children and women in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 35 years old and married with 7 children. He earns his income through the sale of crops, livestock, and by receiving monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Mohammed grows maize, ground nuts, and sweet potatoes. He also has chickens, sheep, and goats.

Having served as a CKW for the last two years, Mohammed looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Mohammed will use it to construct a permanent house for his family. His biggest dreams in life are to educate all his children to higher levels and have a better home.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 33 years old and single with one child. She earns her income through the sale of crops and by receiving monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land Juliet grows maize and beans. She also has chickens and sheep.

Juliet has served as a CKW for the last two years and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Juliet plans to improve her farm and buy new farming tools. Her biggest dream in life is to become a model farmer in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 25 years old and married with one child. She earns her income through the sale of crops, livestock, and by receiving monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land Rebecca grows maize, beans, ground nuts, and millet. She also has chickens and pigs.

Rebecca has served as a CKW for the last two years and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Rebecca plans to expand her retail shop business. Her biggest dream in life is to become a model farmer in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 28 years old and single with no children. He earns his income through the sale of crops, livestock and monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Frank grows maize, ground nuts and sweet potatoes. He also has chicken, sheep and goats.

Frank has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar-charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Frank will use boost his agro-input shop. His biggest dream in life is to attain a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar-charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Hotamby

texts.ru: Хотамби 52 года. Она добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Несколько лет назад она развелась с мужем, и ей было очень трудно справляться с семейными расходами. Она имеет 2  детей. Она свет в жизни детей и единственная надежда для них. 14 лет назад она начала свой бизнес купле продажей посуды на местном рынке. Она имеет свою торговую точку на местном рынке. Она в основном продает чашки, тарелки, ложки и т.п. Она должна обновить товар и привлечь больше клиентов, так как ей необходимо зарабатывать больше денег для обеспечения своих детей и внуков. Ее сын помогает ей введению бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ  для покупки посуды, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Hotamby is 52. She is a conscientious and hard-working woman. A few years ago, she divorced her husband. It was very difficult for her to cope with family expenses. She has two children. She is the light of her children's lives, and she has placed all of her hopes in them. Fourteen years ago, she started a business buying and selling dishware in the local market. She has a shop in the local market. She mainly sells cups, plates, spoons, etc. She needs to update her product line to attract more customers. She needs to earn more money to support her children and grandchildren. Her son helps her run her business. She is asking for a loan to buy dishes so she can increase her working capital. She's waiting for your kindness and hoping for your mercy.

loans.use: buy dishes for sale.

loans.name: Maternidad

texts.en: Maternidad is 58 years old and widowed with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 30 years. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her sewing machine. In the future, Maternidad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Sande

texts.en:
Sande is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years, and  earns more income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle. Sande has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock to offer for sale.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling fish. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to offer for sale.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 32 years old and lives in Caldwell.  She is married and her husband is on a pension.  They have eight children between the ages of 6 and 12 years; only two of her children live with her. 

For the past twenty five years she has been selling pineapples and bananas.  Sometimes she makes less profit because she buys at a higher price.

She is requesting a loan to purchase pineapples and bananas to resell.  In the future she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pineapples and bananas for resale

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 25 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is unmarried and stopped her education at grade 11. She has a 7 year old who lives with her. 

For the past 5 years Vivian has been running a table where she sells fish.  One thing she enjoys is that her table makes her self employed.

She is requesting a loan to purchase 2 cartons of fish for her business. She plans to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cartons of fish for her business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Tessie works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling recycled materials business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling seafood. Tessie is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of recycled materials for resale.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to be able to afford to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of recycled materials for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and her husband is a mason. They have three children aged 19 to 28, all of whom stay on their own.

For the past fifteen years she has been selling frozen fish in the local market. Sometimes she buys at a very high price and makes a very low profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase one carton of frozen fish for her business. 

In the future she plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one carton of frozen fish for her business

loans.name: Oscar Moises

texts.es: Oscar, casado trabajador padre de un hijo en edad escolar, su esposa se dedica a las tareas del hogar, el labora como albañil por cuenta propia ademas tiene una manzana de Piña en cosecha le urge realizar un Manteniento para ebitar las plagas. el credito lo solicita para comprar fertilizantes como. urea, completo, triple y pagara mano de obra. con esta cosecha el espera que su producto pueda venderlo en buen precio y asi mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Oscar is a married, working father of one school-aged child. His wife is a housewife. He works as an independent bricklayer as well as having a manaza (0.7 hectare) of pineapple under cultivation. He urgently needs to do some maintenance on his crops to avoid infestations. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers like urea, liquid and foliar fertilizers and to pay for labor. He hopes to be able to sell his product at a good price and improve his revenue.

loans.use: to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она воспитывает своих 2 детей сама. Она разведена, и ее муж не помогает ей по обеспечению детей. Адолат более 7 месяца работает уборщицей в больнице. Она получает маленькую зарплату и ей очень тяжело обеспечить своих детей. Адолат честная женщина и выполняет свою работу качественно. Она хочет, найти работу по более высокой заработной платы. Она стремиться создать хорошею условию для своих детей. Она планирует отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы купить строительные материалы как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Adolat is a kind and hardworking woman. She is raising her two children by herself. She is divorced, and her ex-husband does not help support the children. For more than seven months, Adolat has worked as a janitor at the hospital. Her pay is low, and it is very hard to provide for her children. Adolat is an honest woman and gets the job done efficiently. She wants to find a job at a higher salary. She wants to raise her children in a good environment. She plans to renovate her house, but does not have enough money to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 KGS. She's waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: buy building materials such as cement and wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Abigae C.

texts.en:
Abigae is rwenty-five years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and has a seven-year-old child who lives at home and attends school.  Abigae is a university student herself.

For the past seven years she has been selling used clothes from a table in the local market.  She established the business with small loans from friends and says that she encounters few problems in her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  In the future, she plans to complete her education.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: San Bartolome Group

texts.es: “SAN BARTOLOME” es un nuevo grupo conformada por 07 socios quienes se encuentran entusiasmados por iniciar una nueva etapa en sus vidas. Enilda tiene 32 años es conviviente con 02 hijos en el colegio. Hace 14 años se dedica a la producción de tuna, cochinilla juntamente con su esposo. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a ser ayudante de restaurant. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de su producción. Su mayor deseo es implementar un restaurant. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Enilda es la primera personas parada del lado derecho viste polo blanco.
texts.en:
San Bartolomé is a new group made up of seven members who are enthusiastic about beginning a new stage in life.

Enilda, 32, lives with her partner and has two children in school.  She and her husband make a living growing prickly pear and producing cochineal.  In her spare time Enilda's a restaurant assistant.

She'll invest the loan in buying fertilizer to improve the quality of her crop.

Enilda's greatest desire is to set up a restaurant.  She's the first person standing on the right; she's wearing a white t-shirt.  The group's grateful to the Kiva lenders for their loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: Doña Maria Esther trabajadora desde muy joven siempre busca la forma de sobre salir y buscar la mejora para su hogar. su actividad comercial es Venta de Ropa con el tiepo ella a modificado un poco su hogar para establecer una mini tienda donde sus clientes pueden llegar con mucha tranquilidad a comprar. con este nuevo financiamiento comprar mercaderia nueva como ropa para damas, niños y caballero para aumentar su intentario. agradece a Kiva y Afodenic por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Maria Esther, who has been working from an early age, is always seeking ways to find and provide the best to her family. She sells clothing, and, over time, she modified her house a bit to add a small store where customers would be able to shop comfortably. She will use this new loan to buy new clothing for women, children, and men to add to her inventory. She thanks Kiva and Afodenic for their support.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: El señor Rolando habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en compañia de su esposa he hijos, sus hijos ya estan mayores de edad. el labora como docente para un colegio publico y su esposa trabaja para el Hospital del municipio como Secretaria, entre los dos han lucha para poder terminar de construir su casa. el credito lo solicita para comprar materiales como cemento, arena, hirro. asi su casa podra mejorar su aspecto y sus condiciones en cuanto a estabilidad en el hogar seran mejores.
texts.en: Rolando lives with his wife in the city of Ticuantepe. His children are grown. He teaches in a public school, and his wife is a secretary at the city hospital. They have been trying to complete their house. He has applied for a loan to buy materials like cement, sand, and iron to improve its look and structure and make it more stable.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: José Nelson

texts.es: José es un joven de 19 años de edad que vive en unión libre con su pareja sentimental. Por falta de experiencia laboral le ha sido difícil encontrar oportunidades de empleo, por lo que desea iniciar su propio negocio y generar recursos por cuenta propia. Quiere dedicarse a vender perfumería y accesorios de bisutería en acero, aprovechando que tiene muchos amigos y familiares que podrían convertirse en sus clientes potenciales; con esta actividad desea percibir los ingresos que requiere para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. José es consciente que para lograr los resultados que desea, debe trabajar con empeño, disciplina y mucha dedicación, pues es la clave para que su proyecto de negocio sea rentable. El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (lociones y accesorios en acero), para dar poner en marcha su idea de negocio. José sueña con hacer que su negocio genere buenos resultados y en un futuro poder montar una distribuidora, que le permita tener una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
José is a 19-year-old man who lives in a common law marriage with his romantic partner. Because he has little work experience, it has been difficult for him to find employment opportunities, so he wants to start his own business and generate resources on his own. He wants to make a living by selling perfumes and steel jewelry accessories, taking advantage of the fact that he has a lot of friends and family members who could turn into potential customers. With this business he hopes to earn the income that he needs to cover his basic household needs.

José is aware that to get the results that he wants, he must work with persistence, discipline and lot of dedication, as this is the key to his business project being profitable. He wants to invest the loans he is asking for in the purchase of an assortment of items wholesale (lotions and steel accessories) to be able to launch his business idea. 

José dreams of making his business generate good results and to be able to launch a distributor in the future, which would allow him to have ample financial stability to give his family a better quality of life and well being.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of items wholesale (lotions and steel accessories)

loans.name: Annie J.

texts.en:
Annie is 49 years old and married to a policeman.  They have four children, with three at school and one out of high school and living at home.  Annie attended school herself, attaining the sixth grade level.

For the past fifteen years, she has been fixing and selling building blocks.  She established the business with small loans from friends and says that she encounters few problems in her business except the unstable price of cement.  She enjoys the independence her income gives her.

She is requesting a loan to buy more cement and sand for her business.  In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more cement and sand for her business.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: La señora Maria Magdalena labora por operador en una Pezzeria desde hace 3 años, su esposa trabaja como jardinero en una casa privada, su mayor sueño para ella es terminar de construir su casa para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida. ella solicita el credito para comprar materiales hierro,perlines, zinc ya que el resto de materiales ya los tiene para asi poder terminarla. agradece el apoyo que ha recibido de parte de KIva y Afodenic.
texts.en: Maria Magdalena has been working in a pizzeria for three years, and her husband is a gardener at a private home. Her great dream is to finish her house and improve the family's living conditions. She has applied for a loan to buy iron, beams, and zinc sheets. She has the other materials needed to finish construction, and she thanks Kiva and Afodenic for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Rosaly Euceda

texts.es:
El señor Rosaly es una persona trabajara y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio compra y venta de curiles desde hace 5 años, los cuales vende desde su casa de habitación donde la visitan los clientes a diario.
Don Rosaly está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser curiles que necesita para cubrir los pedidos de  producto que tiene de sus clientes. El  espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que no cuenta con el producto necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.
Don Rosaly espera un aumento en las ventas y con esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar. Espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Rosaly is a hardworking and responsible person who lives in a community in southern Honduras with his wife and their 2 children.  For the past 5 years, he has run a business buying and selling Curiles (a local clam) from his home where his clients come daily.  

Rosaly is seeking a loan to purchase more product like Curiles that he needs to fulfill his clients' orders.  He hopes that the loan will be very helpful since he currently does not have the sufficient inventory to satisfy his clients' needs.  Rosaly expects an increase in his revenue which will increase his incomes and benefit his family's quality of life.  He hopes to grow his business and continue to support his children in their education so they will have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: purchase Curiles (a local clam) for his business.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: la señora Concepcion trabajadora toda su vida, tiene muchos años de dicarse a la agricultura, peo debido a su edad ha dejado ese trbajo y tiene un negocio de frutas y verduras el cual le ha hido muy bien ya que sus ganacias han  mejorado mucho. el credito lo solicita para comprar frutas y verdura para aumentar sus inventario ya que quiere aprovechar la tempora que ella considera alta para vender mucha mas. Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado por esto años.
texts.en:
Sra. Concepción has worked her entire life, having devoted many years to agriculture.  Due to her age, she has stopped doing that type of work and now has a fruit and vegetable business that is doing very well.  As a result, her earnings have greatly improved.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fruits and vegetables in order to increase her inventory.  She wants to take advantage of the high season since she believes she will be able to sell more.  Concepción is grateful for the support that Kiva and AFODENIC have provided over the years.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 43 years old and married with three children between 10 months and  17 years old, who live at home. Only two attend school. Fatu went to school to the sixth grade.

For the past six years, she has been selling frozen chicken, ribs, pigtails, etc.  She established the business with small loans from her friends and says that she encounters few problems in her business other than finding good supplies at reasonable costs.  

Fatu is requesting a loan to purchase more frozen chicken, ribs, pigtails, etc. to expand the range of sales.  In the future, she wants to support her children and buy some land.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen chicken, ribs, pigtails, etc. to expand the range of sales.

loans.name: Reyna Victorina

texts.es:
Doña Reyna es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus nietos. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de tamales desde hace 10 años.
Doña Reyna tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en donde sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos que la visitan a diario, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más productos como ser: maíz, manteca, arroz, hojas para tamal, gallinas, manteca, polipel, condimentos, verduras, papas, etc. 
Doña Reyna espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucha ayuda ya que gracias a el contara con los insumos necesarios para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así mismo satisfacer las necesidades de estos, de igual manera espera que sus ventas tengan un aumento y gracias a este ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar.
Doña Reyna espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a su familia  para que cumplan sus metas y sueños y que tengan una mejor calidad de vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Reyna is a fighter and very honest. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras together with her husband and grandchildren. She has been making and selling tamales for ten years now. Reyna has her business in her house. Her clients are friends and neighbors who visit her daily. 

Reyna is requesting this loan to buy more products such as corn, lard, rice, leaves to wrap the tamales, chicken, plastic plate liners, condiments, vegetables, potatoes etc. Reyna hopes that the loan will help her a lot since, thanks to the loan she will have the ingredients she needs to fulfill the customers demands. Thus satisfying their needs and at the same time she would see her sales increase. And this would increase her revenues which would benefit the lifestyle of her family. Reyna hopes to expand her business and continue to support her family so they can fulfill their own dreams and goals and have a better quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, lard, rice, leaves to wrap the tamales, chicken, plastic plate liners, condiments, vegetables, potatoes etc.for her business.

loans.name: Jose Rudis

texts.es:
José, tiene 46 años de edad, está casado, su esposa tiene 38 años de edad, tiene tres hijos menores de edad, que estudian en el colegio. José está dedicado al transporte de pasajeros, posee un microbús autorizado para transporte, él tiene tres años en este oficio y lo realiza de lunes a viernes.
José solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos como llantas nuevas y tambien le dará mantenimiento a la unidad de transporte. Considera que el préstamo ser muy útil porque mejorara las condiciones del microbús, dándole más vida útil y ofreciendo un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Su aspiración es mejorar la atención a los clientes y obtener mejores beneficios tambien para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and married.  His wife is 38 years old.  They have three young children who are in school.  

José transports passengers and owns a microbus that is an authorized vehicle.  He has been in this business for three years and works Monday through Friday.  José is requesting a loan so that he can buy parts, such as new tires.  He will also pay for the maintenance of his transport vehicle.  José believes this loan will be useful because the condition of his microbus will improve.  In addition, he will be more useful in life and be able to provide better service to his customers.  

His aspiration is to improve customer service and provide better benefits to his family as well.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his microbus and to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana Mirian de 42 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y dos hijas una de 9 años, una de 13 años y un hijo mayor de edad. Ana Mirian es una mujer muy trabajadora, actualmente se gana la vida vendiendo productos de catálogos a vecinos y personas que la conocen, su hijo mayor trabaja como jornalero y su esposo es empleado en una empresa privada. Con esfuerzo y dedicación han ido mejorando su casa ya que es para lo único que trabajan su ilusión es ver su vivienda totalmente construida y arreglada; es por esa razón que Ana Marian solicito a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de puertas de hierro y pagar la mano de obra para su hechura e instalación. Ella se compromete a cancelar la deuda con el apoyo de su hijo y esposo.
texts.en:
Ana Mirian is 42 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her husband.  They have two daughters, ages 9 and 13, and an adult son.  

Ana Mirian is a very hardworking woman.  She currently earns her living by selling catalog products to her neighbors and acquaintances.  Her adult son is a day laborer and her husband is employed at a private business.  Through effort and dedication, she has been able to improve her home.  Her only dream is to see her house completely built and repaired.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy iron doors and to pay for the labor to have them installed.  She promises to repay this debt with the help of her son and husband.

loans.use: to buy metal doors and to pay for the labor to have them installed.

loans.name: Esteban Rosa

texts.es:
Don Esteba es una persona muy trabajadora  y honesta vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus hijos. Su negocio es la compra y  venta de camarones, los cuales vende desde su casa de habitación.
Don estaban necesita el préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: camarones que necesita para cubrir la demanda que tiene. Espera  que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a esto contara con más producto para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Don estaban desea aumentar su negocio a tal grado que sea el más grande y conocido de la comunidad y  con esto seguir apoyando a sus hijos  para que terminen sus estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Don Esteban is a hardworking and honest person.  He lives in a community in southern Honduras along with his wife and children.  His business involves buying and selling shrimp, which he does out of his house.  

Don Esteban needs this loan so that he can buy more inventory since he lacks enough shrimp to meet existing demand.  He expects this loan will be of great help since he will have more product to satisfy the needs of his customers.  

Don Esteban wants to increase his business to the point that it becomes the largest and most well-known in his community.  This will enable him to continue supporting his children so that they can finish their studies and have better opportunities in life.  

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy more shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Mayble

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Mayble from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area of Liberia; this area is coming to be one of the most populated communities in Montserrado due to some options such as good roads, quietness, and the lower price of house rentals. Mayble is married to a contractor, and they have 2 children, ages 1 and 3, who live at home with them. Mayble herself did not attend school.

Over the past ten years, she has been selling lappa (traditional clothing).  She established the business with small loans from friends and says that she encounters few problems in her business other than finding good supplies at reasonable costs.  Her best trading comes at traditional holidays and Christmas. She is requesting a loan to expand the range of items she sells.  In the future, she wants to support her children and buy some land.

loans.use: to expand the range of items she sells.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 24 years old and married. For the last two years he has been running a food cafe that has been doing great. He is planning to buy a television screen and to renovate the cafe. He is also employed as a teacher, and he has a family member running the business for him. He hopes that in the next five years he will have a stable business. The major challenges for his business have been price changes and finding customers due to the stiff competition. He knew Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to take the programs. The extra income that he will raise will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a television screen and to renovate the cafe.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
This is Helena from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the more populated communities in Montserrado due to some options such as good roads, quietness, and the lower price of house rental. 

Helena is 33 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 7 and 13, who live at home and attend school. Her husband is a builder. She has been running a table where she sells cosmetics. She is asking for a loan to buy enough cosmetics to increase her sales. She complains that the price of cosmetics is the major problem she faces now.  

She started this business with a little money from her husband. She enjoys her business because she makes her own money, and she is so proud of her business because it makes her independent. Her plans are to one day own a house, and to see her children attending university in the future. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy enough cosmetics to increase her sales.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 56-year-old married man and the father of 3 sons and 2 daughters. All of them are attending schools and universities. For the past seven years Jamal has been planting his land in seasonal crops and selling them in the local market. It is a good business but requires a lot of effort. His wife and kids help him at harvest time.

Jamal took a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy seeds and seedlings and also buy new water pipes. This will increase his productivity and his income will increase. He appears in the photo on his farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings, and also buy new water pipes.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a 36-year-old, married woman from a village near Jenin city. She is a mother of five sons and two daughters. Sana's husband sells used items, like furniture. 

Sana has been raising chickens and rabbits for the past ten years. Her husband and children help her on her farm. 

Sana took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to expand the barn where she raises chickens and rabbits. This will help her to increase her productivity and also her income. 

Sana appears in the photo, with her husband.

loans.use: to expand the barn where she raises chickens and rabbits.

loans.name: Nyambura

texts.en:
Nyambura lives in Kongowea, north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a 38-year-old married business lady with four children. She runs a food business in the market and the business has been in operation for the last four years. She also sells lesos (African clothing also called kangas) in the same market. Her business has really grown since its inception and she has managed to employ someone to help her handle the customers. 

She knew about Milango through friends and now she is seeking a loan to buy flour, beans, rice and cooking oil for her food business. She hopes that the business will grow into a reputable restaurant in the next five years despite the challenges of prices and competition. The income raised will improve her living standards and she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, beans, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ghaith

texts.en:
Ghaith is a 21-year-old single young man from a small village near Tulkarem city. He lives with his family in a small house. Ghaith's father is a worker in a local company and he gets a low income. The family expenses are too high and he can't pay the university installment for his son. Ghaith is a very clever man and he is in his second year of studying Social Science.

Ghaith took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installment for this semester. This will help him to complete his study and find a job to help his father with part of the expenses. 

Ghaith appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installment for this semester.

loans.name: Josue Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Josué es una persona muy honesta y responsable, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 3 años, la cual es muy visitada y conocida por los vecinos de su comunidad.
Don Josué está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más productos como ser: maíz, manteca, huevos, queso, refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, pan, café, mantequilla, carne, jugos, etc. que necesita para surtir más de producto su negocio. 
Don Josué espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucha ayuda ya que gracias a el contara con los insumos necesarios para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así mismo satisfacer las necesidades de estos, de igual manera espera que sus ventas aumenten y gracias a esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia.
Don Josué el espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que cumplan sus metas y sueños así como el de que puedan  estudiar para que tengan  mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Josué is a very honest and responsible person. He lives in a community in the south of Honduras with his wife and their two children. He has had a small grocery store business for three years that is very popular and well-known among his neighbors in his community.

Josué is asking for the loan to buy more products such as corn, oil, eggs, cheese, drinks, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, juices, etc., which he needs to stock his business with more products. 

Josué hopes that the loan will serve as a lot of help, as he will have the supplies necessary to cover his customers' demands and thus satisfy their needs. He likewise hopes that his sales increase; in this way he would have more earnings to benefit his family's lifestyle. 

Josué hopes to grow his business and keep supporting his children so that they achieve their goals and dreams as well as ensuring that they are able to study in order to have greater opportunities in life.



Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, eggs, cheese, drinks, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, juices, etc., for his business

loans.name: Esmeralda Isabel

texts.es: Esmeralda de 22 años de edad, habita junto a su familia su compañero de vida y su hijo de 4 años de edad. Viven en su casa humilde pequeña de un solo cuarto desde hace 5 años. Siempre ha querido sobresalir por el bienestar de su hijo, siendo una joven madre luchadora con deseos de superación. Vende tostadas que son rodajas de plátanos y yuca fritas, empanadas y además vende pescado. En esta ocasión se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito que le permita cambiar el techo de su casa y mejorar las paredes de su humilde vivienda ya que actualmente son de hojas de palmera las que desea sustituirlas por lamina galvanizada, y necesita comprar lamina galvanizada, pines, pagar la mano de obra y cemento. Espera contar con la ayuda y que todo le sea satisfactorio para su familia.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 22 years old and lives with her family, which consists of her life companion and their four-year-old son.  They have been living in a small modest house that consists of one room for the past five years.  Esmeralda has always wanted to do well in life for the benefit of her young son, but being a young a mother, she struggles with her desire to get better.  She sells “tostadas”, which are chips made of fried slices of bananas and cassava.  In addition, she sells empanadas and fish.  

On this occasion, Esmeralda came to FUSAI to request a loan so that she can replace the roof of her house and repair the walls of her modest home.  The walls are currently made of palm leaves, but she wants to substitute them with galvanized metal sheets.  She needs to buy metal sheets, pins, cement, as well as pay for labor.  Esmeralda hopes to have this assistance so that everything will be satisfactory for her family.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, pins, cement, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en: Ramadhan is happy that he was able to get a Kiva loan that he was able to repay without challenges. His business improved and he now seeks another loan to buy more toys to sell in his business. The challenge he faces in the business is raising funds. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to meet his targets. He learned of Milango through friends and he also heard of it on the radio.

loans.use: To buy more toys to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food stock, such as rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 37 years old and she lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is divorced, and has five children that are under her care. 

She has been selling electronic tax machines for the last seven years, and the business has been growing. This business is her sole source of income and she has to work everyday to make it succeed. In the next five years, she wants to add more products like photocopiers, typing, and bureau. 

The major challenges that she faces are high transportation cost and fuel costs. 

She learned of Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy electronic tax machines.  

The extra income that she will raise will pay school fees for her children and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy electronic tax machines.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Chrisitne est une femme de 31 ans, célibataire sans enfant. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 10 mois où elle a ouvert une boutique dans laquelle elle vend la friperie es vêtements des jeunes, hommes et des dames et des chaussures(en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les chaussures et vêtements qu'elle expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. Elle économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour ouvrir une boutique de vêtements.
texts.en:
Chrisitne is a 31-year-old woman, single and without children. She has been a merchant in the market place for the past ten months. She runs a counter where she sells used clothing and shoes for young men and women (depending on the season and availability of shoes).

Due to her lack of capital, every weekend Christine must go to purchase at retail the clothing and shoes she sells from her counter. This loan is therefore very important to her for her work, as it will allow her to purchase a mixed bundle of clothing. She will save the income she earns from this loan to open a clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase a mixed bundle of clothing.

loans.name: Qaher

texts.en:
Qaher is a 37-year-old married man from Jenin city. He lives in a small house with his wife and six children; four sons and two daughters. For the past four years, Qaher has been working in his own sewing workshop where he sews different kinds of clothing. It is a profitable job and earns a good income. 

He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy two new sewing machines for his workshop. This will increase his productivity and also his income. 

Qaher appears in the photo in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines for his sewing workshop.

loans.name: Celestiner

texts.en:
Celestiner lives in the Kilifi area which is north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is 26 years old and she is a single business lady. She has been operating a retail shop for more that five years now and the business is growing. She started the business from her personal savings. She knew about Milango through friends and she joined so that she could save and be able to access credit to fund her business. 

She now seeks a loan to buy ten bundles of maize flour and seven sacks of maize to sell in her shop. She hopes that in the next ten years she will open more branches of her business. The extra income that she will raise will help her to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy ten bundles of maize flour and seven sacks of maize.

loans.name: Mofeed

texts.en:
Mofeed is a 29-year-old single man from Attel, a small village near Tulkarem city. 

For the past three years, Mofeed has been working in his farm where he raises chickens to sell its' meat in the local market. It is a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement. 

Mofeed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more feed and chicks for his farm. This will increase his productivity, and  also his income. 

Mofeed appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more feed and chicks for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 20 bags of tea leaves

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 37 years old, and she is married and blessed with two children. Her two children attend school. 

For more than five years now, she has been selling clothes at a shop in town. This is the only business that she does. She has ambitions of expanding the business in the next five years, despite the challenges of debts, transportation costs, and the rent charges. 

She learned of Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy childrens clothes, and ladies and mens wear. The income that she will raise will improve her living standards, and educate her children as well.

loans.use: to buy childrens clothes, and ladies and mens wear.

loans.name: Emeldah

texts.en:
Emeldah lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 53 years old, and she is a business lady. 

For the more than five years, she has been selling soap and other detergents and this is the business that has been feeding her and her family. 

She learned of Milango through friends, and she decided to join so that she can save and access credit. 

She now seeks a loan to buy soap and detergents to sell. The extra income that she will raise will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy soap and detergents

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es: Rosa Estela de 34 años de edad, habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus cuatros hijos todos menores de edad. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser emprendedora y perseverante.  Actualmente trabaja en un proyecto de limpieza y pintura de su comunidad, que la municipalidad le remunera por horas trabajadas. Su necesidad inmediata es arreglar el corredor de la parte de atrás de su casa y construirle un pasamano; es por esa razón que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo que le permita comprar materiales de construcción como láminas galvanizadas, cemento, ladrillos entre otros. Espera lo antes posible iniciar con la construcción.
texts.en:
Rosa Estela is a 34-year old woman who lives with her life partner and their four minor children. She is a very hard-working person who has always been very determined and has an entrepreneurial spirit. She currently works in a cleaning and painting project in her community and gets compensated by the municipality for the hours worked. 

Her most urgent need is to fix the corridor in the rear of her house and to build a banister. She is requesting a loan with FUSAI to buy construction materials, such as galvanized layers, cement and bricks, among others. She expects the construction to start as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized layers, cement and bricks, among others.
